The game itself is one of the best out there. From various game modes to absolutely different strategies, everything that you love and hate. It's an excellent place to spend time with your friends competing with each one or playing modes like death run or hide and seek. There are plenty of community servers and workshop maps. Whatever you want, you'll find that there. However, when it comes to official matchmaking, surely you'll be disappointed. The Trust Factor system will do its best to make your gameplay the worst possible. You will engage an endless amount of cheaters who disgust your game and waste your time. The VAC anti-cheat is something that game developers need to work on!

Wonderful game! The game takes place in 1930, when Nancy Drew visits her friend Emily, at the Lilac Inn...there Nancy encounters her first mystery, and becomes the detective we know and love. :)  I enjoyed this game enormously. The dialogue is solid and the voice acting is less wonky than in other games. The characters have fluid movement, and the game featured more cut-scenes than in other titles. There's history woven into the story too, and the setting is immersive - you'll believe you're actually with Nancy in the 30's!  The puzzles were on the easier side as well, esp. if you're playing on Junior Detective mode. One of the harder puzzles, at least for me, was the logic test, and the answers were sprinkled throughout the game. You can call Bess and George for hints too, or refer to your notebook (this title doesn't have the answers listed like the newer games, but it does provide helpful hints, and clues).  This does make the game feel shorter - for most Nancy Drew games, I finish them in 8-9 hours. I finished this in just under 6. (I still feel like it's worth the price, with how entertaining the story itself was.)  This is one of the older titles in the Nancy Drew series (released in 2005) and it does require a bit of patience to play. Some of the screens load slowly, and the dialogue sometimes carried through to the next scene. Nor does the game always react when you click on something; making you click on it more than once.  The graphics are rough at times, especially with certain characters like Uri, the cat (Dobby, is that you?). However, this game was so much fun to play, especially if you've played older Nancy Drew games, like Blackmoor Manor or the Haunted Carousel. This game is best for people who love Nancy Drew already, though it's worth a go either way. :)

I can see the logic behind the negative reviews. This game is not for everyone. It requires patience, reflexes and somewhat grinding for achievements - therefore the items.  Now if you are not a fan of rogue-like, action genre, this game wouldn't be the best match for you. If you are, however and want to have some fun, this game suits your needs perfectly. I will start with saying that the game is really hard. This doesn't make the game frustrating though. After you get the grasp of the mechanics and familiar with the items, it will be only a matter of time to finish the game.  David Bowie (RIP) is a playable character in this game (Though I don't think he would appreciate the choice of soundtrack.).  Gameplay is fast-paced. That means there will be times you won't even understand how you died or took massive amount of damage. So never rely on your health being full. You always need to be alert and keep your reflexes up because the ways to die in this game are just too many. Like most of the rogue-like dungeon crawlers, RNG factor is significant. Game has six different characters with a huge item pool. There are many things that could make reaching the end a piece of cake. You can get the most OP items on the first floors, you can pray to RNG gods and get some ridiculous stats with the passive items,  you can find the boss room without too much wandering around the rooms and these thing also could make the runs really hard vica-versa.   Simple, pixelated, yet colorful graphics makes the game charming and kind of fits the style of the game itself, in my opinion.  Music is... well, it is dubstep. Depends on your approach to electro music. Although I don't like dubstep myself, it fits the fast-paced theme and makes you randomly jump and shoot to everyone and everywhere, because the groove is real.  Gameplay: 8/10 Graphics 7/10 Music: 7/10 Replay value: 9/10 Overall: 7.5/10, a good game for dungeon crawler or dubstep fans.

Where should I begin, I love this game. Eversince it was on   I played it a lot played from the start when curse of osiris came around and stayed even tho this update was not the greatest. But when Forsaken launched this game change so much all the new content they added is just amazing. If you need a kind of grindy but fun multiplayer game this is for you. If you ever get bored of killing enemies i flashy ways with many different weapons you can try your hand on some raids with your friends. Unique settings and story together with special mechanics for each raid makes them so much fun to figure out and play. I recommend playing raids without a tutorial so you can expirience finding out about how you can damage the boss or why you died after a few seconds for yourself. All in all this is an amazing game and I hope it has many great years to follow.

Eres Jacob Reeves,un hombre que debido a problemas que se desconocen,decide suicidarse.Despues de esto,te despiertas en un lugar misterioso y oscuro donde tendras que averiguar que haces ahi y recuperar tus recuerdos. Es un juego de terror psicologico,en el cual alternas fases de exploracion hablando con la gente y descubriendo la historia y fases de miedo escapando de monstruos y resolviendo puzzles.La musica y los efectos de sonido estan muy logrados y hacen que te sumergas mas aun en el juego.La historia y el misterio que la rodea te enganchara hasta el final.No me esperaba mucho de este juego indie y me ha sorprendido gratamente.

I'm usually not a big of survival and crafting games, but Subnautica is something else. It's immersive and compelling, with a story that actually drives you keep exploring and keeping crafting better gear. The creatures, the enviroment and the sound design are all amazing. This game gave me actual goosebumps more than once. I can't name another title that's done that. It does have some technical glitches and performance issues here and there. But I still thoroughly enjoyed every minute I spent in the water. I highly recommend Subnautica, even at full price. If you can get it at a discount, buy it right away.

Counter Strike : Global Offensive is yet the next installment of the Counter Strike Series. It's gameplay is very the same as the old Games. Whats New in Counter Strike : Global Offensive is the New Server System, when joining a Server you can either use the old fashioned Server Browser or the New System, that automatically searches A random game for you in a game Mode you want to Play. You can choose between "Deatchmatch Mode, Arms Race Mode, Demolition Mode in the Classic Menu you can Choose between "Defuse Mission and Hostage Mission (when you have bought the Operation Payback Pass you can choose these maps aswell).  Whats new too is, that you can create a Lobby out of Friends where you can set the gamemmode and some advanced settings. Then the game searches for a Server and you can play with your friends without owning a own Server. â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜… 5/5 Stars + New Features inside of the game. + Arms-Race Mode + Deathmatch Mode + Demolition Mode.

Wie man anhand meiner Spielzeit erkennen kann, mag ich dieses Spiel. Ich hab bisher nur die Hauptstory gespielt und bin damit gut mit der Spielmechanik vertraut geworden. Nach ein paar Stunden ist diese abgeschlossen und man kann sich direkt im freien Spiel zwischen erkunden, Missionsabschluessen, Handel oder Stationsbau entscheiden oder alles gleichzeitig anpacken. Das Spiel nimmt einen nur bedingt an die Hand, sodass man in der EnzyklopÃ¤die, in Foren und im Wiki stÃ¶bern sollte, wenn man nicht weiter kommt. Es handelt sich um eine Scifi-simulation mit Elementen des Stationsbaus und Handelsstrategie. Ich betone das ich erst ab ver.4.0. begonnen habe zu spielen und damit das jetzige Format vor Augen habe. Das Wandern auf Stationen ist nicht so wichtig fuer mich, dennoch finde ich dies in Anbetracht das dies ein Novum der Reihe ist, recht gelungen. Das Smalltalksystem ist eine gute Idee und das Erwerben der BefÃ¶rderungen integriert den Stationsbesuch als etwas Nuetzliches. Ich mÃ¶chte keine Vergleiche zu den anderen Spielen der Reihe anstellen, da es sich bei X-Rebirth um eine ZÃ¤sur handelt. PersÃ¶nlich kann ich das Spiel fÃ¼r alle empfehlen, die gern etwas lÃ¤nger in ein Aufbauspiel der Scifi-klasse eintauchen wollen und damit die Geduld aufbringen, sich mit dem komplexen System auseinanderzusetzen. Dennoch wird durch die Highways der Spielverlauf auf Wunsch beschleunigt und kann mit Fokus auf eine reine Erkundungsspielweise ebenfalls reizen.  findest du mehr Reviews von anderen Spielern.  kÃ¶nnt ihr auch dem Kurator folgen.

Well, now that I've achieved all achievements I feel that I should contribute and review this game! This is the first time I've played a game like this and it was actually a pretty good experience overall, especially since this game was Free-to-Play!  The first thing I noticed and liked about this game was how it has full voice acting! The voices seemed to portray the characters in the game pretty well and provided the player with an immersive experience. But even though overall the voices were a pro for me, there were times when I felt the voices got excessive and annoying but I learned that it can be countered by just disabling the feature or just clicking through the dialogue. Another thing I loved about the game was how each "romance target" had a different story to tell. There were some overlays in history between the Demon Brothers but overall they each had different reasons for doing the things they did. Also great background music! I found the music pretty catchy in this game (especially the ringtone). Some things I did not like as much was some of the art, how some parts of the story didn't go into enough detail, and the repetitiveness. Well the characters seemed slightly disproportionate and there were some people in the game that I thought looked like a mutant (the teacher) but I didn't expect too much out of a Free-to-Play game. The creator of the game provided a lot of cut scene art though so even though it wasn't amazing, it still provided players with a source of visual aid for the verbal descriptions and dialogue. So even though not great, still better than nothing at all. Also I felt like the story had the potential to become something better but because of the objective of the game (seduce everybody), everything was just glossed over and never really dug into. I mean at times I just felt information was shot at me and that I never really had the chance to digest it. If the creators went more in depth and explained some of the story, I felt the game would have been even better (I learned there was a sequel so its possible that they'll go more indepth on the story then). Last thing I thought was a con was the repetitiveness of the game. It is kind of to be expected since most of the individual characters' plots touch upon others but I still can't help but find it tedious to read the same thing over and over and over (I'm talking about the parts that aren't skippable but are still the same for almost all the characters (like the pre-ending dialogue.) Overall Pros: FREE! Voice acting included Background music Interesting story Cons: Some of the art Not going indepth on story Repetitiveness Yup~ I would definitely recommend this game to people who are fans of female dating sims, especially since its free. Though there were cons, I felt that they weren't major enough to detract from the game. I was still able to enjoy it when I played through all the routes. Oh yeah! This game has male and female romance targets and not just all-male or all-female so people with different preferences can still enjoy the game.
Good game ! :)

Pretty addicting if you're into asymmetrical multiplayers. Seems fairly balanced too.

What can I say? Its a great game, regardless if its in early access! I played 18 hours in two days! Pros: 1. 3D Factorio. If you don't know Factorio, shame! Conveyor belts, automation, build bigger to build bigger! The third dimension takes some getting used to but opens up so many possibilities.  2. Graphic style is unique and superb! 3. The music score is really good. I could listen to the sound tracks the entire time, I didn't need to mute the audio. 4. Addictive! There is always something else to do. I wanted to stop playing about 830pm for dinner. It was 1030pm before I knew it. 5. Responsive developer. The developer posts a lot on the forum and updates have been released frequently. 6. So many different resources and resource chains. 7. Freedom to try any build: You can delete structures and get 100% of your resources back. Experiment! 8. You can build anywhere on the map from the beginning. There are no power poles, areas of influence, or other such things. 9. Map can be infinite, if you want it to be. Resources are plentiful though. 10. Not a single crash, game stopping bug, or situation where I was stuck. In 18 hours. Over 2 days. Cons: 1. No "threat": You cannot lose in any way. This is very minor, and if all you want to do is build then it does not even matter. 2. Still EA, and things are no doubt going to change.  3. Some mechanics are not clear at all. Does the market sell to houses or does it consume product itself? 4. Resources can be too plentiful. Despite an infinite map, there is little need to push outside of your starting area. There are some surprises out there I won't spoil but you don't need the actual resources until really late game. 5. Addictive! Yeah, its a pro and a con. Best set alarms if you have something to do! Overall, you should buy this game immediately! There is no reason whatsoever to not be enjoying this from this moment! Don't wait until EA is done.

I am absolutely terrified of the ocean and this game doesn't help. However, it's so immersive and truly survival based- I love it. Still gonna scream when I see a shark in the ocean, but that's part of the game. The Devs are constantly working on updates for the better and I haven't had many complaints- minus changing the raft and menu mechanics- which are still really good for a game like this.

I really like the Echoes of the Fey series and this is a nice sequel to the series. Solve cases as the fiery Sofya, get in and out of trouble, and maybe find a little romance along the way. In this VN/Point and Click adventure, they've added a new in-game board game that plays a lot like D&D. I enjoyed the extra gameplay factor, I like seeing how different characters played the dungeon master. +Pros+ +Main character: I love, love Sofya. She's flawed, reckless, and has major impulse control problems, but she is also very compassionate and can be insightful and intelligent. She's a fighter but her moments of vulnerability just absolutely endear her to me. I want her to grow and mature in some ways, but I mostly want to see her be truly and honestly happy. +Characters and plotlines: the characters are all interesting, believable individuals and the plotlines are intertwining, mysterious, magical, and exciting, I can't go into too much depth due to spoilers but the plot is clearly well thought out and the lore is interesting. +Voice Actors: the voice acting in the game is pretty good, but the gag reel you unlock after completing an ending is laugh-out-loud hilarious! I just about died laughing while listening to "Sofya and Friends Eff up" (yes that's the name). +Minigames: I liked the in-game board game, it can get tedious but for the most part I had fun with it. +Plenty of save slots +Acheivements -Cons- -Sometimes, I wish I could skip the board game, it could be slow sometimes and though I like it, it would be nice to be able to skip it if you wanted -I did come across a graphical error where the characters were blurry, but changing the texture setting to medium fixed that. -The art style may not be everyone's cup of tea at first, but it grows on you. I really like this series and the characters, it's an interesting adventure and I can't wait to see where they go from here. I believe that there is a lot more that could be done in this series and I don't think we've seen the last of Sofya and friends, at least I hope not!

Black Book Prologue is a dark, mysterious, wondrously poetic RPG set in the world of slavic folklore and mythology. Endlessly original, armed with layers upon layers of intricate lore and backstory, Black Book Prologue tells only a small part of the life and deeds of a young witch Vasilisa as she's trying to learn to control the ominous Black Book, an endless compendium of the dark arts, meant only for those who are worthy enough. The writing is interesting, I don't know if it's the translation issue from Russian, but the dialogue comes a bit archaic, cryptic and delightfully lyrical. It is a leagues better translation than the original Pathologic got, but there are some sentences that come off as instantly quotable, but bearing little sense if you think about it. The graphics and music/sound are very impressive for an indie game. Every level is brimming with small details and grand set pieces, and thanks to the static camera most locations look like pastel paintings. Humans in the game, including Vasilisa on the other hand look a bit drab and lacking of enough details to give out their emotions. The gameplay is based on choosing what Vasilisa will do in every major and minor quest that will have long-lasting implications for the story and her ultimate fate. The other part of the gameplay is the Black Book that contains a pool of random spell cards akin to Hearthstone you call upon to aid you in combat. You can learn new pages and spell-cards of the Black Book when you fight other beasts and meet other characters in the game. This card-building part of the game is simple enough, but it appears to be way too staightforward thus sacrificing (no pun intended) your strategic choices for the sake of brevity and simplicity. The entire demo lasts for an hour and it left a very positive impression on me so far, I'm really looking what sights full game of the Black Book will show us!

10/10 Have a talking Orca named Halo as a crew member. In all seriousness the game is not the end all be all of games, but it is certainly worth your time for a night on the town to see if you'd like to stay. Gameplay Preface this reveiw with the knowledge that I'm a PvE/Co-op only scrub so I won't be talking about the actual multiplayer. The Co-op is laid out and plays the same way as the actual multiplayer though, so I feel confident enough to write this review.  The game in essence is a MOBA esque star ship them up. There are five seperate sectors that you have to "jump" between where the game plays out in. There are the two main bases from which each team will set out that is guarded by some, actually rather vicious, AI flakk turrets. There are two side sectors where most of the combat takes place. There are five capture points in each, the last one of each gives access to their respective base and the three inbetween gives points that go towards upgrading your ships. Finally there is a middle sector that gets activated periodically throughout the game which gives a large combat buff when captured. This may not seem like much, but with all "Hero" games, the depth of the game is found in the avatars that players use to interact in game. The ships are one of if not the strongest aspect of this game. Each one is unique and has a different playstyle. They all look different, but they are internally consistent with the three ship companies found in the game. There are ships for about every playstyle you could think of and some you didn't think of. Shipborne plasma flamethrowers anyone? My personal favorite happens to be the Leviathan which has a very large and dangerous beam weapon with one of the most satisfying firing sounds I've ever heard in a video game. There is a new PvE horde mode, that while I'd love to comment more on it, I've crashed multiple times during the matches and haven't been able to actually finish one. Although I must give props to the developers for a really good reconnect system that acts fast and is the first thing you see when you log back in. There is the normal problem of these free to play games that it takes quite a while to get new ships/vehicles/tanks/ect. However, this game does its best to alleviate that problem. There are events where you can get ships, they have a free rotation where anyone can sail the ships that are in it, AND you can test drive every single ship in the game. Makes grinding for somethig less painful when you can sail it around on the test firing range occasionaly when you want to remind yourself why you want to get it. Graphics The game looks great even on my lemon wired to a potato. The partical effects look awesome and each ships has it's own looks when it fires its weapons. There are serveral very nice looking maps that get used for the sectors with capture points in them. Towering alien looking pylons floating in space, a field of icy asteroids, and others make a very nice backdrop and arena to fight in. I would really like a few more but I'm a huge nerd for space and just want more from other space games until I can get Elite Dangerous to work better on my computer. "Technicals" While I'm not much of a tech geek, I can tell you that you'll need atleast a moderately powerful computer to run this game at the graphics it deserves. The graphic designers obviously put a lot of love into the game and I think it shows. Sadly the game has started chrashing on me fairly regularly, but that may just be my computer so take that with a grain of salt. Conclusion I think the game is hovering around a 7.5/10 as it is right now for me. The graphics are great, the gameplay is not exceptional but it's fun enough to loose yourself in, the diversity among the ships is excellent, but I do think that some of the technical issues hold back my enjoyment. Although the fact that when It does crash my brain goes, "Damn it, I have to get back in as fast as I can!" speaks well of the game. If/when I get a better computer I'll come back to this review and if the issues have stopped, I'd probably bump up the score to an 8.5/10.

For everyone else, this is a MUST BUY to have in your stable of massively multiplayer FPS games. It has a solid, hardcore foundation that will keep you engaged for hours. For others returning to the series, it still has the trademarked/standard   and ass-kicking weapons.  Insurgency has some of the best gun mechanics and map design on the market. It takes itself more seriously than Rainbow 6: Siege, and is similar in it's commitment to pseudo-authentic gunplay and tactical engagements. It has a range of fast paced, quick-respawn modes that pair it's lethal (1-2 shot kill) weapon design (based on real world weapons) with medium-sized, well designed maps featuring objective based match-ups. It also has a fantastic co-op mode (against AI). It's a blast.  The unfortunate consequence of this is that those are the only modes people play.  For those looking for a level of strategy on-top of this excellent platform, you'll have to stick with R6: Siege for now. I'm talking specifically about the   mode, which decreases the map size, giving each match a satisfying strategic layer (holding your point, taking lanes, making plays) and gives you limitations on respawning (making every engagement count). It's one of the only popular games in town that can scratch that particular itch, but the developers have, so far, failed to attract an audience for it.  There are competitive communities who play this mode, but the barrier to entry is very high (you'll get your ass kicked if you don't play regularly). There have been pretty much zero casual Firefight matches available during the times I've played.  This game had some awful issues at launch (terrible performance, limited maps/modes) that have since been fixed. If their previous Insurgency is any indication, this game has yet to see it's prime (Insurgency 1 spiked way after launch). The level of commitment New World Interactive shows their games is laudable.  + Awesome weapons and authentic feeling gunplay + Decent selection of weapons and load-outs + Interesting take on loadout weight x speed (the more you take, the slower you go) + Great map design/diversity + Stable multiplayer-base + Great co-op mode + Developer commitment - No interest in casual Firefight mode (that is the only reason I personally play this series)

Mystery Hotel - Hidden Object Detective Game: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  Here you are in your train compartment on your way to the quiet and picturesque Hotel Noir somewhere in Western Europe. Your Grandmother has chosen this specific hotel to meet you as she has essential news to reveal about a family secret. You arrive at the Hotel and embrace your Grandmother and share a few words with her before going to your room to refresh yourself. A few hours later, your Grandmother is found dead in her room. What a strange coincidence; there is something fishy in the air, and itâ€™s not the velvety smell of the lobster bisque! Itâ€™s up to you to find out what happened to your Nana in Mystery Hotel â€“ Hidden Object Detective Game! Mystery Hotel - Hidden Object Detective Game is a casual/hidden object game developed and self-published by Crisp App Studio on the 17 of October 2020 on the Steam platform.  The game consists of 15 Hidden Object levels and some of them you will visit a couple of times throughout the story. There are also a couple of levels of Spot-the-Difference between two images and match the same objects. I really like the early 20th-century atmosphere in the game, and I must say that the developers have managed to cleverly conceal some objects in each level, which is what you want in this genre of game. Personally, I rarely use the hint button in these games, but I must confess that I used it more than twice in this title.  As you would expect from Crisp App Studio, Mystery Hotel has enough hidden objects to play each stage at least three times. Your goal in each level is to find the specific objects that are written at the bottom of the screen as fast as possible. As you find your first object on the image, youâ€™ll receive a certain number of points. Under the points, youâ€™ll have a gauge that will rapidly move from right to left. The trick is to make sure you find the second item, the next one and so on and so forth before the gauge goes all the way to the left. Each time you find an object, the gauge will fill up again, but deplete to the left straight away, and let me tell you, it will go to the left very fast. So, find all the objects in rapid succession, and you will score highly! You may even be at the top of the game leader board.      There are collectables to gather in each of the stages and you can collect them by achieving a high score, playing the level a second time or by finding all objects before the time limit of 45 seconds. In terms of the story, itâ€™s decent; youâ€™ll meet a few characters, and youâ€™ll have a fairly good idea who has savagely killed your Nana!  Itâ€™s a typical point and click game with good graphics, accompanied by a piece of well-suited music. On the downside, it is a relatively short game. Positives: ~~~~~~~  +	Nice graphics  +	Decent Hidden Object levels +	Fun little story +	Achievements Negatives: ~~~~~~~~   -	No trading cards as yet -	Very short game Search each room of the Hotel Noir, discover clues and find your grandmother killer! 6/10 Key provided by the developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

I may have unknowingly snuck in a few subtle spoilers while spontaneously writing this, so heads up. This is the 3 episodic prequel to the award-winning title Life is Strangeâ„¢. Since I pre-ordered the standard edition several months back, I still need to wait for Episode 3 as of this review. Nevertheless, the first two episodes were enough to get me started.  The voice change didn't really bother me as much further into the game (you get used to it) but I still felt it didn't give the same personality to these characters. At times, it somewhat made the dialogue kind of awkward (or maybe it's just Chloe's weird sense of humour). I like how they changed the way you select options in-game like - Look, Select, Graffiti with the WASD keys instead of dragging your mouse. I found the "dragging" in the first game confusing and quite a hassle in the beginning. There are technical difficulties in this game where in some instances - subtitles were left to repeat, glitches in sound and the occassional bugs. Hopefully future patches will fix all of this. Nevertheless, I am glad this prequel was made. One of my biggest curiosities (as well as many others) in the first game was the history between Rachel and Chloe. We really dive into their relationship in this game and here we can see first-hand why the loss of Rachel in the first game was a devastating one to Chloe. Apart from this, it really is wonderful to see the other characters in their younger years too. An insight to the Blackwell before Max came back.  The biggest change (in my opinion) was the removal of the time-travel element. In the first game, this was a luxury given to us in the role of Max. Whenever we come face to face with a choice (important or not), we can simply rewind if we didn't like the choice we've made. In this game, Chloe (obviously) doesn't have that power. This means every choice you make is a more permanent one. This isn't necessarily a bad thing either. It makes us more wary of the choices we make and the consequences our choices hold. Which I feel ultimately makes the game more exciting.  It is not a 'Life is Strange' game without the constant ride of emotions. This game so far, reminds us what makes the first game great. Here, we are Chloe. We see first-hand how her problems affect her. Sometimes from the choices we are given, non of it are good ones. We can see step-by-step how she changed to the Chloe we know in the first game. Even her main ability is non-other than 'back talking' (which I find hilarious).  Even though Episode 3 hasn't come out yet, I am confident enough to say that this is a game worth playing.

Imagine a Zelda game that relies less on the tools received and more on the combat aspects; thatâ€™s Darksiders 2 in a nutshell. Inside that shell is a quest as lengthy as it is hack-n-slash thatâ€™ll have Death traversing heaven, hell, and everything in-between. Players new to the series do not have to play the original Darksiders in order to understand the plot as this game is a parallel. This game is worth the buy when it goes on sale, and I encourage all who are interested to give it a shot when it is cheaper. Please keep the following in mind: -The game suffers from simpler puzzles that intermediate to advanced gamers will understand off-the-bat or with a little forethought. This can lead to dungeons being tedious at times. Tools are upgraded through the gameâ€™s progression to keep dungeons interesting and some serve combat purposes. -Be sure to speak to NPCs as they will have side-quests for you that the world map will not alert you of. -Most loot gathered from chests will not serve their primary purpose, but instead help to build potentially amazing weapons later on. Donâ€™t sell your earnings absent-mindedly! All weapons and armor in the game are appealing to the eye. -The game occasionally mistakes exploration in dungeons and open areas as â€œLook behind every corner for hidden goodies,â€ and it can be frustrating knowing behind the one unchecked pillar, there is a token to assist in buying great items. Always check the water for more tokens. -Combat is potentially interesting, but most enemies can be brought down with brute force.  -Minor screen stuttering issues (but these can be readily fixed and without hassle, thereâ€™s even a great thread in the Steam Forums for this game that has a fix). 7/10

This remake right here exceeded all of my expectations, I enjoyed every little bit of this remake had to offer. When they first announced that this was getting a remake, I screamed like a little girl lmao bc this was a game I grew up playing and it was finally getting a remake I was hoping it to get. Hangar 13 truly knocked this one out of the park, this is how a remake should be, I mean sure not everything from the 2002 game wasn't included in the remake but either way it didn't bother me one way or another and I very much enjoyed the game and hope it atleast gets some mini dlcs, or atleast continue to pump out updates for free ride. Long story short I absolutely adore this remake even tho it's had its fair share of hiccups and whatnot, so if you loved the original game and have been wanting a  remake of it for the longest, my answer is yes definitely go out and buy this masterpiece I promise you won't be disappointed. I mean you kinda will be once you notice some stuff is missing, but don't let that distract you that they definitely capitalized on this remake, a job well done Hangar 13.

Game Good It Halo

At first glance the game is wonderfull. it has an intuitive interface, multiplayer ( ), interesting landscapes and more. The game sets you off with a settler and a warrior. You start off on turn 1, enable automatic turn end and suddenly its 4 am and you are at war with three nations. Very time consuming, hence every other review including mine starting with "Just one more turn". The game is heavily dependant on microtransactions to be enjoyable. Not every DLC is expensive but if you want to experience the full Civilization experience, you are going to thank yourself for buying the DLC's.

This was surprising. And to be quick about saying so, I want more, and I want this to become the Norm. Basically it's Devolver Digital's own private E3, with subtle stealth mechanics (Nothing more than 'don't get seen, shoot to stun).  It showed off a bunch of games and their trailers in really pretty private environments with minimalistic game elements. Almost no hud other than 'do this'. No hand-holding. It was fun to explore this little area and had a really neat conclusion.  There's not much to say because there isn't much to this game. It's a proof of concept. You can make interactive and fun versions of E3 without all the horrible things that come with E3. I liked this a lot. Give it a try. It's free, you'll see some neat games and entertaining things. I hope to see more of this style from other companies too.

Old school but still awesome! There is no game out there which gives you the same feeling WE NEED A PS 3!!!

I only put about five hours into it, so I'm sure there's plenty of stuff I haven't seen/done yet. First off, this is one of those odd European simulation games. You're a car mechanic. You fix cars. No jetpacks, no fire breathing dragons, no guns. At the start you're dropped into your garage. There's no tutorial. Occasionally when you look at a menu, or try something out there will be a brief tooltip about what that particular feature does. This can hamper your enjoyment. For example I spent a good 15 minutes trying to figure out how to order parts. I should have seen the obvious, that you use your computer to search for, then order parts. Makes perfect sense in retrospect. But, you say, how is the repair portion? You know, the actual meat of the game! At first, everything is deeply confusing. First, you look at the repair order. In the beginning it tells you what parts need to be replaced. You go over, select the proper view mode, and start clicking on parts. In one mode, parts can be inspected. In another mode you can disassemble parts. In another you reassemble. So, basically it goes, find the problem, remove bits until you can remove the problem part, replace and reassemble. Later more difficult jobs appear, that give you a general idea of the problem, and you need to search for the bad parts yourself. Eventually you wind up doing bodywork as well as other repairs. Also there is a point where you can buy, repair and resell cars, but I haven't gotten to that point yet.  The layout of parts is somewhat simplified. There isn't any wiring that I've seen so far, and I haven't had an interior job yet. These things may happen later though. As you do more jobs, you gain experience. This allows you to have access to more tools, more in depth jobs, and different kinds of cars to work on. I'd say I'd recommend the game. It's oddly calming and soothing, while at the same time providing an interesting challenge. It does have a demo, so if you're interested, try it out!

REVIEW: I love RWBY a LOT! I am a really big fan when it comes to RWBY but I will not keep that to  this review, I shall make this fair for all of you who are debating this game. But before I do, If you are a big fan of the series: - Buy it, you will enjoy the hell out of it Now this game I believe is Rooster Teeth's first game (Don't quote me) and it is amazing!  The game is a hack and slash game with MOBA leveling like elements. You can play between 4 characters (So far, DLC maybe?) Ruby, Weiss, Blake, and Yang. Now I shall run this down in Characters to play roles: Ruby: Fast hitter, combo heavy Weiss: Swift Movement, Accuracy Blake: Moderate Play, tactical Yang: Hit everything Now this game features Levels and is a MULTIPLAYER GAME, I would Highly reccomend a controller. NOW HERE IT COMES: {PROS}: - Fast gameplay - Beautiful World - RWBY references to show - Easy controls - Fun to play with friends - Reasonably prices [CONS]: - no 4 pack (yet, probably will be after Early Access) - Only 4 players (Hopefully JNPR or CFVY will be added) - no single player That's my review for now, So I reccomend this game totally! And My rating will be 8 Queens of the Castle/ 10 Queens of the Castle

This game is amazing. Everything about this game is amazing. It needs work on optimization and performance, but I know it'll be worked it. It's still day one. I have been playing in non-stop. Edit: At 90 hours, I got my first crash, after that and all, I got maybe two more but it wasn't that much of a big deal since I was almost done with the main story. This is one of the best games I've ever played and I recommend it wholeheartedly. Edit: As I finished the game, I was so upset it was over, although, I am in love with this game. Hopefully they release the second on PC, but I'm thinking of getting it on PS5 either way. I love this series, thanks Sony and Guerilla for letting us PC gamers experience this masterpiece of a game.

Garry's Mod ist ein Spiel, das sich ein seiner Spielweise von anderen unterscheidet. Hier werden den Nutzern keine festgelegten Ziele vorgesetzt, sondern werden den Spielern selbst Ã¼berlassen. In Verbindung mit  Valve Spielen wie Counter-Strike Source oder Half Life und dem Steam-Workshop werden einem keine Grenzen mehr gesetzt, wodurch man beim jedem spielen neue interessante Neuerungen entdeckt.  Garry's Mod ist in meinem Augen ein All-in-One Spiel, weshalb dies eines meiner einzig gespielten Spiele auf Steam ist. Fazit: Kaufempfehlung!

Mirror's Edge es un juego que gira en la trama de una sociedad corrupta de la cual los 'runners' estan en contra y tratan de cambiar. El personaje principal se llama Faith, una runner que trata de demostrar la inocencia de su hermana en un asesinato. En la busqueda de su objetivo Faith tiene que buscar pruebas y evidencia. Debido a esto hay varias escenas de accion, parkour y ciertas partes del juego que se considerarian puzzle debido a que hay que estudiar un poco el entorno para saber que es el siguiente paso que el jugador debe hacer. El juego en si a pesar de sus cinematicas y puzzles ;es un juego bastante dinamico al que no le encontre muchos bugs o fallas. Ademas, su jugabilidad no es muy compleja y es adaptable al jugar promedio lo que lo hace un buen juego para entretenerse cuando hay tiempo libre. Todo esto agregado al tiempo para completarlo lo hace un juego perfecto para el publico en general. En resumen un juego simple que vale la pena probar 100% recomendado.

Let me start off by saying, I was very skeptical of purchasing this game at first. The reason? I had played the original Shantae on the Gameboy Color when I was younger and wasn't too big a fan of it, however I pushed on and tried out this game and I honestly have no regrets with my purchase at all. This game felt like an honest masterpiece to me and I enjoyed playing through the game multiple times. It has a great design with the sprites and art work, great music, great storyline and characters. Was just interesting to me overall and felt pretty close to a Metroid type game, which I love seeing as I've been a Metroid nerd ever since I was younger (Metroid Prime 4 and Super Metroid HD pls.) Anyways, besides that, let's get into it! The developers did a very great job on this game, even consider it one of my favorites. They kept the simple, yet fun of old school platforming games, kept the music pretty close, kept the sprites pretty close and the game in general. They have some interesting wordplay and character development in the story that gives some of the characters their own unique personality as you go along with it. As I stated above and other have stated, keeps a very close resemblance to Metroid, Zelda, Castlevania type games. With there being collectibles and power ups to collect throughout the game, some of which you can get from the start, with the rest being able to collect as you continue on with the game and get more special abilities. Ways to increase life, items to heal health and restore magic and save rooms and certain parts of the world. There is even a different costume when you beat the game, which in a way changes your playstyle as now you take more damage, but use less magic, so where you might be able to sit around and take a few hits, now become a risk, and I love that they made that type of challenge to the game. Gameplay wise is a little on the short side, about 4, maybe 5 hours worth, however, it's a story that is great, regardless of it's time. You can take it slow or speed run the game, which again, am a great fan of games that offer the option to speed run without affecting the game too much. The controls are pretty easy to get used to, can even use a controller if you wish to play with that. They didn't feel sluggish, clumpy or anything to me, instead felt pretty smooth after I was use to everything. One quick tip that a lot of people have seemed to ask, if you want this in fullscreen, go to options, set the resolution to your monitor size, then press ALT+Enter to keep it true fullscreen. One thing I liked in particular was how as you progress through the game, enemies from their "natural area" will start to move more closer to the lands surrounding Scuttle Town, was a pretty neat idea in my opinion, making things have a smaller challenge with their being newer enemies on the paths that you normally would just breeze right past no problem. The bosses and their dungeons were pretty interesting, with them ranging from time trials, to puzzles to solve, all were very well executed in how they were played out with. The boss fights alone, are pretty good as well. Some of them you have to take somewhat slow so you don't rush head on and risk getting hit, where as some you can just full out attack and dodge when it's needed. The characters are some of those characters that you "grow" a little with through your adventure, from getting closer to them, to knowing what they're about, some secrets, and a few other things you will see while playing through it. -Shantae: Can be a little arrogant at times, yet as you continue on with the game, she learns that she will need help down the road and not to push such things away -Risky Boots: sarcastic, taunting, antagonist who is always causing trouble in the story, still keeps up her taunting even if things don't go her way. -Sky: At first looks, seems to be a little hard headed alongside Shantae, but then it's noticeable that she's just trying to help out however she can. -Mimic: (for some reason, he reminded me of Lord Crump from Paper Mario: The Thousand Year Door.) Uncle of Shantae who is a Relic Hunter, who knows a few things which he apparently keeps a secret from you until it's basically forced from him. -Rottytops: Taunting friend of Shantae who helps you along the way while still seeming like an enemy (I mean, she took a puppy and offered it to you to eat...) There's more you'll meet along the way as you continue on through the story. All in all, I'm very satisfied with my purchase, even if I was a little off putting from the start, due to me not being a huge fan of the original Shantae I had played on the Gameboy Color, but I'm glad I went ahead and bought the game. It's a game I very much enjoy and soon a series I think I'll continue to enjoy and stick around with for a while, seeing as there are two new games coming out, one for 3DS and Wii U (hopefully PC down the road) and another one coming out on all systems and PC. I look forward to playing both new games, glad the community is so supporting with the developers making their new games, seeing as they raised a lot with their kickstarter and I truly can't wait to try out their next game, seeing where the story takes off after Risky's Revenge!  10/10 Highly recommend giving it a shot!

What's there to say? It's GTA, Single player has a decent story, for the first time including 3 playable characters and as always, mods for those that want more. Online is a bit of a hit and miss. There are hackers, just like in every other online game, if he's not bothering you then you can keep doing your thing, otherwise simply switch to a different session (server), the events are plentiful and very well done. The money part and owning things are a bit tough as every is extremely overpriced so it's a bit of a grind. The best thing you can do is find a constant crew to play with or play with friends.

First of all, let me confess that I absolutely adore birds. So it's needless to say that this game has caught my eye. But I had no clue that the story that unveals behind this glorious art accompanied by beautiful classical tunes would be that good. What started as a nice investigative/courthouse adventure evolved in a full on political drama, with masterfully fleshed-out evolving characters which you come to love. Surprisingly solid and humorous writing makes this one of the best games I've played in years. Might be the best bird-themed game out there (yes, considerably better than Hatoful Boyfriend).

Pretty hardcore and realistic fps game. I like how the game takes place in the middle east and also mainly how combat works in this game. Guns are interesting and I really feel more intense gunfight than most other fps games I played before. Sadly it's dying (especially competitive which is the reason I didnt bother with it) and It actually deserves more players. There are also other realistic fps games that struggle with their active playerbase since realistic shooters are past time. I hope devs will adapt to this trend and surprise us with something that will help the series of the game. Still loved the game and had alot of fun 8/10

Walking around town one afternoon, I decided to head to a nearby shop and purchase a nice, fresh orange. As I left and continued down the street, I wondered about how it tasted, how much health it might restore, and whether I should've bought two or three. Just as I finished that thought, a group of thugs attacked me. Opting to do a heavy attack on the first one that charged me, I was both surprised, amused, and horrified as Kiryu shoved it into the thug's mouth, knocked him to the ground, and curbstomped the orange (still in his mouth), spreading juices onto the nearby citizens. After that, I made sure to always carry a few oranges with me. Just in case.
It's a hard game, but I love it!

I have been playing games almost my whole life (15+ years). I can honestly say this is one of the best games I have ever played and I will tell you why. I have had around 500 hours invested into this game across multiple platforms and playthroughs. (PC is the best version) First is the graphics, I've added mods but just the standard game is one of the best I've ever seen. The trees, grass, animals and the level of detail that the game includes is amazing! I literally spent about 4 hours the first day of its release back in 2011 just wandering through the world examining the different things in amazement at how detailed and beautiful it was. The second thing that makes this great is the commentary, it's all voiced and basically everyone can be spoken to in the game and everyone plays a part. (More on that later) Next is the content 100+ dungeons around 10 major cities and a few extra small towns there is much to see and explore I can honestly say through about 500 hours of gameplay I still can find new places or things I've somehow missed over the hours. Quests and random events are all throughout these places you will not run out of things to do (and if by some chance you do there are mods! haha). Now that being said most everyone in the game is "killable" and if you kill them it may stop a certain small side quest from being available. So you really have to make decisions wisely. Choices matter and if you don't watch yourself you can miss out. Which can hook you into another playthrough like I was. You can play mostly as a mage, as a sworded warrior, an archer or create something of your own it's all up to you! Now before I'm done I will add that the 3 DLC packs (Dawnguard, Hearthfire and Dragonborn) are all great additions. If you have the money buy the Lengendary Edition of the game it's worth it. Dawnguard adds some extra gameplay and features, Hearthfire add the ability to build your own home and adopt children (actually really cool additions) then Dragonborn adds a whole new questline and location to play on. They are all worth the money and you will not go wrong buying this game. Only minor things not even worth mentioning are problems in this game and I would not hesitate to give it a 99/100 easy. But as one final warning it is possible to lose yourself in this game. I've spent roughly 500 hours playing this one game and still far from laying it down. It can take your life and give you a virtual one (think with Hearthfire; home, wife, kids... A whole life!). It's an amazing game and I highly recommend you buy it.

THIS IS JUST A CUT AND PASTE OF MY REVIEW FROM THE "FREE" LIGHTMATTER STORE PAGE Lightmatter took me 9 hours to complete both endings and while I wasnâ€™t really satisfied with either ending, the journey to get there was a lot of fun.  Lightmatter isnâ€™t shy when it shows its love for Portal but it is really heavy on the mechanics from The Talos Principle.  Instead of jammers, youâ€™ve got spotlights and instead of connectors youâ€™ve got photon connectors.     So there you have Lightmatter.  Itâ€™s a pretty smart puzzler that has some great moments and uses Talos Principle mechanics but sticks to a more humourous Portal kind of story.  The games that it pays homage to are better though and I found Lightmatter to be on more of a Turing Test or Q.U.B.E. level of quality.    Definitely a thumbs up though and worth a play. Edit:  Developers came through quick on fixing the crashes as promised.  Also they continue to add minor fixes for visuals, controls and running the game.  They recently added a ton of directors commentary which is really great to listen to.  Thanks for this great game and your continued work on  it post launch.

This is not your usual Spiderweb game. Its an old school style RPG game for sure. However, its more of a Kingdom builder. What I really liked about this game is that there in no XP grind. You only get XP from doing quests. There are no respawns and the enemies give you nothing. The quests are basically related to building your empire. For instance, clearing out a mine in order get a steady supply of resources. As far as the story you are a prince or princess sent on a quest to reclaim your kingdom. You get to decide how that is done. There are plenty of critical choices that you must make to get to your own ending. You can become the tyrant, benevolent ruler, or somewhere in between. As I said itâ€™s a kingdom builder, but just when you think you know whatâ€™s going on the lore of the game kicks in. You suddenly find yourself in a cataclysm caused by mystical forces. I really enjoyed the story and kingdom building aspects. The combat however is something to be desired. Its dull, repetitive, and there is not even any combat, music. There is also no real interesting NPCs. You have a squad that goes with you and you get to build different characters, but they are lifeless. However, these minor setbacks do not detract from the story and kingdom building aspects of the game. To me this was like Greedfall 1988. A political story that you determine the outcome. Be sure to hang on to your code they give you at the end that will continue your choices for Queens wish 2. As far as the cost, itâ€™s a stretch to make it 20$. Its definitely worth its Steam sale price at 10$ for about 30-40 of gameplay.

Counter Strike Global Offensive a multiplayer first-person shooter video game developed by Hidden Path Entertainment and Valve Corporation. The benefits of a first person shooter is coordination. It helps to think and react in such situations like 1 v 4.  It improves coordination. Improves problem solving skills. It enhances the memory. Ang playing games is a great source of learning. CSGO also helps to improve social skills and communication, This helps players meet new friends while also strengthening bonds with their old friends.Though computer games might be beneficial, there is need to play them in moderation. It is also important to pick the right game as not all of them provide the same cognitive benefits. Age should also be a factor. Small children should not be exposed to violent games.

interesting game.. in the 14th machine war you can play as 2b which is an android built for battle!!! you can use the pod to use its state of the art machine gun on enemies... but their thick armor means you have to do most of the damage using your swords or fists or lance!!! (but dont worry, your pod gets powerful weapons too... like a laser... but it will still not be as strong as yourself) edit: i just found the missile attack after i switch pods (you must find this one), and also the blade pod program is very powerful against foes. I can't wait to see what more weapons there are to destroy my enemies later in the game.. small laser or pod program laser? upgrade your weapon and add chips to become stronger!! i recommend "deadly heal" which gives you a big percentage of health back after you defeat enemies, or its brother: "offensive heal", which gives back health as you damage the enemy. be sure to upgrade chips to up to +6 or even +8 for maximum power, and black diamond chips means the least weight. It is still the same fun as in the original Borderlands, but this version has a FOV slider and slightly improved graphics, but be warned that with this you may notice a negative performance impact. The only negative things I can say about this version are two: 1)	You may notice slight worse performance than with the original, especially with older systems.  2)	This version is VERY SENSITIVE to graphic card overclocking. When I play this game and my GPU is overclocked, sometimes the games freezes my computer and I need to do a hard reboot. You may need to dial down your overclock.

I've spent 1 hour playing and 1 hour waiting in queue. I know the issue is being fixed but it is something slightly annoying. After that one incident, I know which times are less busy which means no queue times. Better than Cube World overall, good and interesting classes. Fun game but recommended to play at certain times (for me, around 7:00pm) when queue times are almost nonexistent.

Ellegant, Straight(-ish) forward, and assumes I have enough of a brain to figure out simple mechanics. I come back to this short game to see if I can someday manage to get through it without a single mistake (hasn't happened yet!) The Ambience music is just that, pleasant but unobtrusive. At the full price (curently $0.99) it isn't unfair, in the old arcade glory days 4 quarters could last maybe as long as a single playthrough of this game if you were very good, and very lucky. I'd more recomend whatever bundle it is currently apart of, becuse if you like this, those games are likely to appeal too.

â€œStrataâ€ is a 2D puzzle game which players are asked to create the correct pattern using different colored ribbons. Its artistic textures create a soothing gameplay. The game starts with 2x2 tutorial puzzles. Tutorial is nice and easy to understand. It shows the player what his/her goal is, and how the ribbons are used.  In the puzzles, the player is given a set of different colored ribbons. These ribbons can be placed on rows or lines of the diagonal puzzle ground. Puzzle grounds have colors in intersection of rows and colors. As expected, when ribbons are placed on rows and lines, they intersect. Puzzle logic comes from this intersection. Whichever ribbon is placed later, its color occupies that intersection. Playersâ€™ goal is to create the same pattern on the puzzle ground. This game has a static logic for its puzzles. That means there are no new additions when player advances to later puzzles. Logic is always the same. Only things that change are size of the ground and number of the ribbonsâ€™ colors. Smallest puzzlesâ€™ grounds are 2x2 and largest ones are 6x6. If I calculated correctly there are 485 puzzles (excluding tutorials) separated into 7 sets and each set is separated further into 4 waves. It is worth noting that this static logic may be a deal breaker for some people. Puzzlesâ€™ difficulty is tricky to talk about. There is a trick to solve the puzzles. This trick can be used to solve even the most-complicated-looking-level. If player can figure it out then very few puzzles are challenging and rest is easy. So it is safe to say that unofficial puzzle goal in this game is to solve the trick. Levels can be considered as tools to figure it out. During my gameplay, I came across some minor bugs. These bugs did not affect actual puzzles; they were all in main menu. The game has a menu that resembles a navigation system instead of standard button menu. And this menu can sometimes act weird. Luckily the game can be restarted in a few seconds so even a restart doesnâ€™t make player loose anything. Regardless, they should be fixed. As a final note, games achievements are all easily achievable. So this is a good game to get a â€œperfect gameâ€ status if you are interested in such things.  The game has nice textures and uses pastel colors, which makes it easy on the eyes.  Art style and realistic instrument (piano, classic guitar and bell) notes that play after almost every player action create a relaxing environment.  Puzzle logic looks really unique.  Because this is a puzzle game, it is not necessarily a bad thing. Also it is a little expected. That said, using the same logic throughout the game results doing the exact same thing again and again.  The game has some minor bugs that donâ€™t affect actual puzzles. Still they should be fixed. It was nice to play a game that actually made me relaxed for a change. These kinds of games show that games are not all about action or achievements; so I recommend it. Still it is worth noting that this puzzle game is mostly recommended to people who care â€œsolving puzzlesâ€ more than which puzzles they solve, due to its static logic.

Creative platform for any age, user interface is simple and effective, builds are fast and easy. Since this is in early access i like to point out 2 things that surely needs to be looked at in this app: - Standard Grid Layout: as it is we have this triangle unsymmetrical looking layout which of course works but any designer or architecture starts the work on normal Grid Layout, so having the option of multiple grid layouts is very important since standard grid layout is the must for any designing app. - The building block templates are looking well designed and feels natural when u attach next block to previous one, but to have more block templates could add various perspectives, for example one option is modern era templates.

The game is sort of a mixed bag. On one hand, it's great in terms of gameplay and story. But the PC port is just terrible. Firstly, it's using Games for Windows Live still, and there's a ton of problems with that. It's not that well optimized for PC either. I found it best to set most things to low/off, textures on high, and shadows definetly off, the game ran better. You will need a few tweaks to be able to run this properly (at least on Windows 7). I hope they release a patch.

Paladins ist ein Spiel, welches man nur in einer Hass-Liebe-Beziehung ertragen kann.  Einerseits ist es mechanisch sehr ausgereift und besitzt, verglichen mit TF2 und Overwatch, mindestens die dreifache strategische Tiefe. Zu der Teamkomposition kommen noch das Item-, Karten- und Talentsystem hinzu, welche einfach zu begreifen, aber schwer zu meistern sind. Der Competitive-Spielmodus besitzt, Ã¤hnlich wie bei einem MOBA, eine Bann- und Pickphase, nach der die Champions auch noch unter den Teammitgliedern getauscht werden kÃ¶nnen. Auch bekommt es auch am Ã¶ftesten Updates von den dreien und hat bei weitem die beste Balance. Stets sind 1-2 Champions zu stark und ~5 unspielbar schwach, was bei mittlerweile Ã¼ber 40 Champions eine ganz gute Quote ist. Pay2win ist nicht existent, Lootboxen sind ungewÃ¶hnlich fair, da es eine Liste des Inhalts und keine Duplikate gibt. Lootboxexklusive Kosmetika sind selten. Die Kosmetika selbst kommen oft mit eigenen SFX, VFX, Voicepack und manchmal sogar eigener Musik. Generell ist fÃ¼r jeden Geschmack etwas dabei, wirklich objektiv schlechte Skins gibt es keine. Nun zum Schlechten. Paladins ist immer noch sehr buggy, auch wenn es bergauf geht. Je nach Hardware kann von mehrmals tÃ¤glich bis zu einmal alle paar Monate mit AbstÃ¼rzen gerechnet werden. Bugs und Glitches gibt es viele, auch wenn mittlerweile diese meistens nur noch visueller oder auditiver Natur sind und keinen Einfluss auf das Spielgeschehen haben. Die Server in Brasilien und Asien sollen schrecklich sein, kann ich aber nicht bezeugen. Matchmaking ist ziemlich random und steckt, wenn genÃ¼gend Zeit verstreicht, irgendwelche Spieler einfach zusammen in eine Runde, auch in Competitive.  Empfehle ich das Spiel? Schaut euch meine Spielzeit an, wenn mich die Bugs stÃ¶ren wÃ¼rden, hÃ¤tte ich schon vor Jahren aufgehÃ¶rt. Mann muss sich einfach bewusst sein, dass Evil Mojo/Hi-Rez ungefÃ¤hr 3-4 mal im Jahr etwas richtig dummes mit dem Spiel anstellen, was dann aber meistens auch vorbei geht. Diese Zeit sitzt man dann einfach aus und guckt sich die Memes dazu an. Wenn ihr euch nicht sicher seit, dann schaut euch einfach ein paar Videos auf dem offiziellen Youtube-Kanal an. Evil Mojo sind einfach eine Firma, die bei der Charakterstellung keine Punkte in Intelligenz, dafÃ¼r aber alle in Charisma investiert haben. Sie meinen nichts bÃ¶ses und haben offensichtlich SpaÃŸ an ihrer Arbeit. Und genau das hÃ¤lt mich fest und bringt mich jÃ¤hrlich dazu, doch noch etwas mehr Geld zu investieren. Geht einfach ohne Erwartungen rein und wenn etwas dummes passiert, dann chillt zwei Wochen und kommt wieder, es wird alles vorbei sein, das geht seit der Alpha so.

Laserlife is a game for people who need a break from everything else, listen to very calming music, and if you just lost that Counter Strike game. It enables the mind to succeed in collecting memories but if you miss one, you do not get upset. This game is a definite buy for anyone but maybe not at the price of 15 dollars. I bought this game during a sale in which it was lowered to 2.54 dollars. It is a great game nonetheless but here are some pros and cons +Very calming and relaxing gameplay +Good Music +Visually amazing -Short game but still fun -15 dollars -You need a controller Overall the cons arent completely terrible but I do suggest buying it in a sale. If you buy it because of this review please leave a thumbs up. It is a good game! Enjoy

The Best Game

Empires Apart is an indie title made by a small team, it is heavily inspired by Age of Empires 2 in units and theming, it's really good at what it does and an amazing amount of fun. I've never been much of a multiplayer person, but this title had me hooked since I entered beta. A few things are good to note about the design: The pacing was designed to be fast without loss of strategic depth, which means streamlined. Most matches can be finished in 20-30 minutes. There is very little dead space or PvE (player versus environment) play at the start of a match, and not even beginners should feel like they need to jump through hoops with set build orders and such or like they'd rather play with rules like "no attacking for the first hour". Everything from gather rates and resource balance to map size and the availability of units and more town centers is very well tought out for what style of game Empires Apart wants to be. The scout can scan the environment in two long strokes, then scout the enemy or lure boar. Every task you think of is streamlined and quick, no chores that keep you from playing the rest of the game for half a minute. And when I said "no loss of strategic debt" up there I meant it. For optimal play you need to decide within the first two or three villagers you make whether you're emphasizing rush or boom, and start working towards the first big military or economy upgrade. Empires apart was designed from the ground up to be intuitive. For instance: the anti-cavalry bonus is called "long weapon", and that's how you visually recognize all the units that have it. That bonus works on all mounted units. And now you know what you needed to know about that. If you can gather infantry in a building, you can gather cavalry there, if you can hand in fish at a dock you can hand in berries and wood and gold, no matter who or what killed an animal you can gather food from it. The game was made as intuitive as possible to pick up and start to play, even for those new to the genre. Traditionally there are two ways to make a balanced multiplayer game: having two, three or maybe four completely unique civs, or having as many civs as you like that are very similar. Empires Apart embraces the age of patches to allow a degree of civ/faction uniqueness in between those two, dunking us into unexplored territory and some awesome matchups. This means that the game will keep getting balance patches for the forseeable future, since this kind of balance is inherently really hard to get right. Empires apart was designed with all the conveniences of a modern RTS. Automatic farm reseeding, command queue, a clever control group system that allows you to run unit production quickly in between other tasks, ranked play on a ladder with matchmaking function, good HUD/UI. There is very little about this game to get frustrated about (other than an opponent who's playing just that little bit better than you of course). Lesser sides: The single player options are bells and whistles. Fun, but not nearly as fun as the multiplayer. The short single player challenges are pretty good at teaching you the few tricks you won't pick up by yourself though, and complement the intuitive gameplay. The AI is aimed mostly at beginners, although it's scheduled to keep improving. The balance as mentioned before is not optimal yet. Plus the game has heroes. They're wel done and fit the rest of the game, but I'm just not a fan of heroes in general. Overall though it's just a really fun title where you can jump into an all out war and be done in time for dinner. The great easily outweighs the "meh".

Party hard 2 is a game about a guy getting waken up by his neighbors at 3 am so he decides to go on a killing spree to make things tranquil. The game is a combination between Hitman and Hotline Miami. The graphics are stunning and the gameplay is comforting and challenging. Party hard 2 is the perfect sequel to party hard with upgraded animations, better voice acting but still preferably bad but the sounds are excellent though. If you're familiar with the prequel then you know how the game works. You enter a party with a dozen other people. The goal varies from missions. but most of the times the goal is to kill everyone or some specific targets, drug dealers etc. To accomplish your goal you get to use your trusty knife and the environment for an example. sabotage the speakers to explode, poison the drinks or throw people into a fire. But you need to be careful not to get caught murdering because the witness will then call the police and it isn't fun hiding from them. This game makes party hard 1 look like game jam game in my opinion. As i stated earlier, every game of Party hard starts with you outside a huge party, the levels vary from MC gatherings to hospitals parties. But the goal is usually the same, to kill everyone or specific targets. Some levels may also have some level themed quests for an example explode 5 trucks. A new feature that is important to mention is the new abilities. Every character has unique abilities for an example the "party hard killers" ability is to cause a shockwave abolishing everyone in the surrounding. Crafting is also a new important feature that gives you the ability to combine items and create new bizarre items that can be used to exterminate a good example is when you combine a lighter and a full gas can you will create a bomb that can be used to kill a large number of crowded people. Party hard 2 is currently out for 16,79â‚¬ which i think is fairly priced. It's about 4â‚¬ more than the prequel but you get a more enhanced experience. 13 unique missions that take about 30-45 minutes each to complete if you are experienced with the party hard series. There is also a decent amount of replayability because there are multiple quests on every level and a lot of different ways to murder people.   The game is mostly balanced but there's one thing i hoped they could have improved in the sequel that i hated in party hard 1. And it's the fact that the police instantly knows where you are when a person calls them. It just doesn't make sense that the police instantly starts to chase you after them being called. And i believe they could have implemented another mechanic, for an example alternatively of having 1-2 cops that know where you are. they should make maybe 5-8 cops that seek for you or something like that, so they'll nerf the cops but still keep the game somewhat challenging. This game is insanely difficult for newcomers and casual gamers. Because it isn't easy killing people with a bunch of people nearby. Because as fast as they witness you committing murder the police will arrive and the odds of you succeeding to evade them is very low. I usually make a kind of plan on who i am going to take out in what order and then just wait out people to go into deserted rooms. The graphics are stunning. The textures are a lot less pixelated since the prequel and level design is now 3D with 2D Characters. The use of small detailed pixels like fire particles really enhances the experience a lot. The animations are very smooth, and the use of shadows makes the atmosphere feel alive. The soundtrack of Party hard 2 is really catchy and gets easily stuck in my head. And really much all sounds from the sirens of the cops to the sounds of murdering with the knife is really high quality. And a huge improvement from the prequel. Runs really well on my setup with post 60fps. Was a bit of a surprise because i thought it would be at the sub 60's because of all the entities loaded into the game and all of the activity going on. -Police is a bit too overpowered -When taking shortcuts i sometimes end up getting stuck in the ground and unable to move. But it has only happened twice during my 10-hour playthrough and I use shortcuts a lot. Most of the bugs are also patched at this date so you'll most likely not experience my issues when playing.  Party hard 2 is the excellent sequel to its predecessor party hard. The graphics are stunning and a lot of new interesting features that no one expected. The game is perfect with a few flaws such as the police is a bit broken and small bugs that may sometimes be a bit annoying.
You like MMOs? You like RPGs? You like MMORPGs? You like a cheap game? You want to play with friends? You want to have a lot of things to do? Buy this game...

I love playing this game on my leisure time. I play under the German faction and my specialty is - Recon SDKfz 222 driving/ and gunning. I thoroughly enjoy making lots of enemies come after me using their rockets, planes, or anti-armored grenades. It really helps draw out the focus of players from the objectives. The best part of it is when noobs think they can drive out/run out in the open towards me thinking they are sneaking/rushing only to end up dead. Even noobish pilots think they can nose dive shoot at me when in reality, the shells will take out their plane and all I'll need to do is repair the damages done.  But now...like all other H&G players...there is time for ranting.  From the German faction perspective, my biggest complaint has to be that german fighter planes get less bombs than the other factions. I understand the devs like to relive the WW2 experience and make Germany lose the war by nerfing weaponry and bolstering other factions but let's get real. They need to learn humiliation. Just cause one faction's players start being good at killing doesn't mean it's time for a nerf. All in all, I actually do NOT have complaints about Germany aside from the planes. I just am tired of seeing the other two factions receiving bonuses, and weaponry simply to "even out" the fighting. All in all the game is free. The game is playable. The game is an FPS WW2 era game. The maps are huge so you won't feel contained. Vehicles exist. People running out and others camping. It's fun! Microtransactions exist BUT so do warbonds. You can live off and ride off warbonds rather than just paying over and over and over. If you know how to save you can make more gold just from warbonds. Of course, you can always grind! Lastly, my favorite part is the community. I've made lots of friends and remember them by name. I can join matches and talk about a player and at least 2 people would know who I'm talking about. I just love that. Anyways thanks for reading!. - Blackpaw Santana

El juego es muy bueno, me encanta y me gusta la version de pc, sin embargo empezare con sus contras. Contras: - Es el peor juego de la serie en cuanto a canciones, literalmente odio varias canciones, entre ellas el tiki y la bicicleta que si bien son canciones de colombianos y son contadas las canciones en espaÃ±ol, son de las peores que pudieron meter, entre otras mas canciones, he jugado todos los juegos pero estas canciones son regulares con tendencia a malas, igual es cuestion de gustos. - Por el punto anterior, juego mucho las canciones de just dance unlimited, por lo cual cuando se cae el servidor de ubisoft, pues se limita uno a jugar las canciones normales y eso no me gusta mucho, las caidas de los servidores cuando jugaba con wii u eran constantes y aqui tambien solo como dos veces me ha pasado, me imagino sacan el 2018 y no serviran mas, punto en contra. - Que aparentemente no saldra para pc el proximo aÃ±o, porque su "target" en pc es regular y mucha gente no lo juega, eso es lamentable, nisiquiera esta pirata, es la mejor version de just dance para pc, porque no hay mas y ya no van a sacarlo mas? lamentable por ello, porque se justifican que tenemos just dance now, pero eso es una basura. - Las coreografias mucho que lamentar, son copias de algunos juegos anteriores, muchas canciones tienen ese algo que dice, ya he jugado esta coreografia, eso es lamentable, esta faltando innovacion. A favor - primer just dance en pc, rogar que salga el otro para pc firmando en  - la interfaz es clara y limpia, mas contenidos y mas cosas por hacer. - just dance unlimited por 3 meses es claro que deseo mas canciones, pero es lo mejor jugar las canciones de antes. - la opcion de super star, antes solo se limitaba a las 5 estrellas, pero ahora ese superstar le da un plus. - lo busque en la mejor rebaja posible, en colombia lo compre en apenas 15 usd, la mejor compra de un juego sin llevar un aÃ±o en el mercado. aunque claro el unlimited no es gratis. - buena deteccion del celular, aunque me toco crear una red propia para evitar el ping alto, eso me soluciono muchos problemas de deteccion, en algunas canciones nuevas la deteccion no es tan buena - 6 jugadores con celular aunque eso viene del aÃ±o pasado pero se juega bien. - el just dance tv, puedes compartir tus bailes ridiculos a todo el mundo o disfrutar riendote de esos bailes. Espero mejoras en las canciones del nuevo aÃ±o.

Okay, so to review this game, I'll just tell a story. Playing the Reboot first of all. So all is well. I decide to go for the good ol turtle tactic, I have admin. building everywhere and they are cranking out $100k about every 3 mins. I'm happy. I'm buying Anti-Air and tanks hand over fist. All is well. Defences are working well. Then the first sign of trouble comes when a drone apears above my main base. Im instantly dumb founded. How did that get there? Then comes to Stealth Bombers, spawning over my admin. buildings blowing up everything. Could'nt fight it due to the spawning over my base. Turns out, if the opposing team spawns an Air control station on your side of the map the planes they spawn, spawn over your base and blow up everything and ~300k of anti-air cant do anything about it. 9/11 would recommend buying this game.

PROS: This game definitely doesn't need a review, as it's so well known. It certainly doesn't need my help, either. But if I could say a few things about this game, it would be how much fun I have playing it, how tight-knit the community (sometimes) is, and the fact that I love making money from the marketplace! That's right, with more market options than Defense of the Ancients 2, and Team Fortress 2, you can make the money for the honeys. Especially with the use of â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥.com and other trading websites. CONS: Don't click phishing links and don't fall prey to hijackers, and definitely don't call hacks, no one likes that. Losing your entire inventory is a shame, though. There are tradebots that will hunt your account down, so make sure you behind traders with high positive reputations, (+rep) on their account, and high in steam level.  CONCLUSION: Have fun, and make money while playing! It's the only game I don't ever regret burning my time and money, because if you get money while playing, what else do you need?
