The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt was for me the best game in 2015, because the graphics and the storywise are amazing, no other game can beat it. i play the game with an i7 4790k and a zotac GTX 1080 amp with around 120 fps on ultra graphics and i must say it's a dream. i have additionally installed the texturepack or the mod E3FX and that looks darker and more beautiful, just like the reviewtrailer of Witcher 3 Wild Hunt. the fighting system is very easy to learn and makes when you had learned a lot of fun. in terms of Open World as i said the best game in the year 2015. i have also bought  the addon Heart of Stone, it is recommendable for this genial game absolutly. i will also get the second DLC Wine and Blood and also playing it through. if anyone is interested in Openworld and absolutly freedom of decision so i can recommend this game. all in all I would give the game 10 of 10 points if i could. thanks for reading and that was my opinion for this perfect and grandiose game. update: second game Wine and Blood is absolutly perfect and have a great story :P both of them have a great story :) (dlcs)

Awesome game! Great new take on XCOM with its combat system, lore, etc. I find it annoying to get pieces of equipment but thats part of the fun, trying to figure out how to go thru missions with ill-equipped soldiers. However, there are some random crashes that happen which kinda makes me annoyed at the devs because there have never been other crashes with the other games when I have played them. After 7 hours. I think this game is great! Pick it up if its on sale and if you are a fan of XCOM already (or not) !

Good game! Not as good as I hoped, but good nonetheless!!

Best. RPG. Ever. Undertale is a amazing game with amazing characters and amazing ideas and mechanics. You can go the nice way, and spare everyone, to get the best ending, or you can go the mean way, and kill everyone, for the worst ending. Anyone will love the game, even if they arent into Earthbound or Final Fantasy. The game does not have any moments where you gotta backtrack, in the long run. Players of all age will love the characters and at least have one loveable favorite, such as Papyrus, Sans, or even Undyne! I recommend you buy the game a.s.a.p. Don't wait for a discount or price drop, get it a.s.a.p! You can thank me later.

A nice little game that definitely deserves a 'Thumb's-up' ...and a purchase! Don't expect playing million of hours, as it gets somewhat repetitive after a few hours. But at the same time, maps are always procedurally (randomly) generated, so you never really play the same level ever. The one thing to know here is this is very much a puzzle game using a city-building thematic, and not at all a city builder. There are some 'urban planning' logic, (for example the fields yield more points if they are placed beside a mill), but you don't have to worry about distance between houses and workplace, or creating paths for your islanders....because there are no citizens or islanders at all. But if you enjoy adding new achievements, or trying to improve on your high-score and global ranking, etc., this is a very well-made, relaxing and chilled little game, that you will for sure enjoy like many of us who have posted a review here.

Seeing how much backlash this game gets for its gameplay, I gotta say - yes, the gameplay could've been better, because it kinda feels like a walking simulator at times. However, I think that the game is great the way it is - its purpose is to make you feel the lovecraftian atmosphere, give you creeps, and that is the part where the game succeeds. So if you expect this game to be RPG GOTY 2019 then you are gonna be disappointed, but if you are a fan of Lovecraft's Mythos then you will be more than happy

Love the game, Really fun solo and with people

Rocket League is one of the best games I tried this year. I would definitely tell my friends to buy it so we can have fun together! That was interesting, creative and sad but overall a great experience and history. Every day, I imagine a future where I can be with you In my hand is a pen that will write a poem of me and you The ink flows down into a dark puddle Just move your hand - write the way into his heart! But in this world of infinite choices What will it take just to find that special day? What will it take just to find that special day? Have I found everybody a fun assignment to do today? When you're here, everything that we do is fun for them anyway When I can't even read my own feelings What good are words when a smile says it all? And if this world won't write me an ending What will it take just for me to have it all? Does my pen only write bitter words for those who are dear to me? Is it love if I take you, or is it love if I set you free? The ink flows down into a dark puddle How can I write love into reality? If I can't hear the sound of your heartbeat What do you call love in your reality? And in your reality, if I don't know how to love you I'll leave you be.

David Cage has come a long way, or at least he let actual writers create the script this time around. For that reason, this game really took me by surprise. His other games while good at the time were incredibly corny, poorly acted and written. Detroit on the other hand is incredibly acted and written. I started this game with an idea of what I would get out of it and was left feeling like an existential crisis was around the corner.  I loved each of the characters and was attached to them all profoundly. Connor was my favorite as the interactions between him and his partner Hank are some of the best sections in the game. The amount of narrative forks in the road is staggering. Simple choices can lead to entire sections-levels that you would have skipped completely if done differently. You could play this game easily a half dozen times and see different outcomes and story paths, maybe even more.  Towards the end of the game I was very much emotionally invested to the characters, and my choices left me both satisfied and intrigued with what I could do differently next time around. Within the menu, there's a narrative tree that fills up as you see more of what the story has to offer. Filling that out and using the currency you receive from it to buy extras is a good incentive that goes along with one of the most, if not the most narratively diverse games ever made There were a few moments where I hated the game for making me choose between two things, with a timer god forbid. There are moments where you will mess up and things won't go the way you wanted them to, but it's part of the core experience. Let whatever happens, happen.

O tÃ­tulo da Lightning Rod Games estÃ¡ sendo lanÃ§ado hoje, 17 de Abril de 2020, para Windows, Apple Arcade, Mac e Nintendo Switch. Trata-se de um game que mistura quebra-cabeÃ§as com aventura, digamos. Uma aventura, aliÃ¡s, deveras emocionante. Tudo, vale frisar novamente, com um fortÃ­ssimo apelo emocional. Com diversas cenas tocantes, as quais sÃ£o atÃ© mesmo capazes de encher nossos olhos de lÃ¡grimas. O jogo Ã© lindo, aliÃ¡s, com parte de seus grÃ¡ficos em Low-Poly, e com suas dobraduras fantÃ¡sticas. O tÃ­tulo esteve em desenvolvimento durante cerca de cinco anos, e o que o pessoal da desenvolvedora por ele responsÃ¡vel nos entrega, hoje, Ã© um verdadeiro must have para todos aqueles que apreciam uma histÃ³ria envolvente, carismÃ¡tica e cheia de emoÃ§Ãµes. A Fold Apart Ã© uma verdadeira "montanha-russa de emoÃ§Ãµes". Em A Fold Apart, temos a histÃ³ria de um casal apaixonado que Ã© obrigado a se separar, devido a motivos de trabalho. O rapaz, um arquiteto, vai para uma cidade distante, e tudo que os mantÃ©m "unidos", daÃ­ em diante, sÃ£o mensagens de texto trocadas via celular (podemos escolher algumas respostas). A relaÃ§Ã£o Ã  distÃ¢ncia a princÃ­pio vai bem, mas muito rapidamente as coisas comeÃ§am a se deteriorar. A frieza dos meios digitais parece nÃ£o ser o suficiente para ambos, e quando a saudade aperta, nem mesmo palavras de carinho trocadas entre os smartphones sÃ£o suficientes. O rapaz e a moÃ§a sÃ£o verdadeiramente apaixonados. O amor dos dois Ã© belamente retratado por A Fold Apart, inclusive atravÃ©s de seus belos grÃ¡ficos. O momento da despedida, no aeroporto, Ã© verdadeiramente tocante, e a trilha sonora ajuda bastante a fazer com que aquela lÃ¡grima presa finalmente se desprenda. O tÃ­tulo Ã©, sem sombra de dÃºvidas, uma verdadeira montanha-russa emocional, cheio de altos e baixos. Todos eles dotados de grÃ¡ficos desenhados Ã  mÃ£o, e verdadeiramente interessantes. AtravÃ©s deles, somos colocados em contato com uma mecÃ¢nica que nos "obriga", digamos, a dobrar papeis. Ã‰ importante ressaltar que quebra-cabeÃ§as podem ser apresentados ao jogador em alguns momentos, digamos, "chave": quando algum clima tenso se faz presente entre o casal, por exemplo. Para resolver os puzzles, devemos dobrar os papeis, clicando nas bordas laterais, superiores e inferiores, e entÃ£o arrastando. TambÃ©m Ã© possÃ­vel girar a folha, exibindo sua parte traseira, e podemos inclusive rotacionÃ¡-la lateralmente. Tudo isto para fazer com que o personagem controlÃ¡vel da vez (controlamos os dois, em momentos sempre distintos) chegue atÃ© a estrela dourada, a qual sinaliza, entÃ£o, a resoluÃ§Ã£o do puzzle. Portanto, espere por quedas, deslizes, objetos sendo empurrados em direÃ§Ãµes as mais distintas, e coisas do tipo. As tais dobraduras servem para criarmos caminhos. Muitos dos puzzles sÃ£o bastante desafiadores, verdade seja dita. Entretanto, a Lightning Rod Games incluiu em A Fold Apart uma espÃ©cie de "guia", o qual resolve os puzzles automaticamente, caso o jogador assim deseje. Muitos podem condenar tal decisÃ£o, mas Ã© importante ressaltar que temos aqui um game fortemente focado na narrativa. This game is a perfect mix between the Arma and Battlefield series (even if only infantry based), it is full of different and fun pvp game modes, all based around territory control, hunt & destroy objectives, escort and obviously the classics like team deathmatch. The interesting aspect is that it also comes with a full coop team based option, where cooperation and teamplay are fundamental against rather smart and deadly AI enemies. Realism is not far away in Insurgency, one or two bullets put you down on the ground and while gameplay is still pretty frantic, you need to move cautiously around every corner, looking everywhere and listening to every sound clue possible, above all during night missions. You can customize your equipment in every little aspect, from weapon attachments to accessories like granades and night vision goggles, but you also need to keep an eye to your overall weight, based on the kind of mobility you want to have on the battlefield. Technically the game is rather good, graphics/effects are not that far from nowadays triple A titles and levels/maps are pretty well built. Sound design is top notch and you'll â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ yourself out when you'll hear bullets coming your way, but you'll also grin like a little Rambo when you'll hear the power of a full M249 magazine discharge...really great! I don't have particular issues to point out about Insurgency, it always played smooth and I had fun during all my time with it (and will keep playing it in the future). Compared to other FPS communities, players are always willing to play like a team and rarely opt for a mad mercenary approach, putting this game between the top spots of the military/tactical shooter genre. And its developers keep working on it sending out free upgrades and new maps/weapons/modes.  Recommended, without a doubt!! Glorious!

My heart will go on...

The fundamental FPS movement mechanics are so paramount in this game they are given a sense of style that most other FPS games lack. The wall running, double jumping and mech embarking blends together to form a piece of artwork in of itself. The campaign is exciting non-stop action throughout, plenty of opportunities to see each Mechs abilities and weapons. The continuous escalation of intensity culminates with a slight touch of genuinely earned emotional gratitude towards the end, even if it feels like it under stays its welcome. From the multiplayer I've played, each match starts with teams fighting on foot, until about halfway players are given the ability to call down a Mech at slightly different times. Mech fighting is where multiplayer shines as using them makes things fun even when you lose. I was able to call down a mech multiple times during a match, but even when on foot, the anti-mech weapon you can have in your loadout is effective. The multiplayer has AI grunts running around which help make each player feel valuable since defeating them gives XP at the end as well. The more you play, the more XP you get and the more loadout items you unlock. I got into the game for the campaign but multiplayer was worth checking out.

Silver Chains is an atmospheric and gripping psychological horror that was sadly swept under the rug upon its release in 2019. Featuring some decent scares, character models and smooth gameplay, it has all the groundwork for an excellent horror. Despite being grievously and lamentably short, whilst being inadequately priced, I enjoyed my playthrough and was absorbed in the story from start to finish. + Impressive and realistic, detailed graphics. + Highly atmospheric with a handful of great scares scattered throughout. + More variable than a walking simulator, including some hiding scenes, reiterating that players are not just safely dawdling around. + Interesting story, albeit a bit cliche, it is recounted in a captivating manner. + Mixture of puzzles, relying on player deduction with little handholding. + Notes slowly tell the story but are found in a disjointed order, whereby players must deduce the truth + Moderation of jumpscares, chase scenes and puzzles, keeping gameplay fresh and exciting + Clear inspiration from well-known titles (Layers of Fear, Outlast), mixing and matching specific elements whilst maintaining its authenticity, steering away from just being a bland copycat. - Minimal interaction with objects, no opening drawers, optional items etc. - Some objects were difficult to interact with until I was completely on top of it before the command would appear.  - Extremely disappointing 'boss fight', lamentably relying on running loops, repeatedly.  - Far too short (3-4 hours) for a hefty price tag of $AU35.95. Seeing this on the store page, it does not stand out and the used and abused spooky haunted mansion scheme is not something entirely attention grabbing. Yet, shortly after beginning the game, I was soon elated at how wrong I was and discovered there was much more to Silver Chains than I had first thought. Upon the initial load screen and introduction, everything seems to stick to the classic formula of the protagonist finding himself at a seemingly abandoned, eerie old mansion, unsure how he arrived there. Despite suffering slightly from these cliche horror tropes, the game manages to march forward and formulate its own unique experience. Set in England in the early 1900's, we start to explore the manor, uncovering its mysteries, striving to recognise its connection with the character and who its ghostly inhabitants are, including a suspicious puppet. I do not wish to state more details, in hopes of avoiding spoilers for potential buyers. However, I believe it is important to note that Silver Chains is certainly not a pioneer for its narrative. Described in written text,  I wouldn't be convinced to play it off this alone either, despite considering myself a veteran horror enthusiast. Yet, with adjusted expectations about its short length and considering it as a whole, even with its commonplace themes, it does manage to carve out its own thrilling experience and I do believe it deserves a place in horror loverâ€™s Steam libraries. Majority of the game is spent exploring the manor, completing puzzles, with the aim of uncovering the whole truth of the protagonist. The addition of enemies is a massive benefit and broadens the titles engagement with players, actively stepping away from being a walking simulator. Although the scenes where danger is present are somewhat rare, the fear and trepidation caused from this tension-building are what make the game standout as a whole.  After some casual exploring, with little to no spooky happenings, I became brazen in my exploration mission. This was soon thwarted with some excellently placed scares that pushed me back to 'reality' and every nearby sound made me anxious, trying to keep a mental note of all areas I could potentially seek refuge in.  I really appreciate that the developers did not rely solely on loud/eerie sounds to depict and give warning when something scary is about to occur. Instead, players begin to feel safe, unsure when or if the next scare will be, which is a much more efficient method of instilling fear and moulding the psychological horror experience.  Unfortunately, I found the lack of interaction with objects quite disappointing, with many rooms having nothing to explore, except marvel at their great visuals. The notes were interesting and found in a disjointed order, allowing the story to be somewhat of a mystery until the end, however I would have liked to see a greater amount of areas with narration or optional objects to uncover.  This would give an even greater level of immersion and actively encourage players to explore all nooks, as most of the time, this felt pointless to me. However, there was an interesting feature whereby a monocle may be used that gives the protagonist the power to see in another dimension and view areas of interest that are invisible in the real world.  Being such a short experience, there were only a few puzzles but those that were there, were more than simple fetch quests, the absence of these is considerably rare in Indie horrors and I applaud the developers for not taking this easy route. Most puzzles had a clue in another part of the mansion that needed to be found to complete the task or deduce the combination, etc. There was nothing difficult and for me personally, did sway on the easier side. Silver Chains also doesn't give explicit duties to do and lets players figure things out mostly on their own, with the exception of a few hints to point us in the right direction, such as through the use of the monocle previously mentioned. Graphics for this game were much greater than I had expected and brilliantly brought the manor to life. The most standout element was that of the 'Mother'. Up close, she was truly frightening. The dolls and other ghostly presences were also depicted very well and with great attention to detail. The protagonist is fully voiced and narrates some comments along the way but is nothing special. The audio as a whole is surprisingly mediocre. Although the bounding sounds when you are being chased are adequately stress-inducing and some eerie childrenâ€™s giggles in the background, for a horror game, I must say I did not really notice sound being a core element in its overall performance, but it also did not take away from the experience, either. I experienced no issues and it played extremely smoothly and was consistent from start to finish. Silver Chains may not have a standout story, but it makes up for this with its excellent performance and almost perfect moderation of horror elements, steering away from overusing chase scenes, jumpscares, puzzles and narration to create a variable and engrossing experience that all horror fans can enjoy. Whilst I adored this game greatly and recommend to all fans of the genre, potential buyers should be aware of its sadly, very short playtime before purchasing.

It got off to a horrendously disappointing start, with the in-game downloader taking 2 attempts and 12 hours to download 90gigs worth of data. I'd Spent $400 on a HOTAS and $180 on the Premium Deluxe after participating in the Alpha and Beta, and then everyone I know who got it for $1 on GamePass had zero dramas. Now, later on since it's all downloaded and I'm well into the thick of it, it's incredible. Almost everything I could want out of a flight simulator. The only thing I feel like it's missing is individual Training Missions per aircraft type, like they've done for the Cessna 152. It's a whole lotta YouTubing and external reading to get a grip on how to fly the Jets, Airlines and Turboprops otherwise, when it'd be much more engaging to learn through Missions.

Chronicle of Innsmouth is an indie point&click adventure game inspired by the Cthulhu mythos of H.P. Lovecraft. + Gfx: Pixel art is neat. Not superb but not lazy. Sprites are better than most background gfx. Palette is meh. + Sound: Voice-overs are superb! Really adds value to characters. Music and sfx is average except that cool song at the end credits. + Story: Well, since it is heavily inspired by Lovecraft, most part of the story was obvious and predictable for the great man's fans, but it goes well, nothing wrong. + Value: It took me about 3 hours to finish, i think it deserves the full price for the content. ~ Puzzles: I don't know but all looked very easy to me. None of the puzzles offered enough challenge but at least they were not illogical abominations or all simple key-lock puzzles. And of course get ready to do some pixel hunting there & there... - Timed events: I must tell you the truth, i hate dying in p&c games. They weren't super hard but i felt they were totally unnecessary.  It can be counted as a steal if you can grab it on sale. A neat, playable, enjoyable and loveable Lovecraftian p&c adventure game created with AGS engine.

I love the game so far but there are a few things that I want to nitpick on. 1st, the search engine for downloading maps is so weird? It's inconsistent for me. Say I saw a map but I wasn't able to download it, and I search the title of the song, the map doesn't show up. Even though I just saw the map. Or if I type in the words "Party", it shows me songs that doesn't even have the word party in it. 2nd, I think the accuracy meter is a little forgiving? Sometimes I would press a key very late and it still counted the note in the combo. Hopefully they make the accuracy meter more strict with the timings. Overall, I would very much recommend this game and encourage everyone who is into VSRG to play it and maybe even support the devs,

Hide or Die is back and the game is insanely fun after a slight learning curve. The new mode is heavily based on fluid movement and fast paced action. It's pure madness at times, especially when skilled survivors and hunters face off.  It is the first asymetrical horror game where I feel like I'm actually being chased by the killer. I'm not just jogging, I'm running for my life like a mad man. And sliding. Oh my, the sliding mechanic.  It takes a while to get used to, and anyone can slide from the get go, but to master it and be able to execute masterful 90 degree perfectly timed scaffold slides takes a while, but is satisfying as hell. And of course you have parkour as well. While the fast running action is my jam, the game allows for whatever playstyle suits you best personally. You can be a stealthy ninja, or a speed demon. Items are very useful. If you have good aim, go with the stun gun. Or pull a fast one on the Scientist and drop a Darkness Warp while thinks he has you trapped inside his dome. There are also keys, adrenaline, traps, flashbangs and smoke grenades, pain pills and first aid, motion sensors. You bring your own with your loadout, or find them during the match.  There is rich character customization down to the shape and size of your nose. You can look pretty, badass, or just plain ridiculous, your call. Tons of cosmetics to unlock, nametags, sprays, you name it. Progression hopefully won't disappoint you either. Perks, augments, modifiers, and items. There is always something to grind for, but at a reasonable rate.  I sincerely recommend to any asymetrical horror fan and I can't wait to see further development and additonal modes, starting with the return of Last Man Standing.

Realy good first person platform puzzle game. The game has 4 zones, A, B, C and D. Each zone has 4 lvls and also there are player upgrades and ability orbs. Player upgrades are basically jump upgrades, like douple jump and them triple jump and there is also the air bost. Ability orbs are orbs for exemple that alow you to change gravity or to teleport, etc. I would say that in the begining you dont know exactly what you have to do just find the "data point" normaly its next to the cores of each zone or you can use the one that is under the hub constructor (orange one in the begining), The data point will tell you were you need to go, just check the "extract power orb" or the  "upgrade location". Until lvls A2, B2, C2 and D2 i would say they are easy to do and whem you complete them you will able to unlock all the Player upgrades and Ability orbs. From lvls 3 and 4 the difficulty will increase and i remember that there are 2 particular lvls, B4 and D3 that are not easy but if you have patience you can beat them.

So I played the beta, and it was a riot! I had loads of fun, during my time playing I made sure to test each weapon and gadget I could get my hands on. I tried different playstyles, along with solo runs. I also hit the beta level cap.  As some people say, it was a blast. There is a lot that Survive does right. Even with two maps and one gamemode the beta has been a joy to participate in however, it is not without issues. Some of these are glaring, some are just personal nitpicks. So I would like to take a moment to list the both the good and the bad of the Metal Gear Survive Beta.  So for starters I'll list the good:                                                                         * Points are awarded to players who actually help the team out. (Completing side missions, revives, resource gathering) * Rewards are still handed out even if you fail the mission or withdraw, this means you are not   punished if somebody  leaves or is disconnected.  * Guns have a real punch, you shoot it dies. Nothing can handle the double trouble from a double barrel. * The new sounds are great. They've got a lot of weight to go along the high damage output. I hope to see more of this sound design in the full game. * Enemies will do huge amounts of damage if you let them, so footwork is vital. Low player health keeps the game tense as one mistake will cost you. Enemies on their lonesome are easy to dispatch but hordes can and will crush you if you are ever caught in the open. This adds tension, which is good. * The two player appeals are awesome- new voicelines? Awesome.  * Stealth kills are badass to pull off, even more so on the creature variants- sneaking up on a Tracker is the bees knees. * I hope there are more variants in the full game, what we've got now is great but none of the enemies really challenge a player's thinking. (Nothing soaks up damage, and there is only one fast mover.) * The soundtrack is top notch, it fits like a tee. *  Getting grabbed is a nice touch. I hope there is more done with grabs, for the player and enemy. Like what if they     dogpile the player if they don't break a grab fast enough? What if the player could counter if they are fast enough? *  The gameplay itself in so many ways is fantastic. I can't really explain it but if you like the action of MGSV then you should like this. *  I have yet to see any enemies OR players lagging, this is great and a farcry from MGO3s lag.  However...                                                                                                                                     * The matchmaking suuuucks. Anywhere from 4-12 minutes to find a game? The lack of a ready up function is pretty glaring too. When you do find players the 4 minute or so wait is pain, even after that you could be disconnected! * Some more voice types would be great. Though what we got now is good. more would be better. * The lack of animations and visable damage from status effects is jarring. The player just wormholes wolf steak into  his/her mouth. I wanna see some mealtime action! Speaking of food, buffs would be a really nice and welcome addition to food/drink items, like faster move speed and such. * Some way to set automatic item crafting would be nice. * The explosive enemies do not explode fast enough to ever catch a player. * This game really needs a press to voice chat key. Always on is a turn off to mic users. *  One handed and spears are the only real weapons- everything else is waaay too risky to use. (aside from guns, guns rule) * The hordes would be better suited coming from random directions in different sizes, encouraging more defense and comunication. From the start they just book it from one location. Also a higher volume of enemies would be neat. * Player's need to get a much more visable alert that someone is incapacitated. * The enemy needs to be more responsive. Even if you fail stealth you can still stroll behind shank them effortlessly, being spotted should be more punishing. They also forget about the player very quickly.  * A darker tone for the lobby would be real nice. Pure white is rather abrasive. * The new control scheme is bonkers. I for one would like it reverted to MGSVs. Double tap space to quick dive, hold stay prone? Space is also the new use key. The most painful however is how the gadgets are handled, you no longer equip throwables, you just chuck them with one press using the same aiming system from MGSV. Buildings are Q/E then space to place This more of a step down from MGSV as it feels less responsive overall. You can no longer switch from secondary to primary or vise versa while aiming via key press. Shift for first person aiming was another change. The radial inventory is gets more awkward for every extra slot you have. Appeals and voice commands are a mess to navigate. Press a key to toggle the menu another to switch from appeals to callouts, then hit 1,4,2, or 3 to select a command  . Gone is the tone select now whispered lines to screamed commands are individually bound to four clunky menus. The Int scope is gone so you have a waypoint system instead. Instant standup from being knocked down is strangely enough, annoying to me. It kind of negates being knocked on my ass. Also space to prone roll now? Yaarg~ I cannot speak for controller users. * The death timer really needs to freeze if another player is in the process of reviving you. Dying while being revived is ridiculous and frustrating. * The compass that appears when you are at a standstill should always be visible. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- All that being said- People really need to give Survive a chance. The level of hate it gets from people who haven't even tried the beta is insane. Zombie-like enemies are nothing new to MGS- hell Survive has the most interesting take on zombies I have ever seen. They are all crystalline and shatter like glass when hit, they arrive via wormholes just to stop a mining operation. I'd like to see them explained.  For me Survive treads new ground, it is free from the trappings of Kojima's writing, so we will see new things in the same universe. No more once per episode Snake or Cyborg Ninja, or bipedal nuke launchers, and don't forget the Russians. I have no hate for Kojima, I enjoy the games he directs, but holy hell can he write plotholes. If people really idolize him so much, than why don't they go support and discuss Death Stranding, instead of trashing Metal Gear Survive  ! Yes, the current beta build has problems, but blind hate solves nothing. This a spinoff, not a continuation Kojima's vision. All of the 0.1 hour negative reviews make me sick. They all spew the same mewling chorus of "This isn't Kojima directed! Not a true MGS!". You know what else was a spinoff? Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance, and while Kojima had involvement, it was still far flung from the timeline of other MGS game canon. Kojima not being involved does not mean the development team cannot do good work, they are after all, in the Metal Gear universe; crazy obtuse plots are synonymous with Metal Gear! If you think this game is bad then the best thing you can do is give helpful  , I'm thankful for the reviews that do give feedback instead of heaping hate on the beta. The entire point of a beta is to iron out issues! Give it a chance. Anyways, this beta is pretty good in my opinion despite the many issues. I enjoyed what we got, and provided my feedback. I hope the development team within Konami reads through ACTUAL criticisms and utilizes them to improve the full game.  I ramble a lot but thanks for reading. (I hope I didn't misspell TOO much.)

I've had a lot of fun with this game so far. The player-base is growing and it's definitely an enjoyable experience when playing with others. The concept, mechanics, and overall gameplay is simple; but the game shines in its intriguing social aspects. The 3D design and camera work could be improved, but the card artwork is excellent. The sound is good and the atmospheric music, along with the announcer's voice, adds to the overall experience. It took me about an hour to understand most of the basic cards and rules; understanding how everything works together and the various roles is part of the challenge but I think it also adds to the enjoyment. I was a bit confused at times on what my role was and how I should react in certain situations, but that encouraged me to try to be creative when I was challenged on my identity. There's plenty of helps available but just joining in with others is a good way to help you get a crash-course in learning the basics. Get some friends together and play a few hands, you're likely to have a good time.

OS: Windows10 x64 CPU: i7-7700@4.2Ghz RAM: 32GB DDR4@2800 GPU: GTX-1080-OC@~2Ghz HDD: 512GB M.2 SSD, 256GB/1TB UASP USB3.1 SSD, 2TB SATA3 HDD: *Game was installed on 1TB UASP USB3.1 SSD - Gorgeous interiors with good atmosphere - Some nice gore effects - Only few and nice jumpscares - Scary atmosphere - No third party DRM like Denuvo - Waste, empty and only ok looking open world - Controller issues (didn't work for menu, entering safecodes, continue and UV activate) - Bugged Arena (the player get stuck often and stats are not saved) - Didn't save stats after final boss/credits (stats lost after going to main menu) - Bugged Achievement (First Class Citizen didn't unlock) - First Audio loop had an ugly reloop break - Input delays - No weapon sheet - Dropped weapons vanish - Flashlight cooldown too long - Some weapons break too fast - Story I wasn't able to play this game with controller without using reWASD and creating a working config first. Because Controller didn't work in Menu, for Continue, for entering the safe codes and even for UV Activate. So if you want play this game with controller i suggest getting my reWASD config for it. If you like horror games with a mixture of Silent Hill/Outlast and the mentioned bugs above don't bother you too much then i can still recommend this game. If however you can't stand such technical imperfections, it's perhaps better to stay away from it.

Best game out there !

> Basic but Satisfying Combat > Unique art-style > Cozy, somewhat dated, yet atmospheric visuals. > Beautiful Soundtrack by Tyler Bates (Composer of the movie 300) > Surprisingly awesome sound-direction. Very lively environmental sound effects. > Good main-story > Great side-stories (Still part of the main story) > Decent voice acting that gets better over time. > Innovative Skill Tree System (Deeds you do can be dedicated to different gods to unlock points for their unique skill-trees.) > Good dialogue system (Like Mass-effect.) > Multiple Crashes and Bugs (Save alot.) > Very appalling intro, would drive alot of people away. > Painful voice acting in the early parts. > Very linear, with only the illusion of open-endedness > Illusion of Choices, but only a few actually affect things. > Enemies are way too spread out, and cannot be grinded for additional points.  > Boss fights are fun, but very easy even in Legend Difficulty.  > Very abrupt ending, conclusive, yet unsatisfying.  > No replayability or New Game Plus. This game has one of the worst introductions ever; it starts with a dodgy badly animated cutscene with crappy voice acting. But believe me, it actually gets better as mid-game, the story just simply becomes alot more interesting and voice actors actually start being pretty decent. The gameplay is a barebone Hack'N'Slash, but it mostly consists of just talking to be people and running here and there to progress. One the game gets right, is its artistic beautiful visuals, the really immersive sound direction and soundtrack. This is a game for patient gamers, and has great story with a very mediocre ending. (Like most stories) So if you're gonna buy it, I suggest getting it on sale. It's got around 27 hours worth of strolling around Greece while partaking in Greek mythological Events revolving around Jason & The Argonaut's quest for the Golden Fleece.

The game has been ripped off, hated, bad updates, and much more. But this game will always be my number 1. It has been adapted and developed so well over the past years and from the beginning. When I am bored or have nothing to do, I launch TF2. TF2 is such a game that you can cling on to. Overall, best game I have ever played, 10 out of 10.

So I have played for around one hour. The first city I visited was Coeur d'Alene a gorgeous looking city with an interesting road design. I went from that city to Lewiston and again it was a pleasant drive and city was interesting.  I love the new  assets they put in the game. Also like one poster commented the roads and cities look more interesting then Utah. Its really fun being able to drive from Oregon into Idaho just like in real life. If your a fan of driving this is a great buy. The state itself is not very big being around the same size as Utah as far as roads go. However its a real treat being able to drive into a new state. Also if you own Oregon and Washington you get a discount using the bundle option called the pacific NW bundle. Making this a very good bargain game. Well done SCS. I can easily recommend this game to others.

Once in the past, the Wild West was a dangerous place for honest businessmen;) that's why we always carried our favorite Colt with us! But all this is in the past, and now at home, sitting at your computer or phone, you can farm and pump your enterprise with clicks on the screen! It is difficult to say how highly intellectual it isâ€¦. But it sometimes gives you a lot of fun :) The gameplay of the game is as simple as anything else! Click and swing your finger along with businesses! Then open and collect unique cards for bonuses, and move further and further West towards the dream! What is a dream? This is family! Where are you surrounded by your loved ones and enjoy it every day, and every breath of life in this world! So join my Family inside the game! You will become part of a big Family with more than 412 people! When using a unique code, you will receive the first bonus, and then moreâ€¦. ///////////////////////////////////////// AFWRQB ///////////////////////////////////////// And if there is a difficulty in how to enter a Family, then I, as a caring father of a large Family, will help you with this guide! But remember the main thing: in the Wild West, the one who is faster and more agile than everyone around wins! 9/10 honest, dead businessmen!

Right now... this isn't a "game" This is more of a thoughtfull piece of art! Something you switch on for a while and just feel better after. Don't go in there expecting something like "No Man's Sky" that's not the case... maybe in the future (who knows) but not at the time. It is a fun little "thing". It's cool to build you're own ship, to fly it and explore hundrets of planets and asteroids... But it lacks some Important conted to be called a game. Why do I still recommend it then? Because it is, like I said at the beginning, a piece of art, wich I can really see being an awesome game in the future. And it is a interesting beutifull expirience. Last but not least... by buying the game you help the Developer to make it the best it can be. Result: 8/10
this game is super cute with the character design and i could play it for hours with the fact they have seasons. win that crown!

An enjoyable, crowd-funded detective game that's really half-game, half-movie (it's a 16GB download!).  Good acting and interesting storyline that can branch into 5 different endings.   Except for some annoying 'jumping-through-the-hoops' at times (some puzzles and items quests were a bit 'unintuitive'...), it was, overall, an entertaining ride. Good writing and appropriate music, too.   On the downside, there are some graphic scenes of violence (Tex getting beaten unconscious with an iron rod, which I did NOT find funny...), depictions of decapitation, and certain 'adult' themes, all of which make this game inappropriate for pre-17s.  What I also liked about it was that it appears to be designed to help raise awareness about the life of Nikola Tesla and his work.  If you get a chance, read up on some of Tesla's monumental discoveries and their importance in not just our daily lives (e.g. AC power, brushless motors, etc.) but also in the implementation of certain advanced technologies (e.g. wireless transmission of power, resonant systems, scalar electromagnetics, etc).  Helps fill in the missing 'forbidden' knowledge purposely omitted from most college-level Physics courses these days... Check it out. (Note: Acquired via a bundle)

A distanza di 8 anni (2002-2010), finalmente, dopo un numero veramente elevato di ritardi, arriva su Playstation 3, Xbox 360 e PC Mafia 2, lâ€™attesissimo sequel della serie lanciata da Take 2 agli inizi del nuovo millennio. Tanta attesa avrÃ  portato a grandi risultati? Per scoprirlo continuate a leggere: Ã¨ unâ€™offerta che non potete rifiutareâ€¦ La produzione dei programmatori di 2K Czech ci mette nei panni di Vito Scaletta, giovane italo-americano reduce della seconda guerra mondiale (la prima missione sarÃ  ambientata proprio nel corso del conflitto in Siciliaâ€¦) e nella sua scalata verso i vertici di cosa nostra a stelle e strisce dal 1945 al 1951, nel corso di quindici avventurosi capitoli. La prima lode da fare a Mafia 2 Ã¨ proprio quella di aver ricostruito con grande cura la sensazione del tempo che passa in un periodo cosÃ¬ carico di cambiamenti: dalla difficile situazione post bellica fino allâ€™alba del boom economico. Empire Bay (nientâ€™altro che una simil New York) sarÃ  caratterizzata in mille modi per far apparire chiaro lâ€™evidente cambiamento, cosa non cosÃ¬ frequente (tuttâ€™altro) in un videogame. Sotto lâ€™aspetto ludico, le tipologie di interazione si possono sostanzialmente dividere in due: lâ€™azione in macchina e quella a piedi. Il tutto sarÃ  intervallato da emozionanti intermezzi â€œgiratiâ€ alla perfezione (cosÃ¬ identici potrebbero essere presi come esempio in tante scuole di cinema!). Mafia 2 da un punto di vista strutturale potrebbe ricordare GTA, ma in realtÃ  Ã¨ un free roaming molto piÃ¹ lineare e â€œcondottoâ€ e questo, secondo la mia opinione, non per forza Ã¨ un male. La storia di Mafia 2 parte dagli anni â€™50 e si dipana per 15 capitoli pregni di emozioni italo mafiose americane. I panni del â€œbravo ragazzoâ€, saranno quelli di Vittorio Scaletta che si ritrova a dover fare una scelta di vita dopo essere tornato dalla Seconda Guerra Mondiale: lavorare al porto o prestare la spalla al suo vecchio compagno Joe Barbato. Ovviamente la scelta che non si potrÃ  rifiutare Ã¨ solo una e da qui in poi, il giocatore, avrÃ  modo di partecipare a rapine, assassini, inseguimenti, pestaggi, incendi, raccolta del pizzo, combattimenti fra cosche mafiose e chi piÃ¹ ne ha piÃ¹ ne metta. Mafia 2 Ã¨ lâ€™esatta trasposizione a videogames di film che hanno fatto la storia come Il Padrino, Scarface, Câ€™era una volta in America, Quei Bravi Ragazzi o Gangs of New York.Il gameplay di Mafia 2 Ã¨ dunque un agglomerato di missioni che ci porteranno allo scontro finale, al vedere la luce alla fine di un tunnel volutamente diritto e senza uscite di sicurezza. Il gioco in questione non Ã¨ un sand box e anche se i programmatori hanno creato una cittÃ  aperta, personalmente credo che non lo si debba vedere come tale. La cittÃ  di Empire Bay Ã¨ grande quel giusto ma non Ã¨ neanche lontanamente grande come una Liberty City del giÃ  citato GTA e se giÃ  si Ã¨ capaci di notare questa differenza, si capiranno anche tantissime altre differenze che non devono essere accostate fra i due giochi. Mafia 2 ha missioni che ci portano solo in una determinata direzione, altra cosa che si diversifica completamente da GTA che invece puÃ² essere piÃ¹ sbarazzino. Anche sugli scontri a fuoco con gangster di varia natura o con la polizia di Empire Bay, le cose sono completamente diverse dal titolo Rockstar. Appena volano le pallottole (e sono tante), cercare un riparo Ã¨ assolutamente consigliato ma non sempre utile tanto che lâ€™intelligenza artificiale Ã¨ capace di buttarci addosso un quintale di piombo senza pause che andrÃ  a sbriciolare alcuni materiali adibiti alla copertura del personaggio (legno o colonne di cemento) di Vittorio (Vito per gli amici). Di seguito agli scontri a fuoco, segnalo come la vita di Vito (scusate il gioco di parole) Ã¨ praticamente infinita ma anche qui Ã¨ bello notare che se nella modalitÃ  normale si viene colpiti abbastanza spesso e si sopravvive, in quella difficile si potrebbe vedere il Paradiso piÃ¹ di una volta. Ma se, giunti alla fine di uno scontro, rimanessimo senza proiettili o armi in mano? Le soluzioni sono due. Vi mettete a correre alla ricerca di un arma lasciata in terra o fate a botte ed Ã¨ qui che il titolo di Mafia 2 diventa ancora piÃ¹ divertente perchÃ© se da una parte ci sono degli action in terza persona in cui si possono dare solamente dei colpetti, Mafia 2 Ã¨ una vera manna per gli appassionati di boxe: tenere la guardia alta, sferrare qualche pugno basso o di media potenza e poi atterrare lâ€™avversario con un colpo deciso Ã¨ una soddisfazione notevole.I programmatori di Mafia 2, hanno creato una cittÃ  aperta ma con una storia chiusa e questo particolare Ã¨ perfettamente amalgamato nei 15 capitoli di cui Ã¨ composto il gioco. Empire Bay Ã¨ una cittÃ  viva, con gente che passeggia e macchine che circolano, con negozi e ristoranti aperti ma Ã¨ profondamente chiusa al giocatore: le cose da fare sono poche e forse la piÃ¹ divertente resta il rubare le macchine. Questo avviene in due modi, quello veloce e quello difficile; nel primo si vede Vito rompere il finestrino di una macchina (o saltarci dentro se scoperta), lavorare sui fili e partire via. Il secondo caso ci ruberÃ  un tot di tempo in piÃ¹, visto che dovremo cercare di forzare la serratura della portiera con gli attrezzi giusti: andando a girare tutti i cilindretti della serratura si potrÃ  rubare la macchina. Questa scelta semplice regala piÃ¹ di una emozione, soprattutto quando per la cittÃ  circolano parecchi poliziotti o la â€œtagliaâ€ sulla nostra testa Ã¨ alta. Altre cose da fare per la city sono il comprare nuovi vestiti firmati a monte di svaligiare negozi o chiedere il pizzo ma nulla di davvero opportuno per il guadagno e anzi anche abbastanza sconsigliato se si vuole evitare una certa â€œfamaâ€ sulla testa del personaggio.Eccellente anche la colonna sonora degna di un lungometraggio cinematografico, con un doppiaggio in italiano da prendere come parametro per un videogame, e le tracce swing, blues e jazz sulla radio in macchina per creare la giusta atmosfera. According to reviews this game is a masterpiece. You would think 98% is instant buy and you won't regret it. People praise how simple and fun it is. Yet I couldn't find anyone with positive review telling how repetitive it is. I'm 1 hour in and already bored. Perhaps they get that dopamine rush while smashing buttons? I have to admit my dopamine system is pretty messed up so maybe that's why I can't fell "fun" while playing it? After first 3 fights you basically saw everything this game has to offer. Howlongtobeat tells me what it takes 11 hours to finish it. I can't imagine myself it playing for the next 10 hours, such agony would hurt me mentally. I wish I could refund it, but I got it through a bundle so I can't. I guess I'll grab those trading cards and call it a day. DO NOT BUY If monotonous games give you headaches!

Un juego de estrategia ambientado en la segunda guerra mundial , donde empiezas con una isla vacia y puedes llegar a construir un imperio. vas ganando batallas del "Modo Historia" o atacando rivales para ganar EXP y monedas del juego con las cuales desbloquear y comprar estructuras para personalizar nuestra isla como mas nos guste. Es una buena opcion para pasar unas cuantas horas prendido a la Pc pero tiene varios puntos negativos que afectan drasticamente las ganas de jugar del usuario: 1Â°: Es un Pay to win en toda forma y te lo muestra desde comienzo hasta fin. 2Â°: Aunque las primeras construcciones no tardan mucho en finalizarse las de niveles mas avanzados pueden llegar a tardar hasta 1/2 dias en construirse lo que desanima al usuario.(obiamente se puede reducir el tiempo de la contruccion pagando dinero real para que finalize al instante). 3Â°: No cuenta con un menu de compra variado y con alternativas , ademas de que las construcciones tardan no tienen variantes asi el usuario puede disfrutar de elegir a gusto sino que simplemente son "X" cantidad de estructuras que desbloqueas y ya esta solo queda seguir subiendo de nivel para comprar mejoras de las estructuras pero con muy pocas variantes para personalizar tu isla. Sinceramente recomiendo este juego para alguien que quiera pasar el rato como me ocurrio ami , pero no mucho mas ya que llegando a cierto nivel no tenes variantes y se hace repetitivo , ademas de ser Pay to win y que las construcciones en niveles altos tardan dias en finalizar. Pero bueno es Free To Play asi que a darle una oportunia no ?.

Conan Exiles Renewed review {Long) Conan Exiles is still in Early Release and has come a long way. My first review was scathing as Memory management was a Real Disaster... that has been changed and is way better now. Previously ConanSandbox process would use 15 of 16Gb of available ram to run ... it now runs on 0.5 to 5gb. It also use to lock on and refuse to stop as the game closed even 10 minutes later without using taskmanager to stop it. That also has improved! Now shutting down easily ... drastic changes!    The frame rate running around in the game is a steady 30 - 45 fps dipping slightly when in large crowded Thrall towns. In around my massive built bases it does dip down to 15 fps although I don't notice any LAG loading issues. Also much better! Conan use to crash Very frequently that has improved as well, still does crash but nowhere near as much. So stability has improved. Building and the variety of building materials has increased. Read more complexity.  The issue of the game attempting to tell me where I cannot build (with a red outline) will almost stop you from being able to place in areas that you should be able to place in.       Better would be if you could place more blocks through each other and to be able to pick up misplaced blocks...  But I guess that is where mods come in that help to make Conan a better place.  Until your forced to totally restart and lose everything you spent months building ... but then it is in EA. All items you can create in game need to be selected as you level as a 'Feat' (Blueprint / engram) lots are created in your inventory, however a good half need to be built in  the various crafting stations.    Currently for me the worst part of Conan is CRAFTING. In my opinion it is still a total mess. Hopefully it gets updated. Half the crafting stations do NOT have any menus with what can be crafted in them ... just a beginners splash screen of where items are put. Each crafting station also has a totally different way of being operated. Some you have to turn on, some you turn on and then select the recipe and then activate the recipe; even others operate automatically when the appropriate items are placed into the start menu.  Of course all this is added to, in that most crafting stations can have thralls placed into them to enhance that station. That includes stations that have show no recipes so what does having a unique thrall set in that station do ... Someone at Fun Com may know. I certainly don't and I've played 500 hours. Can you guess that I avoid crafting and in games I normally Love crafting!  At least in singleplayer you get the admin controls to add items / Npcs so avoiding the need to use all useless crafting stations It is as though each crafting station was designed by a different designer at FunCom and none of them work together!    The new weather has gone through some trials and tribulations. Some of the weathers looks fantastic but we should be able to turn them off in Singleplayer... when building or inside your base.  Weather seems to try to cause issues, where after a couple of hours in game you may get frostbite and be take cold damage. Changing all your clothes to fur armor and suddenly you will go to overheating and suffering Heatstroke, when normally at that spot there's no weather issue. At least playing in Singleplayer you have the admin console to help in situations and without that I wouldn't be playing the game. So although I do play this occassionally and have for 500 hours I still don't recommend it.

I installed this game, ONCE, but it keeps running itself now, and asking for "Administrator Permissions", I of course, tell it NO!

Thief...this one left me with mixed, mostly negative feelings. Overall, the game has potential, but there are just too many broken & repetitive things in the game. Just to name a few examples : the story didn't get my attention, however it wouldn't be that big of a problem if the gameplay would be flawless, which is not at all. The pedestrians and enemies repeat the same lines over and over again, after a few hours you'll get sick of hearing " I think a tooth is coming loose!" or" same nightmares every night!" Their dialogue's sync is so messed up, sometimes one interferes with the other before its supposed to end. Another example is the city, often you have no idea where to go in the side missions, which window  you should peel up, the transitioning is a huge mess. I suffered through the game for the achievements, they were usually late , or never popped up until I restarted the game. There were a few nice things I liked as well, such as the variety of different arrows and the fact that blunt arrows can be used as distractions & trigger switches from a distance. To sum up, I expected much more from the game. I definitely do not recommend this game, my final rating is 4/10.

I got my money worth!  I have moved on.  Don't call, I have deleted your number from my phone.

DATE : 12-Mar-2019  SETUP :  Microsoft Windows 10 64-Bit Microsoft Surface Book 2016 (GTX 965M) Laptop Logitech F710 Gamepad RATING : 40% + for Optimization - for Storytelling + for Immersion  - for Gameplay   - for Value The game ran smooth @1600x900 medium settings with great visual and aural presentation. The voice acting is good enough but the characters and story are really bad. The control and combat mechanics are slow-pacing instead of the usual hack n' slash button mashing. It's actually really fun... HOWEVER... the enemy respawns, and without map or navigation system, you will find yourself backtracking a lot trying to find the main story objective, while killing the same enemy over and over again using the slow-pacing combat system. That's not the only problem. Although the game have beautiful graphics, you basically only get two places to explore, a big castle (complete with burial site, courtyard, catacombs)  and a big temple in another world.

I can put my finger on it, it just feels sterile, a vast empty nothingness, controls are awkward, landing is a pain, the jumpdrive feels weird, kind of takes away from the immersion, I played it with max settings and felt a bit underwhelmed visually. Its a shame really because Ive had this game on my wish list for a long time and was eager to try it but having come from playing no mans sky with all its faults i can say the game play is more fluid then elite dangerous, although comparing them is a bit unfair as elite clearly gears towards simulation style space flying and no mans sky is totally arcady in that sense. I think unless you are into games like X3 you would find it dificult to pick this up and have any amount of fun with it, making money is a total grind and shuttling between stations becomes a shore, and bear in mind a played 109 minutes, became repetitive really quick. Overall 6\10 for me.

Another one of those - Die 9,000 times while navigating this box thing through mazes while avoiding red tiles that murder you plus doing it with very annoying drunk controls/physics that don't listen to your keystrokes. While I do commend the built-in community features such as level building for fellow players, the way this game controls is frustrating and rage inducing. The only pro here is that it's free, so you can try it for yourself.

It's like sitting in a theater in the very front seat... watching this movie. Cutting to the chase, the controls for this game are flawed. They are very sensitive and makes it troubling to be precise during gameplay. Options and optimization are pretty bare-bone, and as a result, you're stuck with very dated and unpleasant graphics and textures. While I give props for Disney Planes: The Video Game being basic (which is good for a game being targetted for a young audience in mind), the game is mostly just going from mission to mission and completing a few tasks. Aside from trying to get a higher score per level, the levels and missions are not interesting enough to go back to previous levels and play again. Overall, this game has a specific audience in mind. Although I think it is a good kids game for its simplicity, there are flaws that makes this game boring and bland, aesthetically and in design.

Screwed up butterfly emblem thing so that I'll lose Quiet after mission 45. So my save is ruined... Yeah I bought into the hype, pre-ordered n all. It's not enough to recommend this game yes or no. My feelings for this game went from super excited to kinda ok to severely disappointed. BESIDES the Kojima-Konami split, BESIDES the cut content controversy, the story of this game is fragmented anti-climax crap, the gameplay rehashes the same garbage over and over again, pointless weapon customization, the buddy system commands seem to only exist because of the tech demos, and insignificant multiplayer (no coop is a missed opprotunity). This is a full price AAA game under what was once a legendary series. I'm not even mad for wasting my money and time with all this, just sad and disappointed with a game ruined by a dev that is too eccentric and out of touch to care about what we loved of Metal Gear, and a publisher that has gotten too greedy, sandwiching crap on a game that, lets face it, relied on name brand alone to even get this popular. 6/10 points

Wish I watched its gameplay video before buying it.  Battle royale, not my type of genre.  Even in CS:GO I don't play BR game mode.

Are you a complete newbie to this game?  Prepare to be completely dumped on by the remaining vets on the server. There were some very good parts to the game.  If you have VR, its an amazing experience.  The co-op vs AI can be fun with friends as well.  The land and water based fights are pretty basic but also good fun.   However, I got the game for the pvp air fights.  Unfortunately, the battle queue system puts you up against vehicles of the same level, it is not based on player experience.  Most games I played on the NA server i found myself flying towards battle for about 5-10 minutes but then being shot down within 3-4 seconds by the vets (who seem to be the majority of players left on the servers).  Those 5-10 minutes of flying into battle... top notch in vr.  The 'not getting the real chance to fight and improve at pvp', not so great.

Plz Dont get this game, I bought it when it was like 85 percent off, and I feel like I got ripped off, i should be payed a dollar for playing this game, Stephen Hawking can run better than the child or this game can in general

is a match-three game in a dungeon crawler skin, and also a sort of endless runner. The gameplay consists in matching different pieces as your character runs through a randomly generated dungeon. If you face an enemy, match swords; if you find chests, match keys, and so on. It's not really endless  , as sooner or later you'll hit a wall and won't be able to progress until you grind for upgrades.  First off, I'm a weird gamer. I'm one of those who enjoy grinding (for real!), but the grinding in this game is so forced, unfun and disgusting that I gave up. A regular run will take you about two minutes (or five minutes if you're lucky and end up getting a good board). Now, you may think that six hours played is too little, but think about how many two minutes runs I had. Now let me tell you: I feel like I'm not even near the endgame. I tried to enjoy 10,000,000 as a podcast game, but honestly, it feels like work. There are many other interesting podcast games out there.  I got this game for 90% off, so I got my money's worth. While I feel bad giving a negative review for an indie developer, on the other hand I feel bad for those who might waste their time and patience with this game. Even if you intend to play on mobile, there are much better match-three games out there, including free ones. Sorry dev, but you missed the mark here.  * Easy to pick up and play * Nice soundtrack and sound effects * Skill won't matter too much * So grindy that even a grindy gamer can't approve it * The gameplay is too chaotic for a match-three game * You will achieve little by little, but in the end it isn't fun

I've tried to love it. The game has an amazing soundtrack, deep and unusual setting, but the core gameplay is boring. And there are some points that are critical to me. I requested for a refund in case of it. - The map is not interesting to explore - it's huge and empty. Interiors are the same. Some of the houses are locked and it's impossible to get in.  - AI is pretty dumb. Sometimes machines are pushing you, sometimes just stay where they are while you are shooting them. They also lose you when you come into a house literally in front of them.  I can't even say it's genre is survival. There's fast travel, no death penalty, difficult scaling, crafting system - nothing of all the things I expect for the survival games.

Better than the first one. Music is better, and the narrator has a nice voice who actually speaks english this time. Some sort of attempt at at story. Felt most of the talk still was just nonsense. +autowalk!! Was going to give this thumbs up... BUT, the landscape is too repetitive with little to no landmarks. And also the music got repetitive. Should have more tracks. Often too long areas with no music or voice. Just sound of rain, too much walking got tedious. AND i experienced a bug where I hit an invisible wall. I thought i had went wrong and it was the end of map. Spent way too long backtracking and walking in circles before I reloaded last checkpoint and suddenly got somewhere. But because of the repetitive landscape I couldnt tell much difference from where I was and were I got loaded to. This happened on both paths. The second time it happened it was more obvious because she moved way too slow and couldnt jump anymore. Lastly, no the paths were not much different at all.

One of the worst Tower Defense game I have ever seen in my life... As a fan of the genre, I don't understand why this game is on Steam to start with. It looks like a school project that you find on a dusty USB key and try for 2 minutes. Then you have a laugh about it and you show it to your friends and you throw that USB key back into that old box you found it in. Seriously though, three types of tower, no clicking away to close the tower menu, no cooldown for what I understand are tower abilities...? They even realized the game isn't playable and added a button to automatically unlock all achievements. Such a shame, because I love TD games...

"Maturo" " e "contenuto sessuale" sono non poco fuorvianti visto che di sessuale a parte le tipe mezze nude ( e rimangono mezze nude ) non ha nulla e di maturo lasciamo perdere.  Hanno avuto almeno la decenza di togliere un'etichetta che aveva il primo capitolo, ovvero "simulazione"; visto che come summenzionato Ã¨ praticamente una presentazione power point, direi che hanno fatto bene. Mi dispiace in un certo senso, perchÃ© qualche miglioria l'ho vista, ma ne sconsiglio l'acquisto.  Il cuore di una visual novel Ã¨ la sceneggiatura, se quella non funziona anche se il resto Ã¨ discreto ( o accattivante in questo caso :P ), alla fine finisce che tutto crolla come un castello di carte. La posso massimo massimo consigliare a qualcuno che vuole qualcosa di leggerissimo per passare il tempo o a qualche pre-adolescente alla prima esperienza con un opera ecchi. Se siete dei fan dei Sakura, questo Ã¨ un sottoprodotto ed Ã¨ meglio virare su altri che non avete ancora provato.

Absolutely disgusting. This game has it all, and definately not in a good way. If you like: -cheap, predictable scares which 9/10 don't scare at all (unless you find low-polly copy and paste enemies in predictable areas to be scary) - terrible combat that has you missing enemies just inches from your face - Absolutely no difficulty. The only way you can die to these one-trick ponies is if you stand still like a pre-pubscent teen during homecoming. -Terrible voice acting that actually relies on youtubers in order to push its way throught the heaps of â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ indie games that release by the hour. -Gigantic fetch quest. Honestly this has to be a â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ joke. Most of this game is fetching after parts for some machine, pushing levers so doors open, pressing objects in a specific order in a limited amount of time, etc. These fetch quests make the game feel like it was never meant to be a game, rather it was an idea/story that was malformed to fit a games blueprint. -A super vague story. This seems to be all the rave nowadays in indie titles and we as humans are suckered into the mysterious (same way we are interested in the paranormal, space as a whole, afterlife, etc.) -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Bendy and the Ink Machine is a poor excuse of a game that feeds off the common interest of mystery and is better suited in a different artform rather than a game.

Gioco dimmerda fatto da un community di russi dimmerda. Ovviamente (a parte qualche santo) nessuno vuol pickare support e spera di vincere con 5 carry. Va peggio quando le persone ragequittano perchÃ¨ non gli lasciano mid o quando il jungler rimane in giungla per 40 minuti e quando esce l'altro team ha anche il courier farmato. Di bello c'Ã¨ che nei tornei dove si vincono i sghei i commentatori urlano. Editreview (per chi non Ã¨ consono ai termini del gioco): nessuno sceglie un personaggio per supportare il team, tutti voglio uccidere e per come Ã¨ concepito il gioco, se si scelgono 5 personaggi in questa maniera 9 su 10 si perde. In definitiva, il gioco (almeno per quel che riguarda la parte dove si giocano partite matchmaking con persone a caso) Ã¨ dominato dall'egoismo personale (cit. Matteo Montesi). Proprio oggi un Invoker mid si vantava del fatto di aver avuto Midas a 7 minuti (ovviamente freefarmando) mentre le altre linee erano state stuprate dai gank avversari. Ovviamente partita persa in 20 minuti. Consiglio il gioco? Ho risposto no, almeno se non lo giochi con un gruppo di amici o ti piace ascoltare il russo.

NOT RECOMMENDED Ratings 2/10 I played and love the original game which deserved a rating of 9/10. However, the re-release of the game with better graphics is a sad fiasco. I bought the game on the first day of the re-release (Sep 8) and it crashed more than 10 times in about 2 hours of game play, averaging a crash every 10 minutes. Many other games are also having similar problems as evident by the posting on the discussion forums. This is still a great game, and I will change the rating when the developers come up with a patch to address the random crashes.

Firstly, I want to say that this is my opinion rather than a recommendation. And I think it's up to you to decide whether to take new CoD.         I did not play much, but it was enough to me to understand that this is the same Call of Duty MP as last year and a year earlier and all the past years of Call of Duty series. There's nothing new, (Yes they added a new mode (cool)), but it's just a reskin of the past series. Personally, I think that the CoD MP became â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥, not to mention the Quickscopers and everycorner campers (this is another story), I do not remember when I last time enjoyed the CoD MP, maybe it's not for me anymore. I think that some fanboy's will not agree with me but it's their right, their decision, they enjoy multiplayer and let it be!         Do not get me wrong, I love CoD SP part, but the same multiplayer every year, sorry but no!

I'm writing this review of Flight Sim World as a flight simulation enthusiast since 1979. After obversing Flight Sim Worlds development over the last few months it's clear that this will be an extremely expensive ride for those that wish to take advantage of what the extra memory available for addons that will be provided by the move to this 64bit update to Microsoft's FSX.  I am prepared to spend considerable money, and have done so over many years with FSX and X-Plane to get the most authentic, interesting and fun experience I can in flight simulation. I'm not sure how many engineers, modellers and artists Dovetail have working on this sim but I don't think it's very many and it's clear every little feature that will advance the product to the quality we've all come to expect will be provided by 3rd parties at 20-40 dollars a pop.  Buying addons like this is fine (and necessary) on an old stable engine but on a new release? What are they bringing to the table? Currently, apart from a few minor enhancements and a huge amount of lost content it seems it's just a DLC store on steam. For those of you who don't play Train Simulator, Dovetail have clearly demonstrated their lack of interest in product quality and passion for their craft by their treatment of the train simulation community over the years. They have produced copious amounts of generic, often low quality content at extreme prices on a very unstable engine that constantly breaks existing purchases that often never get fixed.  Train Simulator only becomes fun for me when buying buying 3rd party products mostly from a small number of vendors who really care about train simulation and have the ability to develop addons that reflect that care. In addition the workshop (which I'm sure they will advertise for FSW  as a major feature as well) is an absolute nightmare to use and finding content that will work with my existing trainsim purchases is a way too much work to bother with.  Nearly every scenario to download from the workshop for trains and routes I own requires about $100 or more worth of DLC purchases to work. I for one have no faith in this company to execute on developing a platform that I want to invest in. If they win out I think we're in for an incedibly mediocre and frustrating flight simming life over the next decade.  I would wait to see what's in the base product at release day before making a purchase of Flight Sim World and its DLC. The fundumental problem with Dovetails strategy on Train Simulator is to force yearly upgrades to the latest versions. By a competent company this might work but with Dovetail this provides an unstable and moving target that is always buggy and always breaking existing purchases. It's a stupid strategy that has already proven horrible for customers and I'm expecting they will implement the same release strategy for FSW. I received this product for free when Dovetails Flight School was cancelled. I certainly would not pay for it and after a quick look at what was on offer I have no interest in playing it at this time. Let's all be smart about this and wait until they actually have a final product we can evaulate before making DLC purchases.   FSX came with considerable content on it's release day as part of the base product which has now been removed, will Flight Sim World come with considerabe content as part of the base product? Please, let's make them work for our money by forcing them to make a high quality product that actually advances our experience as flight simulation enthusiasts. I'm extremely worried we'll see a repeat of Train Simulator for flight simming, believe me, we do not want that.

Ran into an encounter were all the heroes were 500, so I snatched alot of them using the steel I saved up on. Then spent real money into a character I really digged. Then the next few days, they were all locked with the fee of unlocking them AGAIN for 7500 this time. So it being the steel I spent on buying the characters and the real money behind one of them locked, I was a little angarian. After having a nice conversation with one of the employees over a chat to fix this, the only solution was to give me was an xp and steel booster for 3 days, little knowing that the 5 dollars i put in was worth actually worth a little over 7 DAYS. So not only did I lose money, but I lost alot I had saved up on. Idc if it was a bug, glitch, or etc. But all I know is that I lost money to this. <insert sad face here>

I've played up to the slaughterhouse, but then gave up on it.  My main frustration with the game are it's simplistic puzzle and stealth segments, which never were deep enough that I felt satisfied when I completed them. They are okay, but are boring to me. The first ~5-10 hours of Hunt are the most magical, in my opinion. Maybe it was beginner's luck on my end, though, so I don't know for certain if that'll be a constant for you as well. Getting immersed in the beautifully crafted world is easy to do, and playing during the Nighttime is positively scary for the first couple of runs. It was awesome, and It was an entertaining experience that hooked me from the start. That's where the problems begin, unfortunately. Setting such an expositionary precedent doesn't do it any favors. Once you experience the uncertainty and mystery of the game world a couple of times, it starts to lose that aforementioned uncertainty. You start learning where things are, what mobs spawn when and where, and what the most frequently used strategies are for other players. If you'd like, I'd skip over the next paragraph because I'll be going over what a lot of players do and potentially ruin some of the expositionary surprises you might get. The boss can spawn literally anywhere, which is a good thing in theory, but not necessarily the most fun in practice. Some people can just get lucky and stumble upon the boss immediately, which gives them an obvious advantage for the rest of the match. The popular strategy for a lot of players is to find the boss & simply idle outside of its aggression range until another group of players gets there, OR just wait until another group kills the boss so that they get to keep the bounty for themselves. I can't tell you how often I played duos and upon killing the boss, I get headshotted immediately with no time to react & no possible way to have survived the initial bullet. Headshots, if the damage system works the same way it did when I played, are always an instant kill unless certain shots are used. It's realistic but also incredibly frustrating when you die repeatedly to players with good aim with almost no chance of retaliating meaningfully. But this is how this game is designed, and It's a high-risk high-reward type of game. The progression is also, unfortunately, death-based. You get certain account-wide unlockables through your bloodline, and that's fine and dandy, but annoying when your best-gear equipped hunter gets headshotted by a level 1 player and effectively erases 1-2 hours' worth of grinding. It's not an unentertaining grind, but it's a grind nonetheless. If you're okay with risking that amount of progress each and every match, it might be a positive for you. It certainly makes the game tenser, and subtly forces you to play more cautiously. Another big issue that this game has is the content draught issue. Crytek barely releases any actual content. There hasn't been a new boss added to this game since early 2019. Similarly, they haven't added a new map in ages, and all they continually do is release weapons or skins for guns or hunters. They sometimes release small mechanics here and there, but overall, nothing major and nothing enough to revitalize the game and make it fresh. Also, be warned that this game doesn't have a reconnect feature because Crytek apparently thinks that developing such a feature is unnecessary and would "take resources to make"... You can already see what's wrong with this line of thought. So if your game crashes (and it will), then you would forfeit the game, and your character dies, and your equipment would all be gone. A feature that most modern games have is missing in a game that's inherently unstable when it comes to optimization. The game looks alright, but It's terribly optimized. It's definitely playable, but disappointing when you realize it doesn't look a whole lot better than what you've already seen in the CRYSIS series. The matchmaking is also bad, and getting into matches (which you can immediately die in) can sometimes take on the upwards of five minutes. With a game that so easily dishes out mortality, it can get to be a bit of a slog.  The sound is excellent in this game and is an integral part of the game; everything in this game makes noise. You need to be very careful and listen closely to everything because this game doesn't miss a beat when it comes to sound, so being stealthy in this game is a must if you don't want enemy players figuring out where you are because even the simplest thing as walking over glass can make a very prominent noise. Overall, the sound is great, and I have no complaints about it.  I don't regret purchasing the game because I did have my fun with it. Had Crytek used that money to address the game's lingering balancing issues, adding a reconnect feature, and most importantly, adding actual new content like new bosses, enemies, and maps, then this game would have been genuinely great. It's shown that potential each and every time I've played it since I purchased it. But sadly, Crytek only releases new weapons and skins with small features every now and then without releasing any meaningful content. Overall, I can't recommend this game, and if you still want to buy it to test it out, at least get it while it's on sale because the extra money you give to Crytek by buying it at full price will only go to waste.
