I personally wouldn't completely recommend this game anymore. Unfortunately though, I have to recommend it as the only okay Voxel Zombie Survival game on Steam. It has great reviews, but I assume that's because it's currently the only game that combines full voxel physics with sandbox zombie horde based gameplay; And because of that, most people cling to it with a death grip. If we looked past it's unique game play however, we'd find it's a mess of systems that you would likely find on a bare-bones Unity game. For example, gun mechanics, they haven't changed all that much ever since the games creation. Menu system could do with an update graphically and "behind the scenes". Zombie A.I is okay, they do kind of sniff you out while you're certain that you're fairly hidden. Which I can understand, but it's a mechanic that seems to go un-explained. Meaning, there's no scent meter for the player or sound meter, just a visibility meter (a17). Vehicles... Well again with the base unity store assets looking and handling. This is only a few things, could go into further detail if needed but I don't see a point too. I really did not want to tear this game apart, I can see the hard work and dedication put into this game every update but the game has just reached that point now where I don't see a grand future for it. (At least within the next few years)  This games been on steam for damn near 5 years... I understand that games take time, but this is snails pace compared to other indi games. (Rust, Factorio, The Forest).  I love the ambition behind this game, but at this current time, I would not recommend buying 7 Days to Die. Maybe wait until some better updates, or wait for a sale at the very least.

Not gonna lie, making the download time count towards "time played" is kinda scummy.  Unlike many others, my download went fine. Downloaded 90 gigs in about 1.5 hours. Download only froze once, but was fixed by relaunching the game.  I only got the standard edition but seems anyone who bought Deluxe or Premium got the same content as me.  Will probably change the review once these issues are fixed, but right now its not looking great.

Along with paying the 20$ for the game to jump in with limited content is kind of bs, basically forcing you to have to pay if you want anything over standard operators. Toxic snowflake community, servers are ungodly slow and hit-reg is questionable. If you want to live long, don't play this game. See what you can find on the net     Ubisoft doesn't mind at all. Balancing for the operators is centered around how pro league players play rather than how the the playerbase plays a majority of the time. Save whatever amount of money you're gonna spend on this somewhere else.

Absolute garbage. Controls are awkward and can't be remapped. Time limit prevents any thought to planning your run. Hit boxes are completely borked -- The air near your character will come into contact with the air near a saw and you'll die. Control during jumps (and height of jumps) is insufficient, given the hit box issue. You're also forced to run it in full screen, creating some weird proportions for those of us running ultra wide. Everything about this game is bad. If you have it, the only reason to tolerate this junk is to go for another +1 to your 100% achievement stat. Spend your time playing another game. You'll thank me later.

This game is early access.  As an avid fan of the guild series, I would not recommend this game at the current stage of development.  To simply put it many of the 'core' features that make the 'guild' are not there.  Romance, shop automation, and other aspects of the game are there but not functioning.   Many 'click' events such as dragging inventory, or crafting do not register the first time.  Shop management suffers the same issues with assigning workers tasks, or stopping a task and giving them another.  I really hope these things get fixed quickly, as in a month or so, because I've been dying for a new game, but this is simply NOT playable, and this is coming from an avid fan of this game's series.

Hola muy buenas gente. Quiero comenzar diciendo que este juego ME ENCANTA, lo sigo desde su kickstarter (hablamos que ya han pasado 4 aÃ±os, al inicio no estaban en Steam, luego si y luego se aliaron con Bandai para bien o mal). El juego es genial, un juego de cartas con un combate estrategico y por turnos, un estilo grafico precioso, una animaciones hermosas. Un buen lore aunque dificil de seguir por la manera en como te lo presentan (hay una "biblioteca" donde leer o escuchar mucho texto), no existe un modo "campaÃ±a" en si y tampoco era la idea original. El juego es una delicia, entonces porque no lo recomiendo Â¿?. Tristemente el juego es como una "arcade" de monedas, esta echo al 1000% para sacarle dinero a los usuarios como humana e inhumanamente les sea posible. En el juego hay "jefes" que son controlados por la IA con un capacidad muy alta para derrotarnos pero si uno les derrota recibe una recompensa. Â¿Todo perfecto verdad? pues no, porque para abrir esa recompensa hay que comprar una llave con dinero real y asÃ­ para todo hasta lo que uno gana debe pagarlo con mucho $$$$$. Esto hace al juego un gran pay to win, pues quien ponga dinero real para comprar expansiones y diamantes (dinero de el juego) superara con facilidad a quien no lo haga por mas habilidad que uno pueda o no tener. Es una pena un juego con tanto buen arte fuera convertido en una minita de oro que sobre explotar para Counter Play. Recomiendo Duelyst solo por diversiÃ³n y si no piensas gastar nada ni te importa perder 9 de cada 10 peleas porque tu oponente dejo ir unos $50 o mas en el juego. Yo le di $15 a este juego por las horas que me entretuvo y consegui cerca de nada con ese dinero. Claro que no puedo recomendar Duelyst a alguien que lo quiera jugar seriamente, hay que estar sobrado de dinero. Ultimo detalle, todo sobre el juego esta en ingles digo eso como algo a tomar en cuenta no como algo negativo en si.

Recommend: Nope. Not even for .49 cents.  I've played a lot of indie B flick horror games cause I enjoy the genre. I figured negative reviews or not this would still have something to enjoy. I was wrong.  First I had to use third party software to lock the mouse to the game window to avoid my other 3 monitors but at least it did stretch to 2560x1080. Not that it helped visually. The game is dark and the flashlight doesn't seem to work as shown in screenshots.  A few comparison snips for your own judgement.  Definitely not the flashlight coverage shown in the store screenshots.  In a room with some chairs and a small TV.  The chairs in back light up from all angles, but the ones closest to me do not. Nor is there a ring of light as most dark games with flashlights.  Doors stand out pretty nicely as does blood splatter :D: but you can't see much in the halls to know where you can or can't walk. So lot's of getting stuck in objects as its just blackness.  Upstairs view next to a railing looking down at the bad guy. Makes finding his location nice, but you're still fighting the environment like Pitch Black or The Chronicles of Riddick :happypirate:  So getting past the visual, we have our bad   creature that chases you. Wow is he sensitive! If i moved before he came down the stairs and walked off in the opposite direction he was coming at me. Granted he is slow so you have that to your advantage. At one point he was upstairs and I turned my flashlight on downstairs and he came after me as well. So it seems even if it doesn't do much for you, it certainly helps to conclude your game faster. Reset back to the menu to try again.

Ubisuck

The original Deus Ex is considered one of the greatest PC games ever made, this title pretty much nearly killed the franchise. I finally played and finished 16 years after release. Also, the developer behind Deus Ex games was shut down soon after this mess. Invisible War has to be one of the most disappointing sequels of all time. Much of this is, again, the result of having been designed and tailored for the original Xbox hardware in mind (which were insanely limited by PC standards of the day especially for a game like this). Ion Storm managed to take all good things that made original so special and decided to cash into sci-fi genre. There is almost no cause and effect like in the original title, no weight in your choices. Much of the cyberpunk feeling is pretty much gone! The art direction felt very cartoonish and colorful. Everything in this game feels rushed, from the dialogue, the story, the graphics, the controls, even the voice acting, HUD and item screens. -Horrible level design, pretty much all levels feel and look the same. The levels Similarly, the outdoor environments are claustrophobic, and there's never many characters onscreen at any one time. -Invisible War gives you a miserly five bio-mod slots to fill. -The developers decided to remove the hacking skill, and along with it the fantastic ability to read private emails from all the computers you can find. It was one of the best ways the original fleshed out its fantastic story. Now itâ€™s replaced with automatic hacking.  -Enemy AI is dumb regardless of difficulty setting. Gameplay balance between Alex and enemies is strangely weird and messy. Initially the game is extremely easy but enemies become op very fast during the final act of the story. Itâ€™s like every bad guy drank Red Bull at the end. Also, you get very less ammo for the last mission.  -No-kill run or 100% stealth playthrough is probably impossible in this game imo because of the advanced level enemy types encountered in the game with tough body armor. There is also no bio-mod that lets you sneak past human enemies (there is one but only for bots). A bit disappointing because playing Human Revolution this way was hella fun!!  -Your actions result in no consequences for committing undesirable actions against factions other than ending.  -Excessive loading screens despite lacking large open world environments that were present in the first game.  -Requires fan made patches and mods to make the game work just right on modern PCs. -Screen resolution wonâ€™t go higher than 1280x1024 for me. - The devs have acknowledged the original Deus Ex ending(s). Some of the coolest as well as minor characters from the original also make an appearance!  -There are many references to the first game including some locations and landmarks.  -Serviceable story and voice acting. There are also plenty of side quests.  -There are some cool factions here (incl. Knights Templars and Order of the Church xD)  -Universal ammo, yes it means no more messing around rearranging ammo in your inventory, plus you could choose to use the same gun throughout the whole game should you prefer to do that.  -There is a surprising amount of voice acting in this game incl. fully voiced protagonists (male/female) as in Fallout 4/Mass Effect/Saints Row/ games.  -Combat is something that I feel was an improvement. -Graphics are decent for a 17-year-old game. -Should appeal to old school gamers that like futuristic, sci-fi games. -Soundtrack was fine. -Multiple endings. Most of them were satisfying (I checked out alternate endings on YouTube). -Cinematics are well done (cutscenes were very important back then; both for presentation and marketing).  The original Deus Ex from 2000 is one of the greatest PC games of all time and addressing why itâ€™s so special would take hours of explaining. Itâ€™s not that Invisible War is a bad game by any means (itâ€™s really a decent game but as a huge fan of Deus Ex series this is far below my expectations. If this is your first Deus Ex game then you might even love this game!! Itâ€™s a good sci-fi shooter. Itâ€™s nothing to be ashamed of. Itâ€™s just that this game was a huge letdown after the excellent original. It was really hard not to look back and keep comparing these two games as a fan. There was so much potential, they had the budget, they had the technology! Half Life 2, Halo 2, Doom 3, Far Cry, SW:KOR, Thief 3 were proof of concepts that making games with high production values wasnâ€™t impossible in 2004.  Since IW is canon to Deus Ex official timeline it becomes a little hard to not recommend this game but if youâ€™re a fan of the original you owe it to yourself to try it once.

I normally love story-driven walking simulators, but I found this game to be very boring, a bit creepy, and incredibly depressing. I do have to at least commend the developers on the BEAUTIFUL graphics and the great writing, but if you've ever struggled with depression in your life, don't play this game - it will send you spiraling into a dark place as it's very focused on the meaning of life and death. But if you're somebody who thinks they can handle it and wants to just sit and enjoy something casual, then this may be a good game for you.

The game keeps crashing after saving manual/autosave in Whitechappel after dialogue with a doctor about a particular scalpel. I've tried to update Nvidia drivers and different video settings, playing in windowed mode keeping only 2 saves, as some players suggested on the forum but nothing helped, A lot of people experiencing this particular problem with all of Sherlock Holmes games from Grogwares save for a few early games in the series. Something isn't right with the game engine and in-game saving system! Unfortunately, It seems as if the guys from Frogwares don't give a damn about this whole situation!! I am so disappointed because this game definitely has a potential ..   . I don't recommend to buy games from Frogwares because you might as well experience this issue thus you'll be unable to finish any of them.  I've found a solution! I was playing in windowed mode and keeping only two save files. I've definitely tweaked something else but I don't remember what exactly. Apart from this, the game's really good. Interesting and sometimes quite challenging puzzles Sadly, the story is quite trivial and hardly engaging. Oh, often puzzles are repetitive. For example, many characters in the game have either boxes or cases with codes or some tricky mechanisms you have to decipher or solve in order to open them.  Nevertheless, I do recommend this game!

Crackhead fornite version of Nba2k, terrible , horrible game. You might as well get an only fans and save some money for nba2k21. If you wanna play it then get ready to waste money on special characters cause without them your opponents will mop the floor with you and probably use you as a public toilet after the match too. Even then, it's not worth your money, full of bugs like perhaps getting the ball snatched from your hands when you're 20 meters away from the guy marking you. Like I get he's a pg but last time I checked they couldn't steal the ball with a magnetic pull like some sort of basketball superhero. Pretty much filled with cheaters boosting their attributes all the way up or god know's what else. I never thought I would say this but even easy anti cheat does a better job of taking care of cheaters than you, and that is something you should be ashamed of. The characters look like cocaine addicts that just escaped from the rehabilitation center, vengeful and angry at the client that snitched on him, probably has a knife hidden in his sock. Something that I find stupid is how this game allows people to put on gigantic outfits and enormous characters that cover half of the screen, how the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ am I supposed to get a rebound on this guy if all I see is his big chungus ass. Y'all couldn't even spare 20 minutes of your life explaining how the game works, I had my teammates explain how the hell cards and all the other useless â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ works because you were obviously too busy sniffing each others butt to see which one smelled more like rotten â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥, and the answer is both. Im personally ashamed of having wasted 42 precious hours of my life on this garbage, 35 of them were me trying to understand why the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ my abilities dont work and then I finally understood why, some of them simply dont work or these retarded devs wrote a description thinking it was a different ability. I was 10 years old when I created a lobby, I am now 67 with two grown up kids, a dead wife and a bunch of cats. If it weren't that these two people in my lobby that have a weird resemblance to shaggy aren't actual players but bots. I think you'll have more luck finding a job and the love of your life than filling a lobby in this game, and if you do manage to fill a lobby, get prepared because you're getting roasted by your teammates. Just 20 minutes prior to this review I got called â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ and useless waste of oxygen despite me being the only one who scored, the player base is basically 10 years old with arthritis who can't play basketball in real life so they vent on people who aren't physically impeded like them on freestyle 2. Overall I had a lot of emotions playing this game, such as severe depression, suicidal thoughts, and I'll admit it, sometimes even homicidal ones. If you have depression, which most gamers have let's be real, stay away from this game unless you want to become the talentless version of Billie Eyelash.

Rating: 2/5 I brought this game because of the overwhelming amount of positive reviews but it turns out to be disappointing. The kind of game play it has reminds me of games I used to play on mobiles 10 years back. And I wonder what made developers to think of such old mobile  gaming concept to PC. I've only played this for few hours but I already feel kinda bored.  First of all you play the game viewing from top. So you cant even see characters properly. Secondly almost 80% of game is you driving around and racing. The rest of the game is blowing â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ around and stealing things. All that driving around and navigating is already putting a strain on my hand and that's exactly what I hate about these top view games. Some people might find this game interesting but this is not for me.

I pre-ordered DOOM ETERNAL to delight myself with the sequel to the great DOOM 2016. But things turned out to be not so rosy. DOOM ETERNAL just refused to start. Whatever I did, downloaded a new driver, cleared the cache, reinstalled Windows, damn it, nothing helped. It seems to me that the point is not in the system requirements of the game, because DOOM 64 also decided not to start. There were no errors when launching, even the game screen was not there. What is the problem? God Himself does not know this. On the main computer, the game did not start, but on the other everything is fine. But on my computer, which was supposed to play DOOM ETERNAL at a high level, I could not play. The game is good, but I will not forget the problem described above. I am no longer going to pre-order the game from Bethesda. It seems to me that it makes no sense to write a review about the game itself, since more than 70,000 players have already done it. The game is really very good and enjoyable. The developers did a great job, made it better and harder. I liked everything, from optimization to the plot. But whatever one may say, the problem that is higher - ruined everything. I also wrote a review about the DLC for Doom Eternal - it's trash! (be sure to look)

Don't buy this game. Everything is broken, the controls, the sounds, the enemy AI is boring and completely ridicilous. On top of that, the 'build' gimmick is pointless, you have endless health and if you get stuck even ONCE on any object, you get stuck on it forever, followed by an orgy of enemies rocketting at you until you're forced to start a new game. Apparantly the dev has been buying negative reviews as well, which is something I could possibly confirm, but that would be entirely pointless, because the game has such poor credibility that I don't need anybody to confirm this. If you have to sell your game at -90%, you know something's wrong. Still crashes... and crashes... and crashes. Sadly, I delete it from my library. ... ... Now...looking at Riders Of Icarus. Now... looking for a PS4 and a GAEMS Vanguard or Sentry. Now... I am still certain that WoW might still be better than risking my time to play Wildstar.

I was having quite a lot of fun with this until about 6 hours in, when I got matched with someone who has clearly spent a fair amount of money in the store - full set of cosmetics, and a deck in which literally every card out damaged my own and seemingly every other card had devastating synergies and combos. I don't begrudge my opponent for buying his way to a shockingly glorious deck, indeed it was fun to get a glimpse into what the endgame of Gwent probably looks like, but I really take issue with the game matching me against him where the outcome was all but predetermined.

Love the puzzle quest games and the theme on this but wish it had a cloud save function so different computers don't have different save points. Your heroes seem to be located only on the machine that you are playing on. The Steam version saves only local content. There's also some other annoying items like some screens don't scroll down for me to get to information below. I'd also recommend that if you do plan on investing time in the game to actually play the mobile version. That version will save a copy of your characters to Facebook and allow you to play across multiple devices. The Steam version does not. It's good for me to just kill time. Don't expect to go very far into the game unless you want to deal with microtransactions.

Der Singelplayer-Modus ist vollgepack mit spannenden Missionen und einer brillianten Story, welche ich jedem nur ans Herz legen kann. Man kann den Singelpayer-Modus sogar noch mit tollen Modifikationen erweitert, welches das Spielerlebnis deutlich verbessern kann. Im Online-Modus sieht das wiederum ganz anders aus.  Die Ã–ffentlichen Lobbys sind von Kopf bis FuÃŸ mit Moddern, kleinen Kindern und anderen Gestalten vollgepackt, deren Ziel es schlicht und ergreifend ist, einem den SpielspaÃŸ zu verderben. Dies verleiht dem Online-Modus eine sehr schlechte AtmosphÃ¤re. Hinzu kommt noch, dass fast alle GegenstÃ¤nde wie z.B Autos deratrig teuer sind, dass man gar nicht mehr um Shark-Cards und deren verbundenen Kosten herumkommt.  Ich kann den Singelplayer-Mode voll und ganz Empfehlen aber lasst die Finger vom Online-Modus!!!

I've been playing this game since the day it came out. It was supposed to be a remaster of Contract Wars, Absolutsoft's browser fps. And it was just that, for a while -- A balanced and fun shooter with a less arcadey feel than most other fps games that I've played. However, the game was super buggy, and it died quickly since it was a paid game, while Contract Wars was f2p. Fast forward 3 years, and the game has been ""remade"" several times, each straying further and further from what made Contract Wars so great. Now, we have a generic, buggy, and unbalanced game that is now arcadey in all the wrong places, while still retaining features that shouldn't be in an arcade fps. This game might be fun for a dozen hours, but as a veteran who only has access to high level servers, the game is overriden by people who abuse OP weapons and attachments, and know exactly where to camp on every level, so that the conquest game mode is unwinnable for one of the teams. If you live in North America, have fun playing on 200 ping servers as you get sniped from behind walls. 4/10. ps, they've been ignoring the feedback from non russians, such as myself, although me and a few other people have put in 300+ hours and know what this game needs more than most of the other players.

The developer goes out of their way to explain that it's "not a game, but an aesthetic concept". Ok, I get that. OutDrive hits a lot of marks - compelling artstyle, pretty great music and it runs well to boot, but in the end it actually is a game in the sense that you need to control a car and keep it between a number limiting factors, namely the road edges and the upper and lower speed limits. Sadly, this part just isn't fun. Devs, if you want me to hear (and potentially buy) your music and you choose to package it in the form of a game, then you'll need to make the game component compelling as well, especially since I'm forced to actively play the game in order to hear the music.

Erwin's Timewarp is an Adventure game in which you control the dog named Erwin, the pet of the scientist Dr. Zachory. He has invented a time machine with that Erwin was transferred to the time 1984 by accident You control a dog in the middle of nowhere and without any background story behind. There is an alien that seems to be your friend and some guys that try to kill you. You must collect objects to use them somewhere, and control your stamina and food bars to survive because in other case you die. Graphics are in 3D using isometric prespective. You move the dog using keys and you take and use objects using mouse Music and sounds are inexistent The game has achivements and trading cards. Sincerely, after three hours, i haven't found any reason to return to the game. Maybe, hardcore adventurers will return the dog back to the future, but I don't Thanks to Shade00

Little Nighmares : Review + First Thoughts What an amazing game, I had a super fun time and I had blast playing it for the short time I did. This game has a unique art style that is very dark and spooky, and it really made the game.  On the other hand I beat this game under 2 and a half hours and for the $15 - $20 price tag depending if you get it on sale, is not worth the small amout of playtime you get with it, plus it doesn't have much replay value. I was really hoping for this game to last a bit longer. My personal rating for this game Art Design 4.5 / 5 Gameplay 4.5 / 5 Playtime 1 / 5 Story 1 / 5

So on paper, and in reviews as it seems, this game is decent. In reality, everything this game does it does poorly.  I'm going to start off with what this game is mostly composed of, which is combat. And let me tell you, combat in this game is surprisingly awful. All the guns feel, sound and look like toys. Recoil while ADSing with them makes me nauseous, half the time I was trying to just hip fire to make it less unpleasant.  Guns in this game, sadly, are incredibly bland and generic as well. They all feel pretty much the same with the distinction between ARs, SMGs, Pistols, and shotguns. And only the last one feels somewhat powerful (sometimes). I guess it wouldn't be such a big downside if this game wasn't so reliant on constant, repetitive, wave-based combat. Now granted there are some "progression" missions where you progress through a map, but they are just as tedious as all the environments are incredibly boring and bland. You also get 3 girls that "help" you in combat, but honestly, the only reason they are there is so that you can have secks with them to replenish HP of both you and the girls. Alternatively, you can wait for their HP to drain completely and watch them get abused by the undead if you're some sort of a weirdo. When it comes to sexual content this game is brought down by the lack of any artistic design, and what we're left with is awkward animations and textures straight from oblivion, on top of that this game comes with complimentary censorship that is pretty bad. I suppose one positive is that there's a fairly decent amount of different scenes, and animations with different actors, like if you're into watching an anime girl get impregnated by a giant worm and then have her head smashed you might like this, otherwise it's just kinda weird. When it comes to story from what I gathered there's a zombie virus that makes girls have secks with you to "heal" themselves or whatever, but to be fair I just skipped 90% of the dialogue.  And I finished all of the content this game has to offer within 2.3 hours.  To summarize this, as fun as it might seem at first I'm fairly certain that most players will find the content of this game to be simply quite boring. I struggle to really picture the target demographic for this title too; it's for people that like to read a lot, like to shoot guns, like to "work" for secks, and also fantasize about having secks with undead and giant worms. On top of that, they must be oblivious to the existence of porn online, since I can imagine that you could easily find much better quality content on there, for free.

The controls in this game (joypad ONLY btw) are absolutely POTATO! * edit - apparently there is an option to play keyboard&mouse, but only if you unplug your controller, otherwise controller is the only option. Has there ever been another game that does this?? , that is just Potato! /edit Buttons keep changing function, depeding on which screen you are on. there is no clue as to what the buttons actually do, the game just shows a bunch of buttons and when you press one, it either changes the languiche or asks if you want to delete your save game, usually in portugese. After figuring that bit out and suffering through the intro (cant be skipped), I had the game switch the orientation of the keypad on me so I kept sending souls to the wrong place.  Continuing the game consists of guessing which button to press, which hopefully gives you the option between selecting thumbs up, thumbs down or X. Still not sure which gets you into the game.  The gameplay itself is fairly straight forward. You send souls to the right place with increasing complexity, in the same style as "Papers, Please". although there doesnt seem to be any story involved besides, you are hungry and need the money. (much like real life there). (I'll update review if I actually get anywhere without accidently deleting the save in portugese). An OK game. If you liked "Papers, Please", you might enjoy this game. However! A game that is this simple, and still manages to completely mess up the controls, is NOT a game I can recommend buying. ps.  I noticed there has been some updates that fixes that controller issue, but at this time I have not checked it out yet, I will make a note to revisit this game.

Bioshock 2 is an amazing game, or at least has the potential to be one. The gameplay is an improvement over the first in many ways - you now can seamlessly use plasmids and weapons together, there are much more interesting enemies and the pacing of the game is great. I've always liked the way the first Bioshock kept the difficulty up throughout the game by requiring you to manage you supplies and this game carries it forward.  I'll not draw a comparison between the plot in the two games, but the plot in this game is good. Where things fall apart are the bugs. The game crashes over and over, even on PCs with good specs. It makes the game a pain to play, having to press quick save, and watch the loading screen for quick save after every event in the game, so that you don't lose progress when it randomly decides to crash.  The second major issue is the audio - the sounds that enemies make reveal neither direction nor distance. All the enemies sound like they're right next to you and you don't know which direction the sound is coming from. This makes it unnecessarily hard to find out where the enemies are and makes combat chaotic, especially if you're in the hardest difficulty. Another issue I faced is the lack of a weapons selection wheel on KB+M. The hotkeys to select weapons can go from 1-8 and similarly plasmids go from F1-F8. In the heat of combat, it's pretty hard to choose the weapon you want. This is worsened by the fact that once you upgrade or swap a plasmid, it moves to a different slot and you have to keep up with the changing plasmid slots. The audio along with the lack of weapons wheel make the combat frustrating. You'll die multiple times due to no fault of your own and then sometimes when you finally end up finishing a hard fight, the game will crash. I've read that the non-remastered version of the game has these issues too. Bioshock 2 could have been a great game, but it is nearly unplayable in its current state. I sat through it because I enjoyed the first game very much. Whether it is worth sitting through is up to you.

FSX was once the pinnacle of flight simulation, but these days, it's getting old, outdated, and there's no reason why you should be investing money in an old simulator. A long time ago, i could reccomend FSX easily, with a wide range of excellent addons, good graphics (at the time) and a good multiplayer. However nowadays this is not the case. The graphics have aged poorly, the game is plauged with bugs, mainly the out of memory crash (this is due to FSX being 32-bit, so it cannot use more than 4GB ram). There are simply far better alternatives, such as XP-11. However, if you'd rather stay in the FSX ecosystem, you should buy Lockheed Martin's Prepar3D. It is somewhat costly at around $60, however it is certainly worth it. It is based off of the FSX engine, so it should feel very similar, however it looks far superior (especially with addons such as TomatoShade, ORBX, and REX texture direct), and performance is far superior, due to it being 64-bit, so no OOM errors. The only reason I have FSX installed is for legacy addons, such as the PMDG MD-11.

I'm giving this game a thumbs down, but I'm not negative about it.  When I started the game the graphics jumped out at me, it's very colorful. I was very happy with my first impression. It feels like you're in a Disney cartoon. My pet dog was waiting for me and I spotted a bone, stick and ball I could throw. Unfortunately I couldn't reach any of them as the VR ground was lower than my physical floor. So I had to go into my oculus settings and fake a higher physical floor in order to reach stuff in this game... Petting the dog was also a disappointment to me as the dog barely responds to it.  If I compare this to the robot dog in the free game The Lab, that dog was more interactive and felt much more real.  Having pointed all of this out, I hope they will fix the bugs and make the dog much more interactive like make it roll over to rub its belly. I've waited for this kind of thing for many months and for the price of 4 euros I will keep the game and see if my nephew and niece enjoy it as much as the robot dog.

The choices are a bit dumb, doesn't leave for a lot of leeway. I understand it's supposed to be built on tough choices, but the path seems already set ahead of you. The lack of voice acting is a bit of a shame too, random grunts and noises just don't fit the game nicely. I only put 45 minutes into this, I would have put more, but I felt that with the current cost of the game. (12 quid) which, admittedly isn't a lot, the game just didn't have much content. It's make a nice book or comic. But as a game it comes short. I liked that I could pet the cat.

Grand Theft Auto V es un juego que recomiendo a medias. Por el lado positivo, tiene un modo historia lleno de misiones y actividades bastante entretenidas y variadas. Su modo online es bastante completo con nuevo contenido cada aÃ±o dÃ¡ndole mas variedad a este modo. Sin duda, es un juego excelente a la hora de jugarlo con amigos o incluso desconocidos... pero por el lado negativo, el modo libre tiene muchos problemas con los cheaters y jugadores tÃ³xicos, y aunque no sea un juego competitivo, hay mucho desequilibrio en las sesiones, teniendo que jugar si o si con tryhards solo porque Rockstar no mete un sistema de equilibrio. Cada dÃ­a, aparecen nuevos bugs beneficiosos o maleficiosos que pueden arruinarnos la experiencia. y para terminar, las pantallas de carga son exageradas, teniendo que esperar varios minutos para jugar. Es una lastima que rockstar no dedique un tiempo al juego para optimizarlo y organizarlo, despuÃ©s de todo es uno de los juegos mas vendidos de la historia, pero si descartamos sus puntos negativos, el juego es aun muy disfrutable especialmente con amigos. Tampoco evitarÃ­a siempre las sesiones libres ya que no siempre es asÃ­, incluso puede a llegar ser divertido dichas situaciones. Pero hay que ser honestos, los tiempos de GTA Online ya terminaron, Grand Theft Auto VI puede salir en cualquier momento, y la tienda de Epic Games esta regalando copias de este titulo, trayendo mas cheaters que jugadores normales. Si te interesa el titulo puedes reclamarlo en la tienda de Epic, o en su lugar, comprarlo cuando este en descuento, pero te recomendarÃ­a guardar el dinero y esperar a la prÃ³xima entrega. Disfruta del poco tiempo de vida del GTA V.

They started this game   and  , many  ,   and adding  , but after couple years, they   it and moved on to their  .  you still reading this? why?? is the reason above not enough for you to not buy this game and avoid it at all costs? ok ok. ill tell you my reasons why you should avoid this game.  -tutorial is terrible -loading screens are way to long  -game saves are very rare and in order to not lose hours of progress, you gotta remember to click that save button(where are we, in early 2000 when a save button was a thing?) -no alert/warning of any sort when a thief steals something from your shop -no option to close your shop or end the day whenever you want in order to re arrange your shop, or just quit the game and manage your real life stuff. -your home doesnt have any use, except displaying some random trophies that the game didnt even notify you that you got them and when you got them... -when a vegetable is fully grown, many times when you try pick it up, it just vanishes and you never receive your crops -you can only accept 1 quest at any given time and only way to check the accepted quest progress is to go all the way back to your shop and check the quest board -items in quest book are very small icons and there for really hard to figure out what items are requested from you to finish the quest, unless you go back to your shop and check the quest board ONCE AGAIN... -shop organization list is very bad and needs allot of improvement and options to sort items by helmets, armors, swords and so on... -no way to see what gear is better for your champion and if its worth putting it on him or not in order to make him stronger -in skills firstly unlock the "customer talk I", it will help you at beginning, lvl 2 and 3 you dont really need, even later in game -avoid unlocking different customer classes(mage, rogue and druid) until you first unlock everything else, reason behind it is, if you unlock for example a mage, he will only accept potions, mage armor. but quests ask from you mostly to sell armor, weapons  and potions, so youll have very hard time finding "armor" npcs to sell them the armor, swords, shields. -farming is broken most of the time so no point in unlocking it all, but if you do decide to unlock it, youll get quests to sell 30 weed or some other vegetable, and like i mentioned above, you cant gather fully grown crops most of the time Even in this unfinished and abandoned stage of the game, its still fun for couple of hours, but i highly recommend everyone to buy this game only when its on sale, otherwise not really worth it. but yet again, its only 4 euros full price, so you decide, but i suppose you get what you pay for.

I said Not Recommend, but this game has quite a bit of potential. On first experience, the mechanics are there to make this a good game. However, the game feels extremely clunky and tacky. Especially the movement. Getting stuck on objects that you really shouldn't has been a massive problem for me. The gun sway, while I respect what they're trying to do, quite a lot of the time, makes the gun play feel disgusting, and sometimes makes it downright unplayable. Leaning mechanic is also quite tacky. The map design makes it so that, a lot of the time, you'll get shot from a lot of angles, with no idea where the players have come from, only to find out that they're camping. The gameplay, I feel, relies a lot on camping. From short time playing this game, I can say that you'll encounter A â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ TON of annoying, tacky gameplay mechanics that feel extremely unfinished. But hey, this is an Early Access game, so I expect that the tacky gameplay will be fixed up in the future. But right now, if you're like me, you probably wont have an enjoyable time playing this game.

Modding is one of the only reasons why I and lots of other gamers play GTA. If you take away modding you just lost yourself thousands of fans, including me. Disappointed.

1. Missing textures on character models. 2. User Interface designed for 1920x1080, can't even read the user interface without a magnifying glass at 4K. 3. Game crashed and EasyAntiCheat told me I had violated it, had to sign out or reboot my computer. 4. Can't contact Trion Worlds support. I will refund the game for now. Archeage is a great MMO with a good combat, player housing, sieges and naval combat but this is a poor remaster with PC issues and barely any marketing. Please fix this game as this game is genuinely one of the best MMO games on Steam with content that doesn't just involve collecting or crafting new outfits.

HOLD UP! Even though I said a thumbs down that is just because the game is not for me. For the time I played it was pretty enjoyable but I have to not recommend this game for my own reasons. Not recommending something does not mean I dislike the game, people seem to forget that. I got the game on sale for $2.50 and wanted to try it out and in 50 min I acquired all 17 achievements. To most that is not a big deal but as someone who hunts achievements getting them all so fast makes me not really want to play the game anymore even if I want to just waste time.  It was almost too easy for me. I got my bus up to 1000+ in length in just 50 min of play time on the museum map (which is pretty small) and I feel like there is nothing left for me to do. I would probably request a refund if I paid the full $10 but I decided to keep it since I payed 1/4 of that. That is it. That is my simple reason for not recommending it. I just don't see myself investing more time that what I already put in.

This game relies (heavily) on social features to make this game great. Too bad the server does not support this feature (in the way of keeping the connection stable), which makes this game suffers a lot. Constant disconnects, even on the middle of hunt (mostly right after firing SOS flare), which makes me have no option than hunting the monster solo, making me bored fast. I agree for the game's name change to "Monster Hunter: SOLO". And no PS4 button prompts also. This game is released on PS4, surely implementing a toggle to choose between button prompts is not that hard. I kinda like the combat system, though. Makes me keep thinking about strategies for a while (because I am playing solo, of course I had to evade every single time!) For this current state, I cannot recommend this game.

I enjoyed the first Drizzlepath, and if it wasn't for the voice acting, I would have enjoyed this enough to recommend it. The scenery is repetitive, and the walking goes on for too long without differentiation in direction or a real sense of progress (which I get is partly the point but there should be a way to do both). I do however like the idea of the story, and I love the poetic nature of the narrative. And it's pretty enough to be nice to look at and screenshot. I got 5/6 hours out of it, completing both paths and the achievements were nicely done and 100%able within that time period. Unfortunately within a few minutes of the game I cringed at the singular voice of the protagonist. This innocent voice that is meant to be so articulate and emotive, sounds like a young girl reading poetry she doesn't really understand to the teacher in school. It constantly dragged me out of the world, and actually irritated me quite alot. Such a shame.

Hello folks, I was really in trouble to make this review. I am a fan of difficult plattformers, so that was not the problem. I love pixel art and enjoyed the soundtrack. But now the madness begins. A little tutorial about some functions like boost jumps or how the air strom in the third part of the game works would be great. Even the phase shifting is not explained. A key function is not explained.  After you try and try and finally finished some of those levels, the game is not rewarding. You just have another soundtrack and new areas. You dont have a real reason to go on, not even a story. If you tell your story with some surrounding like dark souls it would be great. But no story at all with this beatiful art and soundtrack is just sad. Well and then you have so frustrating controls. Sometimes the shift button dont react or is just stuck and then you have the level where you are falling. Honestly sometimes this game has to many random facts if you are falling fast or just slow and dont reach the ground. It was so frustrating that i give up on the last level with the laser. Until you get what you do you already want to quit the game. Well I made a walkthrough until the last level. And i cut out all fails and trust me I died over 100 times.
I enjoyed the game on oculus but i cannot recommend it until the angle is fixed on the index controllers.

i really want to like this game but after some of the experiences i had with it, i decided not to, the game is physics based and thats really cool, however said physics engine is far from enjoyable, the game uses a reverse kinematics skeleton to see where your limbs and body are supposed to be, with that said, alot of the movements that i was able to do in real life are very restricted in game, either i cant aim properly or hit things because of the characters paralysed wrist that makes your arm look weak holding a crowbar, did i mention that your wrist wobbles and bends around when you hack enemies. On to the firearm combat, its very moderate, sure the physics is a fresh aspect, but you have to reload with another mag, i meant you hold a mag next to your gun for the empty mag to fall out on to your fresh mag clipping the physics and thats 3 more seconds wasted in intense combat with holograms balls. Also dont forget the mag holder is right next to your left armpit holster, that means when your rifle runs dry, your emergency secondary pistol would instead be a fresh mag * might appeal to some*. Forget about vaulting things, because your legs are crippled as well, making scaling over objects slower than my grandma does it. Oh and my hatchet clips through the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ floor once in a while. Now on to the story aspect, it has no clear storyline, why? because the in game world called MythOS is a work in progress, the developers jammed random textures and objects in to the game, its a literal Gmod server / halflife / portal wannabe. It feels like the dev decided to used prototype object and ai to build the world while adding more detailed objects as their skills in CAD improves.   after my rant, its still a fun experimental game, but i cant take neither the story nor the characters nor the physics seriously, because its just, unsatisfactory and frustrating

Left 4 Dead 2 is sequel of the Left 4 Dead game. Whats new: Survivors. Now we can choose between Nick (an ex-prisoner who escaped in the wake of the Infection), Ellis (a mechanic hailing from Savannah), Coach (Physical Education teacher at the local high school) and Rochelle (a minor associate producer for a news station) Special Infected. The Charger, The Jockey and The Spitter. Their characteristics bring new challenge for survivors skills. New weapons. P220 & Glock, Magnum (Deagle), Chrome shotgun (better accuracy than a Pump one), Silenced SMG (better damage than UZI), Ak-47, SCAR, SPAS (Combat shotgun), and a Military Rifle. A whole bunch of melee weapons. New items. Bile Jar, Adrenaline and Defibrilator. New Game Modes. Also there has been added Steam Workshop to this game. So now a player can download a custom file to change game files in-game. _______________________________________________ Replayable: Yes Interesting plot: No Singularity: Yes Gameplay 7 of 10 Graphics 6 of 10 P.S. Really poor animation in-game that can only be fixed with an addons. In-game Sounds & Music 3 of 10 P.S. Gun sounds also are terrible. Interface and in-game controls 9 of 10 TOTAL 4 of 10 P.S. Out of time. P.S. In my honest opinion the game is a lot worse than original L4D.

Fun game but it needs alot of fixes. Game crashes every time I quit game. (Not so much of a big deal as Im closing game anyway but that might be why my next bug is occuring). Game doesnt save my key binding changes (every time I start the game they have been reset to the default). You cant just climb down a ladder you have to press crouch to jump off it when your at the bottom. This along with poor climbing animations. (Sometimes you just fall through the rock) Long loading times to get into the game (Once in the game you only get the long loading screen between maps and occasional mission). Enemys appearing and disapearing. Limited range on enemy spawning into view defeats the object of a sniper game. There are lots of in game bugs/ glitches which is a shame because it really could have been a good game if more time was spent on it.

I really want to like this game, but the performance issues are just too much. It's a game with graphics comparable to a doom mod, but still manages to only run below 30 fps on mid range hardware in the first act. Yikes.

tl:dr: Great game, get in in Humble Bundle, Keystore or sale, but for the full price i would be disappointed. There are too many problems that I have to talk about... First:  I realy love the "Red Orchestra" & "Rising Storm" franchise, i have them all. Great gameplay, very realistic, bot not too much that its no fun anymore. And in a time where too many shooters appear, sets RS2 exactly on the right setting and gameplay. If you expect a CoD or BF, this is nothing for you. But for all who liked Red Orchestra, Insurgency, Day of Defeat, Verdun or Day of Infamy: Try this! Pro: - Great atmosphere - Realistic gameplay, movement etc. - Large maps, big battles, massive jungle feeling - Commander & Squad features - Stats, leveling & unlockables - Interesting classes incl. Pilots - Many maps, weapons, and equipment - Good game modes - Original armys and weapons - Amazing support only with free content - Workshop support & custom maps - Ingame tutorial videos Con: - Playerbase: Yes, the playerbase is good enough to play this game on every daytime. But its too small to have a big choice on which server or gamemode you wanna play. I find between 1 (night) and up to 20 (day) servers with enough players for a serious match on it with: Ping filter "100" on EU west, all modes / no pw / no empty. For sure its more during double XP event, after big content update or free weekend. Or even less during a beta test branch. - Ping:  My real ping is 15, i join a EU server with ping 60, get a ping 80, up to 120... Often im the only one on a EU server with a ping under 100, rest 150-300... - Clunky animations and movement:  Often i get stuck or ported back on vault animations, feels very clunky. Or you cant shoot after vaulting. You cant lay down or your charakter stands up without reason. "Build tunnel" animation disappears seconds before finished the tunnel. Many small things. - Artillery, airstrike, gunship, napalm:  Its too much! Two commanders setting all this on the battlefield in a too short time. in 50% of the time you die without a chance. For sure enemy commander can set arty on your spawnpoint, or an helicopter is shooting on your spawn. Its not fun and feels like CoD killstreaks... This is not the nice gameplay from RO2. On some maps you play as Vietcong on an open areal, while arty, napalm and 2 helicopers of the other team are attacking your spawn. Theres no playing anymore. Just spawn and die until match ends. - Some annoying weapons: The USA troops can use a granade launcher (Noobtube) and a flamethrower. Sure, it is realistic, but annoying to play against. Also only they have: AC-130 Gunship, napalm, attack & transport helicopters, jets. - Bullets disappear: As example, if your enemy shoots the flamethrower and you are able to aim and shoot at him at the same time, your bullets will disappear and you will die. Same with the Grenadelauncher. Happens often enough to talk about. Both players should be dead after this situation. - Napalm: You sit inside of a bunker: Killed by napalm bomb. Wtf? Or you step out of a bunker after a napalm attack, the ground is already safe, no fire. Killed by napalm. Kk... For sure the game let you spawn even if the napalm effect is still active. So you spawn inside of a fire and youre dead again. Makes sense. - Supression fire: Nice to have, but sometimes it leads into stupid situations: You aim at your enemy, enemy starts shooting in your direction without aiming or hitting you. Your crosshair will shake and you can`t hit him anymore. It can`t be a good featur if its honor those who just spray & pray and kills the ppl who aim. - Visual effects: Its too much, in many situations you are blind, were you normaly would aim and fire. Like "Supression fire". If someone shooting close to you, even behind a wall or bush, your screen blurs out and shakes. It would be cool if this happend if you got hit or a explosion is close to you. But it appears for every bullet fired, even if it wasnt in your direction... Sound: You hear gunshots all over the map, everything sounds like a real battle. But you dont hear gunshots on you from 10-20 meters. So it happens that you get killed by a camper several times, but cant locate him. Its annoying. - Squads:  Often useless. Everyone is forced to go into a squad, so no one realy cares about his own squad. Not every time, for sure. But often. Sometimes you open a squad, someone else joined and you`re not longer squad leader. - Commander: While there are tutorials for every class, theres not a good one for the commander, so you have to loock on Youtube, or start without any knowledge. - Voice chat: People playing music, screaming kids... Why there has to be voice chat for all? Somtimes ppl playing music loud af, but no symbol appears who is playing it. So, no mute possible. - Skins: Good idea to make all DLCs free and just charge money for cosmetics, but in the jungle its hard to see whos friend and whos enemy. Different Skins just lead to teamkills... - Team switcher: Some ppl just switching into the winning team in the last minute of the match, and you, who fought in the winning team from the beginning, get switched into the looser team. - A few annoying bugs, stuttering, lags, FPS drops, useles votes... Finally: I realy like this game, but all these small problems are too much to play it more then 1-2 hours. But at the end, its just my opinion. It could be an amazing game, but it is not.

Bleh! Aside from the fact that I get to play as Bruce Campbell, I can't believe I paid $3 for this DLC! You think he'd at least come with some customizations unlocked aside from a blue hand! And the model itself looks nothing like this Thumbnail image of Ash. It's really quite â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ actually. His face looks flat and doesn't capture the likeness of Bruce very well and the textures are really blurry compared to the other survivors. I mean, if you're buying it for the same reason as everyone else, it's freaking Ash baby!, then of course my review isn't going to dissuade you, but it really is kind of â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ for the money. Love the base game though!

Kann es nur volljÃ¤hrige Spieler ab 18 weiterempfehlen. Da es aber anscheinend ab 0 Jahren Freigegeben ist und man in dem Spiel Videos vom World Wide Web abspielen kann wo gerne mal das abschlachten von Tieren oder Menschen gezeigt wird sowie Pornos der perversesten Sorte, werde ich diesem Spiel aus mangelnder Interesse gegenÃ¼ber minderjÃ¤hrigen von Seite der Admins und Valve abraten und dem Spiel einen Daumen nach unten geben. Nicht einmal das Vote kicken durch absolute Abstimmung jedes einzelnen Spielers eines Servers ist oftmals nicht mÃ¶glich. Ansonsten bis auf vielen 12 JÃ¤hrigen Internet Rambos und noch mehr unlustigen Trollen gibt es sehr wenig bei diesem Spiel auszusetzen jedoch dieser eine Kritikpunkt den ich durch dieses Review ansprechen mÃ¶chte ist fatal und sollte dringend Ã¼berdacht werden.  Can only recommend it to players over 18. But since it is apparently released from the age of 0 and you can play videos from the World Wide Web in the game where slaughtering of animals or people is often shown as well as porn of the most perverse variety, I will use this game out of a lack of interest towards minors on the part of the admins and discourage Valve and give the game a thumbs down. Not even the vote kick works even though everyone is voting on the server for the kick.  Otherwise except for many 12-year-old Internet Rambos and even more unpleasant trolls there is very little to complain about in this game... but this one point of criticism that I would like to address through this review is fatal and should be rethought urgently.

This is one of the best games ever made, and I'm absolutely addicted to it. But it doesn't deserve a positive review. No, I'm not referring to campaign. I'm exclusively speaking about Online.  I won't even write everything I think. I'll just say this game is addictive as hell with the right people, but the problem is that finding the right people in this game is like finding a needle in a haystack. It's just hell. The game is riddled with modders that always want to mess with everyone, and it's a real pain. If you want to mod for money, go for it. Everything in this game is disgustingly overpriced and the payouts for things are garbage. Making money in the game is easier than ever, but the problem is it takes too long, and the payout ratio when compared with the prices of items is just ridiculous. Not everyone has the time to grind for days just to afford one super car or whatever they want to indulge in. But when you mod in order to mess with other people's gameplay and hard-work (e.g. cargo), you're just a worthless scumbag.  The sad thing is that Rockstar don't do anything about it. This has been a serious issue for years. They don't seem to do much about the modder infestation, and it's sad to acknowledge because this game is so â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ amazing.  Do I recommend it? Unlike what my review states, yes, I do. It's fun, and if you have friends, it's even better. But it doesn't deserve a positive review until Rockstar show they care about their community. It's that simple.

The Game is very overrated I finished it in 8h and was pretty dissapointed with the story mode, the first 2-3h are very good, you get new weapons you fight new enemys and the game makes you feel like a complete Badass but it gets old very fast, the boss fights are pretty boring especially the last one, the levels are all the same (except for the tower one and the Vega one those ones were very very good), Hell just doesnt feel like hell at all, Im very dissapointed with Doom I also want to say that i took my time with the game, I didnt rush it i tried to explore everything that i could and still finished the game in 8h, as for the multiplayer mode its basically Quake (but i have to say that the Snapmap feature is pretty cool). So yea i dont recommend this game at all.

UPDATE : 29 Sep @ 8:35pm While Frontier has a great game here i cannot recommend it anymore since the game, instead being a simulation like RCT 1/2 and 3 and fun to play, it lacks the fun part since the aim here is to build buildings in the parks mostly while adding the rides and coasters! Also the game is incomplete lacking the fun part, lacking many rides, and also with many bugs which makes the game frustrating. On top of that, too many paid dlc's (sure it has free updates) and hotels and staff managent isn't good! If you want a truly sequel to rct play Parkitect since it is a more complete game than this one with much space to improvement! .................................. Original review on : 17 Nov, 2016 @ 4:25pm Happy and fun times in the comming future!!  LOVED RCT1/2 and 3 and enjoyed to play the alpha and Beta of PC! Now, its time for PC FULL RELEASE with all the upcoming content and the fantastic support of Frontier!  They have been amazing with consistent updates and listening to community! Congratulations Frontier!

requested refund, too many bugs can't play.  I tried for an hour play time however just as mentioned in other reviews there are just to many things with this game that makes it unplayable.   quick list,  getting stuck in a scene to move to another but can't.  hint button not working which someone mentioned that it only works in the hidden object scenes and if that's the case what's the point.   no skip button for mini games.   I had to force close the game several times because of the no menu showing up when I went to get to the menu and also when I couldn't get out of one scene to get to another. when I went back in game I was still stuck at this door.   if the developer plans on fixing all these things and others that were mentioned it may be a somewhat enjoyable game for some casual play but in this state it's not enjoyable or playable sorry to say. update: I appreciate the developer responding to my review however at the time I received the refund I requested.  I would consider changing my review one day if the developer addressed the issues that I and other players mentioned if I come by the the game for free to try again or if I know for sure it's been addressed purchase again to play. until then my review will have to remain.  thank you though for responding back in January. I've only been able to play for about an hour thanks to several things: -This game is EXTREMELY ANTI-NEW PLAYERS. I was spawnkilled over 10 times by different people while trying to figure out the controls. I also asked in the chat if anyone knew how to get oxygen in the chat, and was just told do shut up. Got called some pretty epic insults when I said to my pteranodon group that I didn't know how to hunt fish. Even the admins don't want to help people, and I know that they have a bad reputation for favouritism and banning people they don't like. Obviously that's not the game's fault, I'm just saying that if you want a warm, welcoming community in a game, this game is definitely not for you.   - The graphics... I know people make it sound worse than it is when it comes to how bad this game's graphics are, so I'll give my honest opinion: The graphics in this game remind me of one of those free online mobile dinosaur games you find out of pure boredom. This game cannot compete with graphics from games such as The Isle, and I know I shouldn't compare them, but I really don't understand why you would play this if you own The Isle.  -Features, though, are different from games like The Isle. In Beasts of Bermuda, there are functions such as grabbing food and offspring, which I like. The game isn't terrible, just... very... hard to enjoy. It feels like a massive downgrade from The Isle. But yeah, it has some really nice features, like the completely customisable skins, the obeseity thing is quite funny at first, and like I said, and the nesting system is quite nice.  I wouldn't reccommend the game if: -You can't pick up a game in literally 30 seconds or die -You're looking for a game with a friendly community and fair, helpful admins -You dislike the game you payed Â£10-Â£15 for looking like a free mobile game Thanks for reading :D

first of all i would like to state with over 200+ hours on this game and its all been solo since day 1 i have enjoyed it myself. (also i know my play time is lower than what i said but i have 2 accounts and i did indeed buy it bc i lost my mobile Auth to sign in at the time so i re-bought it on my main "this account"). I had really high hopes for this game and i stuck with the developers for a long time now but sadly my expectations have not been met. I also know that it is an EA game before anyone says "its an EA game dude". I will list why below why i do not recommend this game.  So what is killsquad you may ask, Killsquad is a game designed for coop, but you can play it solo, game where you drop into planets with one of 4 different class's with a contract to raid/loot the planet, kill/clear the boss/minions for materials and equipment and if you are successful and you get out, you get to upgrade your character (thats it).There is no Glory in this game at all playing it solo but dont get me wrong, clearing a hard contract solo really gets you going for more. Sadly it was 200+ hours of solo for me :(. I know the game can be played solo but it WAS designed for 4 player coop mainly in thought. Another good thing to say is that the characters are well animated and i have never had FPS drops or any other problem like that so its pretty smooth. It also has great lighting effects and the levels are pretty lengthy (but tedious solo). As is said above i have enjoyed playing it solo with my 200+ hours but i just cant stick with it anymore, I have been more than patient with this game and its has let me down, the devs have let me down. In all my time playing i have never met another player online or even interacted with another human in this game at all. I think im lying here, i think i did come across people once when the game was at the peak of its hype at the very beginning but as i said, 200+ hours solo really gets you down on a 4 player game. I have sat in lobbies for hours  waiting on some sort of human life to join and not a single player has ever joined me. Mid contract i had a very startling moment, "players name" has connected, 1... 2....3....4.... "players name" has disconnected. The overall gameplay mechanics work, thats good but with one major flaw, its a bit clunky at times to use abilities. At one point playing this game (solo) i was mid vector level 90+ at the time, i think, and i was trying to heal myself, USE ABILITY, does not activate, spastically spams button to activate healing but no.... it does not work and i fail my contract. It is not the first time this is happened. You will not care about any lore you may obtain about the characters as it just does not suit the game bc it feels as if they are taking it from other games and using it wrong. Im sorry but if this is what NOVORAMA has to offer this is a dead fish in the water. It feels SOULLESS.  The only way i can see this game getting better/more players is with a VAST price reduction to maybe Â£4.99, Â£9.99. I bought it day one and i am very disappointed  with the overall progress/development with this game. Overall i would give it a solid (SOLO EXPERIENCE) 4/10, (COOP EXPERIENCE) -1/10. I hate to do this but unless the game has a drastic change i would avoid this game at all costs as of this moment. Im sorry, i really am but i just cannot recommend a dead game to anyone. I have been waiting for some sort of new update to come out as i feel burned out of the crap i am getting from this game. I recently asked one of the devs for an update on the new 1.0 full release and its coming i think they said "mid-late october". Hopefully 1.0 will change my mind.

I have no clue how to play a racing game that is clearly designed for ONLY the most skilled players with the BEST equipment, from the very start. Well, no, not really from the very start.  It's only revealed how even moderately skilled players are weeded out after the SECOND hour. Coincidence? I think not. Even though I got it on sale, I seriously regret the purchase (and the DAYS of DLing a 106GB game), and it's just a hair too late for a refund. And this from someone who almost certainly is bordering on 1,000 racing hours on Steam (though many are offline.) Even the couple of hundred hours in the original Dirt Rally didn't prepare for the frustrating hopelessness of Dirt Rally 2.0. Racing at night with NO lights of any kind made available by any means? Are you fracking KIDDING ME?! (Apparently not....) VERY disappointing.

I'm honestly a bit disappointed in this game. It's only enhanced in so far as it runs on modern Windows versions which the original doesn't. Otherwise it's exactly the same. The original was great and all, but would it really have been too much to ask to beef up the graphics a bit?

Even though the game got updated recently, there are not enough content (game modes, models, maps, and etc) to play this game with others. Sure, you can buy the game during a sale or when it has a discount, but buying Garry's Mod would be a better option due to the amount of workshop content it has compared to this game.

I would not recommend this game to anybody. There are major FPS issues for everyone, the soundtrack is very annoying, and the achievements are terrible as of now. The gameplay itself is entertaining even though there are some issues, but what made me strongly dislike this game is the way the achievements are setup. To earn 100% achievements in this game, you must unlock every single badge in the game. Sounds reasonable, right? Well to unlock badges you must spend the coins you earn on a random badge which turns collecting them all into pure chance. There are 99 badges to unlock, so once you get down to the last few it becomes nearly impossible to receive the ones you need. Get ready to play through this entire game 20+ times to unlock everything.

First off, before I start this review, I want to say that I TRIED to like it. Even forced myself to like it. But me, and the friends who have played the counterpart, have both agreed they took a major part away from Amnesia, namely...  The inventory is what defined most of Amnesia, if I'm fair, holding items crucial to the story, and player development. When they took this away, they cut a major part from the story, in my opinion. You are now bound to weird phones, and dragging things along for 3 levels. (Exaggerated) This was a major downfall for me, because the predecessor had this so well done. One of the good things I found, is that the monsters do not dissapear after you die, but instead keep patrolling. I have got to admit, I got frustrated, but none the less, a good feature. Then on to the enemies, who help you in the cages. They are extremely dumb, and can be easily avoided by a hit-'n-run tactic. Just gotta wait your time. This was also a huge letdown for me, as they remained oblivious to you, when you already reached the next room, and gave up chasing you, thus ending in really easy enemies. I could of forgiven SO much about it, though, if it wasn't for the biggest dissapointment of all. The story makes absolute zero sense, about some guy going to the Nevada desert, or whatever else got sand, coming back, getting ill, and his children have vanished, and all of a sudden pigs roam the castle. I mean,  . This is original, yet SO crummily put together. Two hours into the game, and I set it down, and never finished it since. IT honestly pains me to give the second part of the game, such a bad review, but this leaves me nothing else but a sad, low 2.5 in my book. As much as I'd like to say the contrary, it's not worth the buy, if you're in for a good experience.

I think this is one of those games where you either love it or hate it. For me, it is the latter ... and it is mainly because the game just doesn't really sing to me. There's another negative review in which the reviewer claims to have wanted to love it. I am the same. Technically, it is well done. But there's just no fun factor. The good: The bad: Ultimately, it is not a bad game. You can hopefully tell from the long list of pros and the one very individually oriented con. The right people will love it. The rest of us will have better games in our backlog to move onto.

Spesso siamo soliti ricordare con affetto e ammirazione titoli del passato, andando ben oltre lâ€™effettiva qualitÃ  che realmente possedevano. Recensire quindi un gioco che ha rappresentato la nostra infanzia od un periodo particolare della nostra vita da giocatori, riproposto a distanza di anni dalla pubblicazione originale, non Ã¨ mai semplice. Il rischio Ã¨ duplice, ovvero farsi prendere dalla malinconia ed omaggiare il titolo con un voto alto a priori, oppure cancellare gli straordinari ricordi ad esso associati, rigiocandolo quindi con occhio critico, scoprendo le inevitabili lacune od i probabili difetti realmente presenti. Se tutto ciÃ² Ã¨ vero per i grandi capolavori del passato, a maggior ragione Ã¨ difficile ipotizzare di poter oggi realmente apprezzare un titolo come Bullet Witch, che giÃ  a suo tempo non lasciÃ² ricordi sensazionali nella memoria di tutti coloro che tentarono di dargli fiducia (opinione personale naturalmente). Bullet Witch Ã¨ un action in terza persona sviluppato dallâ€™oramai defunto studio giapponese Cavia (responsabile del primo NieR e della serie Drakengard) e pubblicato nel 2006 da AQ Interactive in esclusiva per Xbox 360. A distanza di circa 12 anni dalla sua uscita, la strega Alicia torna a farci visita su piattaforma PC (via Steam e Humble Bundle) con una edizione completa di tutti i DLC prodotti ed in una nuova veste grafica, con miglioramenti riguardanti risoluzione, framerate, gestione delle luci e bilanciamento del gioco. â€œUn esercito di demoni ha conquistato il mondo e la resistenza umana Ã¨ sullâ€™orlo della disfatta totale, ma proprio quando tutto sembra perduto, una donna vestita di nero arriva sul campo di battaglia armata di poteri magici e una lunga pistola simile alla scopa di una strega.â€ Giocherete nei panni di Alicia Claus, la misteriosa salvatrice, e dovrete combattere orde di soldati demoniaci, civili mutati e persino giganti. Tramite il gunrod, la pistola di Alicia â€œmultifunzioneâ€ (piÃ¹ simile in realtÃ  ad una scopa magica), potrete spazzare via i nemici che vi si porranno dinanzi. Il gunrod puÃ² trasformarsi istantaneamente in quattro armi diverse, ognuna delle quali puÃ² essere incantata per ottenere piÃ¹ potenza e bonus particolari. Alicia non avrÃ  a disposizione solo il gunrod per sconfiggere i nemici, ma potrÃ  anche contare su una serie di poteri magici che le permetteranno di scatenare la furia di fulmini, tornado e persino meteoriti, creare muri di protezione, far apparire foreste di spine, utilizzare il potere della telecinesi, etc. La schermata di gioco presenta la classica barra della vita, che si ripristina automaticamente col passare del tempo, ed una barra supplementare relativa al potere magico residuo (ogni magia consuma un certo quantitativo di energia) che viene alimentata dalle uccisioni dei nemici in gioco. Alla fine di ogni livello avrete infine la possibilitÃ  di distribuire dei punti abilitÃ  da ripartire tra nuove abilitÃ , armi, magie. Tralasciando il fatto che avrete armi infinite durante il gioco, che viaggerete attraverso scenari scarni, anonimi e obbrobriosi, che impiegherete ben 4 ore per finire tale scempio, a tutto questo aggiungete una intelligenza artificiale inesistente e ridicola e purtroppo capirete il livello di gioco offerto da Bullet Witch. La IA non Ã¨ imbarazzante, Ã¨ semplicemente inesistente. I nemici si porranno davanti a voi come manichini praticamente immobili (spostandosi di tanto in tanto in maniera meccanica) che sarete in grado di abbattere anche giocando alla cieca. Avrete durante la partita la possibilitÃ  di abbassarvi furtivamente o schivare i colpi ma non sarÃ  realmente necessario: non morirete mai e sicuramente troverete piÃ¹ sfidante, interessante ed impegnativo rassettare il cassetto dei vostri calzini. Purtroppo no, graficamente parlando il gioco risente degli anni passati e non vi sono evidenti e netti miglioramenti rispetto al gioco uscito nel 2006. La caratterizzazione di Alicia Ã¨ comunque interessante e graficamente parlando, piacevole. In aggiunta la scopa tecnologica della quale Ã¨ dotata ne caratterizza in maniera adeguata il personaggio. Bullet Witch Ã¨ un titolo purtroppo insufficiente sotto tutti i punti di vista. Sebbene sia una conversione migliorata di un titolo del 2006, graficamente Ã¨ inaccettabile al giorno dâ€™oggi. Il gameplay inoltre risente inevitabilmente del peso degli anni con scenari piatti, ripetitivi senza il minimo interesse. A tutto ciÃ² si aggiunge una IA imbarazzante che si traduce in una totale assenza di sfida. Porta si delle piccole migliorie rispetto alla versione del 2006 che tuttavia non ne giustificano l'acquisto soprattutto per chi non ha mai giocato il gioco originale. Per tutti coloro che invece hanno apprezzato il titolo del 2006, sappiate che, in caso di acquisto, avrete davanti un gioco pressochÃ© identico a 12 anni fa. Rappresenta realmente un investimento difficile da comprendere. PerchÃ© pubblicare ai giorni nostri un gioco che giÃ  a suo tempo aveva ricevuto un freddo riscontro, mantenendo quasi totalmente inalterato ogni aspetto presente nel 2006? E' un titolo realmente difficile da consigliare.
