TL;DR: Heart and Seoul is a short slice-of-life about a getaway house-sitting for a relative. It had so much potential, but poor writing and static character sprites with only one facial expression make this visual novel (VN) fall below the quality of many FREE visual novels on steam. I can't recommend buying this when there's several free VN's with better writing, better art, and more features. Still, if you can grab it bundled or on sale, it does have some good moments. PROS Nice soundtrack Nice sound effects that are relevant to the story - door bell chimes, phone rings, etc NEUTRAL You're not able to take screenshots in Ren'Py, but the dev posted a workaround in a different game, here:  The Art Gallery exhibit was a nice idea, but 4 paintings seemed way too short for an artist's exhibit. Writing has a lack of continuity, the characters seem to contradict themselves in places. example: Kim Yoon-Ji says "I'm house sitting for 5 days" then later says "I'm staying here for the summer" -- Wait, what? Is your "summer" is only 5 days long? There is a match-3 game in the story that you must play 3 times, and there is no skip option for it. I didn't mind it and found it was actually enjoyable to play, my objection is that there is no in-game benefit to playing it. It would have been nice to see Kim Yoon-Ji "earn her tips" bartending for the evening based on how well you did in the mini-game, then have later story choices limited by the amount of cash she has to spend. Better match-3 success = better tips / more money = more choices later on. I also think a "skip" option should be available for those who don't enjoy such games. It's not voiced. This didn't matter to me, but might matter to some. CONS There's no steam overlay. There's no CG gallery. There is a log, but the typeface and the background graphic make it really hard to read. Characters have only one static pose and one facial expression - no matter if you are having the time of your life together or if you are coldly dumping a guy after he declared his love for you, his expression never changes. I've seen far better quality on free VN's, the fact that you've charged for this is inexcusable poor quality. The characters never change clothes for the entire 5 days of the story. Whether they are going to work, going out clubbing, going on a sightseeing tour, going to a museum exhibit, or going to confess their love to a girl - they always wear the same outfit. It really ruins my immersion in the story when the characters don't change clothes for 5 days AT ALL. The game requires a LOT of clicking for such a short story. Every page has only a short sentence - sometimes only a single word, and you have to click through many pages read all of the characters speech. It would be much easier to read if you put all four short sentences the character was saying on a single page, but then it would be much more obvious how short the story actually is. I found the writing style has promise, but was still rough around the edges. I feel the author could benefit most from working on "show don't tell", as far too many things are TOLD to you, rather then shown. The biggest negative for me was the complete lack of character development, which meant I didn't really care about the characters. Kim Yoon-Ji (the main character) isn't very detailed or thought out well. It's said she graduated university 2 years ago with business and communication degree, but she's been tending bar and working at cafes because economy is bad and she hasn't found a better job. However, it's never detailed what kind of job she actually wants, what she was going to do with the degree (her "dream job"), what her career goals actually are, or what she desires in life. There are 2 male love interests, but neither one of the guys really had a developed personality so it was hard to feel anything for them, or care about their characters. Their characters seemed more like trope outlines. Insta!Love. The male characters fall in love with your character SO FAST! I do understand it's a short VN taking place over 5 days, but even if I felt a major connection to a person I would not feel comfortable declaring my love after only a week. Asking someone you've met and have feelings for to stay in the area, helping them get a job and find an apartment - yes, that's totally logical to offer them. This "romance" felt somewhat  forced and unreal, because I didn't have time to develop a connection with any of the characters and BAM they're in LOVE! The characters lacked enough development to stand out and individuals, as well as connect to each other. It just didn't seem like they even really knew each other well before they jumped to declaration of love. - Park Hyun-Woo (dark hair, serious, architect assistant) says "I love you" after only knowing you for 5 days. - Lee Seok-Jin (blond hair, wacky, DJ) says " Dam girl, you really got moves!" after you make love for the first time. (yes, it's actually misspelled in the game like that) It's been mentioned in many other reviews, but it bears repeating - at the start of the game, you're told how this is supposed to be an AUTHENTIC Korean setting. Then you are treated to several minutes of a non-skippable club scene with pretty much only white people. I saw only one Asian male in the club scene. It's annoying and really breaks the mood of the game. Although there were mention of some Korean foods, there was also "No one does breakfast like the Americans." Overall it didn't feel like it was a story from Korea, it felt like it was a story written by foreigners about what they thought Korea *might* be like. TRADING CARDS / BADGES The badges are buildings. The emotes are black and white artwork, and they display clearly. The backgrounds are 2 character backgrounds and one muted city background. VALUE FOR THE MONEY Poor. There are FREE VN's that offer more both in terms of a longer story that is internally consistent and in characters who are better developed and have many varied facial expressions that match the events of the story as it unfolds. You're better off reading any number of other quality free VNs before you spend money for this.

(I.e breeding countless generations, thousands of hours, missed sleep, failed relationships) This is a failed attempt at A.) A Joke B.) Teleporter incentive  C.) Providing valid and useful content in anyway. Look at the mods. Look at what people, smart people, thoughtful people. People that play the game, know the game DO WITH THE GAME. YOU CLIPPED THEM..OUR BIRDS....AND MADE PENS OR SOME â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ FOR HARRY POTTER FAN FICTION. Worst free game out there. Oh wait, it's not free I forgot, you needed to PAY to waste your time haha. If you're thinking about buying Ark, try waiting until the reviews get better. You'd have more fun clicking on *Link has Been Removed* then playing it right now. ________________________________________________________________________________ ________________________________________________________________________________ -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ***New Info*** (Update Review) 2017-04-05 "There were many PvP implications in flier speed, not only did it make snatching, C4 bombing, and Quetz Grenading huge, easy issues, but it had underlying repercussions in the overall pvp gameplay space with regards to trivializing the land dinos which we actually want to see in battle, and giving people the option to remain endlessly airborne with giant mobile chaingun/gatling/rocket platforms high above the world and out of range of any threats. There were also PvE implications. The ground game was essentially trivialized. You could live on the back of a Quetz perpetually after getting one, never even having to land... ever, really. 80% of the game was easily ignored because the air is safer, more straightforward, etc." The above was writin by the Senior Gameplay Designer. This is in regards to Flyers. However. You could say the same thing about rafts. You can stay on a Raft forever, ignoring the land and missing out on 80% of the game, or more. And you'd never, ever have to to go land. (Not true, as you'd need resources and food / water (if in air) and the latter if you were on a raft. What about all the bugs rafts made? Getting outside the map, spawning in players bases, cluttering up the map, glitching your items into the world ect. Having Flyers in the game, is the reason I bought the game. I'm fully aware of the fact this game is Early Access. However when I bought this game, Early Access was expected to end years ago, and this "change" that people are blaming on Early Access, happend long after the projected period that this game would be finished. Don't make items (I.e Clusters / Rocket / Mini Turrets) if they BREAK your game. "in the overall pvp gameplay space with regards to trivializing the land dinos which we actually want to see in battle" Anyone that has played SOTF (Old School) before Birds in that mode were nerfed about as hard as the game itself. Knows that Land Dinos win. Always. Without contest. Rex Level 10 Beats Rex Level 1. And So on. There is no skill in that. It's just who can tame the biggest and highest level Dino, or even in many cases breed the most god tier land Dino. And we can all agree it takes no skill to tame. Or very little (I should know, it's one of my favorite things to do) Flyers is the game. It's not just some "Meta" it's the whole game. The world, map, everything revolves around the ability to fly. That is how the game was made, and now they're saying since they've added new content (Like Cluster nades, Platform Saddles,  Rocket / Mini Turrets) that Flyers are broken. How about you look into the implication of thoses additions vs breaking your game. Land Dinos collect resources. But when you go and add Dinos, like  the Theri you break the whole chain. When is the last time anyone ever needed a Mammoth. Or a Berrie Collector. Or even a Meat Collector. Or Fiber Collector. Ape was a hard tame, hard to get one that can defend itself. (Fiber) Thatch (Weak tame, good for a single thing i.e thatch, and thats it) Beaver / Mammoth (Good for wood, Beaver serious out did the mammoth,  making it useless) (Then the pair were trumped by the Theri) Rex or any other meat collector. (Trumped by Theri) Even a low level 15 Theri leveled up into Power, can collect enough meat and battle 99% things in the south. As well as collect enough Fiber for a Alphas tribes needs.  You say you want to see Land Dinos in PVP and more use in PVE to prevent people from playing the game THEY WANT TO PLAY. The key word is "You" We don't need "You" to chose how we play an Open World / Sandbox game. If people want to sit in the sky, and rule the damn clouds, who the cares. Let them.  This is no longer a mystery it's a fact. They're trying to controll the way we play the game and I bought a Sandbox / Open World game. Not a Paint-By-Number. "Open world, free roam, or (more loosely) sandbox are terms for video games where a player can move freely through a virtual world and is given considerable freedom in regard to how and when to approach particular objectives, as opposed to other video games that have a more linear structure to their gameplay" You want to fix your game? Then do it. Just don't break the core gameplay of it as an attempt to fix your failed ideas and desires. You're breaking the foudation of your otherwise great game. And I won't beapart of it. Now lets see if I can get a refund on this game.

I absolutely loved Far Cry 3 and having heard nothing but praises from everyone about blood dragon i decided to go ahead and buy it.Thing is wheather you will like blood dragon or not is solely depending upon on how much you are willing to overlook things.My biggest problem with BD is that it uses all the same mechanics from FC3 which is really annoying since it causes a disconnect,FC3 was pseudo realistic fps and encouraged realism but BD is the exact opposite.I also felt weird playing the game coz it essentially is reskinned version of FC3 although some of you may not have an issue with that. The asthetics were very appealing as everything is neon filled from the enimes to the dragons to the buildings everything lit in neon colors.The comedy especially some of the dialouges are really hilarious.The outlandish over the top settings with robots,dinasours is really refreshing.The length is pretty short can be completed in 2-3 hours and if trying to get 100% can be done in 5-6 hours, this might be a turnoff for some people but i absolutely love short games as time is an issue as we get older. Overall i have pretty mixed feelings for FC3 BD, i gave it a negative because of the huge disconnect between the game mechanics with the gameplay for example the hostage resuce missions are really a pain in the arse coz you have to be stealthy but its not enjoyable at all becuse of the way the mission is setup its nearly impossible to be not detected not to mention the fact you are encouraged throughout the game to blast your way though.I'd say if you want to pick it up do so when its discounted or maybe skip FC3 is a far superior game in every single way grab that if you dont already owe it.

This is a review for the "Attack on Titan Mashup Set" costume DLC for the game Dead o Alive 5. I won't make a big deal about how this version doesn't have the feature that costumes take battle damage like the PS4 version does. Most people point that out for reviews on every other DoA5 DLC page. The devs couldn't be â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ to do it and for me it doesn't effect the game. It can't be helped. However this DLC reflects many things that are wrong with how the game and its fans are being treated. Lets look at the price first. Typically I think its dumb to make a big deal about the price for games or extra content as those will go down pretty fast via a sale or something just months later as is the current trend. However this DLC which was up for only a year never got a discount or sale. It remained the same price the entire one year it was available. You would think with the past Steam summer sale they might throw us a bone since they know it's going to be removed but nope. This leads us to the next thing to examine, the actual price. Here in the US it ran for $40. Putting that into perspective the game itself before turning over to the free to play model was either the same or lower the price depending on how you purchased it. Now I can't really comment on the amount of effort it took to make these costumes, yes they all look nice and accurate to the material they're supposed to represent but objectively they're just brown jackets with logos for a majority of the cast. Putting this also into perspective without making some arbitrary system of what takes more effort, I will say DLC costumes packs with more varied costumes cost less than this one did and they have also received discounts making them even cheaper than this. So where exactly does this price come from? Certain people at this game company trying  to milk Dead or Alive and Attack on Titan fans for as much money as they can. Now to put the cherry on top in their fine print: "*The Attack on Titan stage shown in the screenshots cannot be used in this version of the game." Well isn't that great? Just another reminder on how little they care about the PC community that they couldn't port over what was essentially a reskinned version of another stage already in the game. I think them having screenshots of content not actually in this game is also a violation, not sure if that new Steam rule applies retroactively. Seeing as how this DLC is getting removed though, I guess nothing can be done about that at this point. So for any devs wishing to make bank just know you need to have a crossover DLC with a hot property, mark it up for high of price as possible and then announce later that you're removing it so you get a surge more sales towards the end. So I guess my final rating is for the DLC itself: Brown Jacket/10 Rating for pricing and practice behind this: *You must have the latest update installed in order to view this rating.

Honestly I wouldn't have bothered playing this game but seeing the mostly positive "reviews" and how everyone talks about how it's not P2W I decided to give this game a chance, you know - maybe it's actually something unique! And of course this piece of garbage game fails to deliver. Another pathetic and lazy CS&CoD attempt that talks about how it's the best F2P Shooter out there but no, it's not. Your game has literally nothing original, the only decent maps in this game are literally rip offs from famous maps like Airport in CoD and more. Performance is garbage, graphics are garbage, there's no skill curve, recoil is nothing to learn, it's literally just predicting and praying while you spray. The weapons don't feel nor sound satisfying at all, the game has the typical F2P awful hitmarkers because 'Oh CoD does it and CoD is cool, right?!'. - Oh and people who talk about how it's not P2W either never opened the ingame shop, are bots or are just idiotic and think that being able to grind for hours (if not days to average players, because I can't see ANYONE being able to play this game for one hour straight without vomiting or rage quitting at this dumpster of a game) to earn a weapon you can just buy with proper cash isn't considered P2W. Hitboxes are worse than launch day Rainbow Six Siege (another thing I don't get, why the hell does Steam say this game is similar to Destiny 2 and R6S? They're nothing alike and putting them in the same category is an insult enough to the games.) - Oh, and I'm not even gonna bother talking about free kills killstreak (they're more broken than in CoD and easier to achieve). TL;DR: Another cheap CS/CoD F2P copy that says it's the best F2P game but is just as garbage as all the other CoD & CS Ripoffs. 0/10, want my 0.4hrs back. Edit : Also, whoever claims this game is even close to CoD : MW (2019) has actually never played CoD MW and it really shows. Ironsight is exactly everything CoD MW is against and tried to fix in their franchise. Anyone who ACTUALLY played MW knows that the people who wrote the reviews probably never touched MW 2019, were too poor to afford it or weren't good enough in the game and probably RQd after 10 minutes

Even for early access, this was released way way way too early and definitely needed to cook longer. The mechanics are sound but god dang everything else needs work. Opening doors is horribly clunky and theres no way to do it in a quick motion which isn't good because there are 1000 doors on each map, vaulting is incredibly buggy, grenade throws are seemingly random and the animations are god awful. I think this title has a chance if they can really polish out how clunky it is. This is something I believe needed to be addressed before even releasing into a payable EA title. Releasing this too early is going to kill this game which is a shame because it really could've been something good. The mission planning screen is also borderline useless. Cool concept but definitely needs much more love and work. I really wish there was like a sideways thumb rating because by no means do I think this is a bad game, it is not. It's just simply not ready YET.

Upon the game's release the most popular finales (matches at the end to decide a victor) the   liked ones were the ones with the least RNG and player choice. These games included hexa-gone and jump showdown. These were matches of skill and you only had yourself to blame if you lost. Since the game's release we've had rampant game deciding bugs and hacking for a long time. It took way too long for the hacking issue to be sorted in a game this popular but worse yet 'major' content drops will only be coming at the end of the season. We still have several of the terrible bugs still in play, names are still disabled since there was no safeguard in altering the name's color & size, and the servers keep exploding. If you were to fix all these issues then it'd be playable but there have been dumb changes or accidental problems that make the game take away control from the player's hand like some jump inputs not registering and randomly falling for no reason. There has been time to fix the game and make monumental differences but after the devs trying to address the problems by responding to them then purposefully ignoring the biggest problems it makes it clear that before adding more ongoing constant content it'll take them ages to address the groundbreaking issues. In season 2 after a long season we got: -A new   dlc for 5 dollars -4 new maps -Random graphical changes that make the map worse for the colorblind and seems to be viewed as worse than the originals -A new mode sort of The new mode focuses on removing the thing people ask since day one. Team modes. This was my favorite part of the update but was quickly ruined by the most questionable choice.  . This has been brought up over and over again but why not make it the mode people like most or even have all of them have the same chance?  I could go on and on with this but although it seems good the devs here are out for money and have little care for the experience. I was taken aback when I noticed the most interesting and worked on skins showcased in their videos would be dlc only. I've won 12 matches and at least each finale once and as others said it gets   especially when you've won them all.  .

Short and disappointingly shallow, with a cool art style. Let me start by saying the controls are absolutely awful. You use A and D for moving, and F to attack or interact with objects. It's such a mindblowing thoughtless choice of key bindings that has you press both D and F in short sequences. The other controls use, Q, E and S, no idea why they couldn't just spread them around. And of course there is no way to rebind them. Some sections have you manually aim, which felt very awkward and unsatisfying. While I was not able to get use to the awkward controls scheme, the game is not very mechanically demanding, so you can get by. But then the issues with the core gameplay loop come to the foreground: Initially Haimrik seemed to be a puzzle like game, where you would have to figure out which of the words on the screen can help you solve a problem. Unfortunately, the puzzle solutions are extremely obvious and in fact, the sentences that contain the words often tell you the solution step by step. What's worse is that the "puzzles" often repeat themes, so you will be using the same words over and over again in pretty much the same way. The only positive about the game is the visual style, which delivers as promised. The game is also very short, about 3-4 hours. A short, but very unsatisfying mix of puzzle like game with words, with a bit of mechanical execution required, such as shooting and platforming. None of those elements have any depth to them, and the game ends up being very shallow and boring.  If you are still drawn to the art style I suggest waiting for a sale.

This game is overpriced. I'll tell you the positive and negative sides :) -------------------------------------------------- POSITIVE: -You can have a lot of fun in this game solo or with friends. -On the early access you could earn more money than the game price. -There is FPP and TPP. -There is not only one single map. There is 2 maps. -There is voice chat so that you can communicate with your Teamates. -There is cool skins which you can get every week if you are playing enough to get BP (Battle Points). NEGATIVE: -The game is really bad optimized -It has ridiculous mechanics -Spectating mode has many bugs -A lot of hackers (70% of games im killed by hackers). -Really high price. -Bad graphics for 2017 game.(GTA V has better graphics[2013]) -A lot of bugs and glitches. -There is hardly any loot on the second map. -There is server lag almost every game. -------------------------------------------------- After 400 hours on this game I can say that I do NOT recommend it! It's not worth the money. Thanks for reading!  I hope this review will help you to decide on buying or not :)

I would like to start off by saying this game has a lot of potential, and I really enjoy the concept of it. I will still play it, even though i do not recommend it. This game has some really fun ideas, and the game seemed to go somewhere decent a while back, but I think it is finished. There are so many broken things in this game on both sides. Some killers are just strait up OP compared to the rest of the competition. while those killers stay on top, the other parts of the killers keep getting nerfed to the ground. Even the stronger killers of the game will get nerfed, but not the OP ones that need something changed. On the other spectrum, there are combinations that make some killers rediculous (Huntress with iri-head infantry belt combo (gives her 3 insta-down hatchets)), but BHVR refuses to changes any of that. There are things you can bring into the game that give huge advantages. survivors can bring keys that make it so much easier to escape, and killers can bring moris to only need 1 out of the 3 hooks to kill you. after years of people complaining about it on the forums, no changes have been made to them. but pig needs that nerf i guess. Organized SWF 4 man groups are the definition of a 1 sided game. the only way you have a chance of winning is if they are the kind that focus on keeping everyone alive and you just sit at the hooked survivor. otherwise, good luck getting at least 1 kill. The community in this game has some great people. while not the majority, the toxic people are the LOUDEST of any community i've ever seen. They ruin the fun of the game for anyone else while complaining that their side is completely underpowered and justified to what they do. And, right as of now, the people making the final decisions of the game have never shown this much bias towards the whales of the game. In their biggest event of the year, they have decided that all skins must be purchased. Even last year, you were able to earn a currency to get 2 skins of your choice if you played enough, but now you MUST pay. While they are giving log in rewards as of this moment (until sometime at the start of november 2020), this doesnt fix the fact that we are not getting an event this year, because they have evolved from being inept decision makers to inept and greedy decision makers. While I hope this game eventually gets people who know how to run their game (and maybe play it more than once to test out the next patch), This game is something that you should stick away from. If you really want to play through the toxic community and bugs that plague the game from the beginning, then only purchase the game and don't buy anything else. it is not worth it. as of me writing, the developers do not deserve the money from other people.
If you love all the other Flatout games... DO NOT BUY FLATOUT 3!

This game needs refreshing, it has been out for long enough now for a new Cities Skylines 2 version, forget about the new DLCs I'm afraid. It's time that this game requires a new engine - with better optimization. It is far too laggy because the engine fails to utilise the CPU fully so no matter how beefy your computer is and eventually you'll drop to around low 20 FPS average.  Sorry but this game is far too coloured and childish. In real life you wouldn't see pink or blue buildings etc. Yes I know there are mods and assets but I'm not going to add extra lag in addition to my already lacklustre FPS. Also ''Cities skylines'' the title says itself - it seems as though there is only a max height of like 20 story buildings? Also, buildings get repetitive and boring and it doesn't look like a "city skyline" as the title had proclaimed itself. They need more variation.  Yea yea yea, I'm going to receive backlash and most of my responses will be ''Oh, just get mods and assets and stop whining.'' Well that's your opinion and I'm not going to stop that however most of the responsibility lies on the developers of CO in the first place, no time for more DLCs. It's time for a new game altogether.

Build insane, fully customisable robot battle vehicles that drive, hover, walk and fly in the free-to-play action game Robocraft. Add weapons from the future and jump in the driving seat as you take your creation into battle against others online!  BUILD - Combine blocks in an easy-to-use editor interface to create a futuristic robot battle vehicle armed with dozens of different weapon options.  DRIVE - Jump into the pilot seat and test out your robot design against AI. Jet cars, tanks, flying warships, helicopters, drones; almost any vehicle is possible in Robocraft!  FIGHT - Battle online in vast battlefields against players from all over the world on dedicated servers.  ADDITIONAL FEATURES  Over 250 cubes and growing! Be part of a constantly changing metagame with new weapons, components and features added every month  Watch as enemy robots break apart cube by cube as you destroy them with powerful weaponry which players can switch between at their leisure  Form Parties and battle on the same team with your friends  Create or join Clans of up to 50 players  Share your robotic creations with other players online via the Community Robot Factory Robocraft is currently in the Open Alpha stage of development and is available for everyone to play. For more information about the game, please visit

Hello there; Without a doubt Blood is one of the BEST FPS ever. But we all know that.  What I am reviewing here today, is not Blood itself. It is Blood FS (Fresh Supply). It is its first day on the market, so these issues may change. I will change my review as the game updates. The source code for Blood was never released. All that exists is a leaked 0.96 alpha source code, which has been used to reverse engineer these fan ports. FS is not a sourceport. No port for Blood is a sourceport, sadly. FS uses the Kex engine to emulate Blood. GDX ported the Build engine to Java and runs off the leaked alpha source code. Nblood uses the Build engine and reversed engineered 1.21 debug code. These are the difference between the ports at a base level.  What I will be reviewing is FS's capabilities, its pro and cons, and how it compares to Fan ports like Nblood and GDX. I have played Blood to my heartâ€™s desire for the past two years now in DOSbox, Nblood, and GDX. I beat it for the first time on normal (Lightly broiled) is DOSBox, then Well-done on GDX. Nblood I have played often; and used it to beat a heavily surreal and fascinating fan mappack called Deathwish. I have even made a map for Blood. I know Blood very well; so playing this port, surprisingly feels new. I will illustrate the difference between FS and the other ports briefly.  First off, yes it works fine and runs at high FPS if you wish it too. It is obviously superior to DOSbox, but that's like comparing an ant to an elephant. I will be comparing FS to fanports keep in mind, and not DOSBox. Why? Because why would anyone pay ten bucks for an inferior version of a game, you could get better elsewhere? Differences which are both good and bad: The new renderer looks amazing and is very colorful. However, it is a huge stray-away from the original Blood colors. If you want some new looks, this is good. If you prefer the OG colors, (Which I do), it will be a heavy problem. The Proâ€™s FS has: Revamped music. It works. It is good publicity for Blood, which for sure needs more attention. Improved AI, monsters instead of bumping into walls now chase after you and are more aggressive. (Easily the best improvement).  New Voxel sprites. Supports direct x and other 3d renderers. New Netcode for multiplayer Some cons; here are the major issues first: Changing settings in display options creates a black screen and forces an FS restart. No software renderer, it contains only palate emulation. (hence the polar opinion on the colors). FS comes with Bloodâ€™s files, but not all of them. So, if you wanna do some modding or mapediting; itâ€™ll very difficult. You may have to go to some websites and download those programs yourself. It does not come with all the original Blood files.  Limited modding capabilities Nitpick Cons and glitches: Booting up Cryptic Passage requires exiting and re-entering (which in GDX CP is natively supported). Not being able to make the hud bigger or lesser with - and +  Everything looks wonky using mouse aim, even without 3D aim on, everything is more warped than usual for a Build engine game. The end screen for levels having the same resolution as DosBox instead of being wide-screen. Changing between CD music and MIDI requires restarting the level Thatâ€™s all so far. Blood is an amazing game for sure. FS is close to doing it some justice. I have other issues but they are more personal and most players wonâ€™t care for. For example, the console takes up 2/3â€™s of the screen! That nitpick is far too nitpicky to be an issue! FS has a lot of these small nitpicks, but the ones listed do add up. FS as it stands on day one release, is on-par with Nblood and GDX. It is not superior to these FAN ports, nor is it less. Is it worth ten bucks? Iâ€™d say no; for now. Once the nitpick cons are fixed, the glitches in settings patched, and you have the option of owning all of Bloodâ€™s OG files, then yes, for sure, ten bucks is well worth it. I have faith that Nightdive will fix these issues. Wait another few weeks, and if they are fixed, buy it. As for now, best to stick with fanports. I will give FS a thumb up when it becomes better than the fan ports and is fixed. I must review it based on the current product. I really do hope that it becomes a Thumbs up in my book very soon....

I really want to like this DLC, I really do, but I just can't bring myself to. I'll admit I was a bit rusty at the beginning--almost everyone would, unless they were grinding the base game all this time for God knows what reason--, so take my complaints with a grain of "just git gud lmao" The main problems stem from the fact id has either forgotten how to design good arenas or the DLC not having been developed by the main team. I can't find a good reason how could they think "Hey, let's drop an archvile, three carcasses, a couple of mancubi and some other â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ inside a narrow corridor" and come to a conclusion that is a good idea. But I wish that was the main problem. There is also a matter of horrendously long fights, think 10 minutes long or shorter/longer depending on how good you're at focusing down targets that progress the fight. It wouldn't have probably been such a problem had the arenas not been so small. I can't tell you the exact number of times I made a wrong turn inside an arena and stumbled on 5 or so stacked demons who not only bodyblock you, but were also bodyblocking themselves from reaching you. The arenas in the first two levels (barring a couple of exceptions) are just not designed to accomodate large numbers of demons, but designers still say â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ it and have you deal with them. I can only really commend the last level, it had WELL DESIGNED fights, large enough arenas and mostly felt like a level from the base campaign. The music is bland, which was to be expected after Gordon's departure. Once again, I really want to say I liked it, but the tracks were so forgetable, I can barely remember a single one and the one I do remember is ambient. Oh, did I say each level has only 1 combat track and it just plays on loop the entire time? Good stuff. I'm not sure how much time did Levy and Hulshult have, so it could be a time issue, but I still feel like had Gordon still been around, he would've written more than than, not even mentioning the quality of his work. The story, ignoring the fact they continue butchering 2016's lore, is reaching cringe levels that should not be possible. Whoever thought that adding a geeky nerd as a medium between the doomguy's inner thoughts and the player is clearly insane. When you had Hayden/VEGA tell you to do stuff, it made much more sense than when some INTERN says stuff out loud that is obvious even without him saying it. The best example was when Hayden transfers himself into Seraph--you clearly understand that Hayden is Seraph--and the first thing you hear in the next cutscene is "HEY DID YOU KNOW HAYDEN IS A SERAPH, HE'S BEEN WITH US THE ENTIRE TIME". No â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥, dude. My expectations for part 2 are even lower than they were for part 1. I can only hope they'll do something about the combat loop. They nailed it perfectly in the base game and here combat just didn't feel fun until I reached the last level.

It's honestly severely overrated. The focus on melee kills via chainsaw, fists and flame-thrower make guns feel almost useless - coupled with the need to NOT kill things with guns - and instead reliance on closing in to finish with one of your hotkeys make the gun-play awful. Add to that some completely unneeded and unwanted platforming make this a real chore. Then you have the fact that the game stifles freedom by forcing you to use certain guns (with certain mods) against some enemies. Gone is the carefree way of giving you the tools and letting you play it your way, because if you don't follow Eternal's strict rules you are going to have trouble. Really disappointed after buying the game expecting a decent sequel to 2016. It isn't Doom anymore... something I thought I'd never say. RIP. - Jimbo Rating: 5/10 - being generous due to awesome sound and engine.

Still a bad game even today after a few years!! Vendetta - Curse of Raven's Cry is a RE-RELEASE of -Raven's Cry- which was so bad. Vendetta - Curse of Raven's Cry is a bit better but not with much, game stil crashes, runs between 22-40 frames not matter what settings you have. Vendetta has improved Voice Over with alot and Quests but animation of lip-sync is stil bad, combat is not great. If you want a better Pirate game just buy AC4 Black Flag. Over-all I can't recommend Vendetta, too expensive,not too much improvement, they could just patch Raven's Cry to this stage easily.

This game is for a really niche audience, that audience? Car boys who are angry that their parents took their Xbox and need to play a game to calm their angry because they've already punched through all the drywall in the house. And if that's good then aww jeez you're going to like this game. Buy buy it on sale, Â£9 for this? Too high, it should really be Â£3 - Â£4.Almost everyone else will find this game insanely boring and annoying. You're just a small car on a race track going broom broom but hey, some people like that. My experience? I played 11 minutes, got board and then left the game running for 2 hours 30 mins, put on my speaker and cleaned my room because the soundtrack is AMAZING and works great as background music.Overall thoughts:0 / 10 game10 / 10 room cleaning background music.

Game has potential and I'll still play it since the game is fun, and the mechanics of the game are already fantastic compared to other games, but with the metric ton of cash they have, it needs to go into fixing the game before content. Server has lag issues and minimum requirements isn't quite as accurate. Microtransactions are unnecessary due to the sheer amount of sales that this game has, but are fine anyway as long as they do not affect gameplay. The cosmetics found in the crates aren't exactly the greatest looking, and you won't spend much time looking at them anyway since you'll be doing 360s attempting to scan the area. The RNG element is a little too strong. *65% of games you will have full level 1 for the first 10 minutes of the game with sparse meds and a red dot on an m16. 5% of games you have an 8x on a kar98k + full attachments + suppressor on SCAR-L or M416 with level 2/3 and too many meds to carry. Other times you have the inbetween. This is even worse in squad gameplay. Final Verdict: Save your money and watch how things play out. The game is currently fun, but can be frustrating if you have a less-than-average connection or computer, and even with neither may still have issues.

Well, what to say. The only thing I really found appealing about this game was some of the music. However, the writing and the story, it's just bad. Half of the time you can't make sense of what the characters are trying to say. I think The Agony had a good amount of potential if it wasn't written so awkwardly. The game features strong sexual themes and violence. The choices do matter, leading you down multiple paths. Unfortunately, I couldn't get into it. The writing was just too bad. PUBG is great in it's core, poor in execution. I still enjoy playing it but the frustration is getting on me quite more often. I like the graphic, I kinda like the various gunplay - the immersion getting close up to TOP 10 and fighting over a slimmer of  safe zone BUT the issues considering technical state of the game with various glitches, bugs, micro stutters, cheaters (no recoil), no-region lock, still a bit poor optimalization (to be honest, its vastly improved than it used to be), netcode etc. is far greater threat to anybody who wants to have a good time in this game. Thats kinda reason why I have so little hours in = I play more periodically, still in wait for new content and needed repairs. What is really grinding my gears is the FIX PUBG pledge while watching devs adding more and more pricy skins into the game. The state of the PUBG is invoking massive playerbase drops. On monthly game bleads off a lot of players. Well, nothing what a new skin wouldn't solve, right? RIGHT? ++ General gameplay ++ Real fun with premade group of friends + Addictive battle-royale genre + Guns and feeling of them. Plenty of addons for them. + Moments of pure enjoyment while is everything going just right + Graphic - Matchmaking that puts you literally around the world (no region lock?) - fun to play with someone who don't speak english or being forced to endure high ping of you/enemies - FIX PUBG pledge is a joke so far - more like "lets push skins, make more money" - In-game report system can get you temporarily banned if enough people report you, just for giggles. Shooting a streamer is downright felony in this mess of a game and could EASILY get you prosecuted as a stream sniper. - Occasional cheaters in game. Being sometimes shot through the wall with zero recoil or first shot headshot at 800m is fun for the whole family. - Gambling lootcrates. This â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ is always fun and not inherently wrong at all. - Pushing e-sports tournaments on playerbase to watch seems almost offensive with the whole negatives left and right. -- No region lock. -- The greed of devs is seriously astonishing. Skins is the new patch. --- Technical state of the game.  4/10

When I heard about an Alesso Heist through a Twitter leak, I thought it was another practical joke from Overkill. But when addressing serious matters Overkill jokes, and when joking around, it turns out theyâ€™re serious. The John Wick pack was free of charge, and the Hotline Miami heist had good gameplay, good content, and wasnâ€™t egregious when it came to the cross-promotion. But the Alesso Heist isnâ€™t any of those. The heist itself is merely a one-day heist contracted by Bain (who else?), who constantly gives the celebrity of the hour enough shilling to qualify himself as a paid billboard. Alesso signs everywhere, product-placement for the musician all around and nothing but praise is given to Alesso when any serious heister would be apathetic at best. But letâ€™s assume it wasnâ€™t a commercial in disguise. The layout can be confusing for newer players due to the deceptive nature of the passage ways, never mind the dead-brained AI heisters who constantly get lost. To complete the heist, one must go behind the shops, go to the basement, then to the highest floor to hijack the concert (guided by an insufferable jive turkey), back down to the basement to extract the loot, then back up to secure it. In an undercover run one has to avoid detection in open and windy corridors while in a firefight navigating through the labyrinth whilst fighting the heavily armed enemies. Thereâ€™s barely enough time to get from A to B without keeping these factors in check. Preplanning is absent. While this can be justified being a Bain job rather than The Dentist hosting the mission, the map is so large that the random-numbers generation that places the assets available is unfavorable. Not to mention the complete lack of spotters or spy cameras which would be useful for someone stealthing for the first time. The weapons included arenâ€™t much to speak of. As usual the melee weapons are filler and often outclassed by others before them. The revolver sticks out due to being compatible with laser sights, but is otherwise completely forgettable. The Bronco usually serves better in its league anyway. Letâ€™s find the positives in this DLC. Obviously the weapons provided make it theoretically higher in value than The Diamond, another controversial heist that lacked any weapons whatsoever. Bag-hauling has been circumvented slightly thanks to the chutes connected between the basements and the shops above it, in addition to the zipline deployed in a loud mission. The music, orchestrated by Alesso rather than Simon Viklund, is also enjoyable. The music itself cannot be adjusted and is synchronized with much of the gameplay (more so than usual that is). Sadly thatâ€™s not enough for me to declare this as the worst DLC-mission so far, more than The Diamond. At least The Diamond was enjoyable to play without friends, and had a more substantial payout. Those who are complacent in accessing every heist available should only buy this on sale, and not before obtaining everything else.

So, Ich habe das Spiel jetzt lange genug gespielt um auch mal meine Meinung abzugeben. Als "fast" reiner COD Spieler habe ich mich auch vorm Release natÃ¼rlich auf BO3 gefreut, auch wenn es "Zukunft sein Vater" werden wÃ¼rde. Nach der damaligen Beta war ich echt gut gehyped vorallem weil die Beta schon echt gebockt hatte. Aber was ich dann bei Release mit meinen roten jÃ¤mmerlichen Augen sehen musste ist nicht in Worte zu fassen. Es ist mit Abstand eines der schlechtesten COD's die es jemals gegeben hat oder in Zukunft geben wird. Dieses Spiel ist am besten mit einem wahrhaftigen Griff ins Klo zu vergleichen. Die Story war wie in fast jedem COD lieblos hingerotzt worden (abgesehen von allen MW Teilen, Bo1 und WaW) ,dass einzige Plus war das man als Vierer Truppe spielen konnte.  Das auch wieder EIN riesen Haufen an Updates nÃ¶tig war um das Spiel auch wirklich ohne Bugs und vorallem bei jedem User zum laufen zu bringen war auch wieder typisch, weil ja nach BO2(dem letzten PC angepassten COD) auf die PC Performance und vorallem die PC Community geschissen wird. Das Komplette Zukunftding war auch einfach nicht stimmig, das wurde zum Beispiel bei Infinite Warfare tausendmal besser umgesetzt. Nur Zukunft ist fÃ¼r mich und auch fÃ¼r viele andere die seit Jahren COD zocken einfach keine Option fÃ¼r ein gutes COD. Man braucht nicht viel nur ein paar coole Waffen(keine Zukunftplasmalaserkanone was weis ich..), ein paar Prestigelevel, ein paar coole Maps, "GUTE" Server und das wars.  Abgesehen davon ist auch in BO3 das Waffenbalancing komplett nicht zu finden auÃŸer man empfindet es als normal wenn man mit einer Shotgun genau so weit schieÃŸt wie mit einem Sturmgewehr. Aber was dem ganzen Spiel noch die Krone aufsetzt sind die Spezialisten. Also wer sich diesen kompletten Mist ausgedacht hat, dem ist nicht mehr zu helfen. Zum Zombi Modus kann ich nun nichts sagen da ich absolut kein Zombiefan bin und den Modus nichtmal angerÃ¼hrt habe. Es bleibt einfach nur zu hoffen das WW2 das Ruder wieder rum reiÃŸt und vorallem auch die PC Fassung spielbar ist und es sicht nicht wieder anfÃ¼hlt als ob man eine EA Version von der PS4 Version spielt. Ich rate euch am Ende meiner kleinen Meinungskunttuhung die 60â‚¬ oder wie viel das Spiel auch immer momentan jetzt kostet lieber anders zu investieren. Peace!

First of all it's important to make clear that this game is episodic. So far two of them. Five dollars each on Steam. That's something that's not actually clear in the store page. Then, to the game. I played the first Episode/chapter. The gameplay consists on observing a scene and selecting the correct from two to four choices. If you accumulate wrong answers you "die". All the correct answers are pretty straightforward if you take five seconds to examine the current scene. There are no actual puzzles. The closest thing to it are two electrical circuits you have to complete for an elevator and a tram to work. Those are really straightforward too. There is no actual challenge about the game, which leaves it as a an interactive -interesting enough- story. Visuals are good, something to expect when UE4 is involved, but there are other similar titles like The Vanishing of.... that are way better, both visual and gamrplay-wise.  I'm adittion, it suffers from serious performance and optimization issues, with stutters and locks like hell. They did manage to transmit an abandonment-sinister atmosphere to the facility. There are achievements, but you are required to do some cumbersome workaround to get one of them.

This game is slowly dieing and it produces the smallest and most sadest updates I have ever seen, and yet they dont actually work , if anything cause more bugs. It also dosent help when there is a very over-hyped community from a click-baiting youtuber that trys to show off game changing events that the developer trys to back up, but yet they never come out. Then this pushes some fanboy whiteknights of this youtuber to have to come out a leak it to the public. Another thing about the developers is that they have been working on this project for over 2 years now (asuming) and yet a game thats been in an alpha for 2 months can get more support and feedback then this game. Matter of fact I think modders put more game fixes then the devs do but then the modding community in this game sucks and 90% of the time the mod brakes more â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ then what its fixes so it becomes worthless. Now I do enjoy this game but its a risky price to pay for if you decide to buy this pothetic thing for a game. Sadly I am addicted to this game. PS, sorry if I had any spelling errors or grammer errors I guess i am handecapped when it comes to spelling. Ok so it has been some time from the last time i have played this game, and the game seems to be improving, but improving in the way that it is slowly dropping in the number of players, content/updates, and less public attention. The majority of the players that still attempt to enjoy this game dont even play the way the hole game is made to do. The Isle is a game where you are to survive as playable dinosaurus in a prehistoric world, not a game to have rules in servers to wear people are told how to play the game. Server owners and admins are the biggest downfall to this game. If the where just  open servers then most of the game would be to survive and hunt, but now server hosts like to add rules like No KOS, Only Chill/No Kill which make zero sense( dont carnivores need to eat to survive). The rules then end up starting harrasment between people on if they break the rules or not. In the end the rules add more negativity in this game then without them ( I mean come on now, who wants others to controll how you play). Another problem is people do stick to a more realistic style of the game, meaning they dont play the game on how it was ment to be played. Herbivores and Carnivores are like WWE in this â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ anymore cause all they do is tag team on discord to ruin the fun for others. And if its not herby kos it revenge killing ( or over exesive killing) meaning you are huntng way more then you need, but hunting is on you and tbh i am not trying to control how you play, I am just stating on how this game is played by others. Not to forget if you have any questions let me know in the comments dont shy and let me know how you think The Isle is going to be in the future or if you need any questions feel free to ask cause if I dont even respond i bet someone else will. I have over 2500 hours on my accounts in total on this game and I can tell you a thing or 2.
i have around 16 hrs on my other acc that i forgot the password to but damn this game is bad i dont care about graphics but the gameplay is super terrible dont waste your time

An absolutely dreadful experience, so much so that I quit this DLC mid way, something I rarely do, if ever.  Both of the DLCs are extremely buggy and broken, from cutscenes that make no sense at all, to sound bugs making conversations end abruptly or go silent. It is a botched mess.  The missions are basically a collection of tedious fetch quests and fort attacks that amount to nothing but the most boring repetitive chores.  Invade fort after fort, and you're done.  The way elysium is built in chapter one, is horrendous, they made the terrain extremely hard to navigate just to slow you down and give you the impression that the DLC is longer than it is. They do that but forcing you to climb and run endlessly. This expansion is downright insulting.  The Odyssey expansions are also blatant reskins of the Origins expansions, but much worse ones.  Which made it even more boring for someone like me who's played those.  It is everything the great base game isnt. After the base game leaving me wanting more, I played this and it ruined my memories of the base game and made me question if I even want to play another AC. It's that bad.  The worst, most boring most repetitive an AC game has to offer, packed into a DLC.  Stay away from this, or it'll hurt what you think of the whole franchise.

Man, am I glad I stayed within the 2 hour mark so I could refund this game. First off, I gotta say, I had been looking forward to the release of Overgrowth for a long time. For as far as I can remember, I found it about... Five, maybe six years ago, and really liked the look of it. Now, after pretty much forgetting about it, and seeing posts about it every now and then - it's finally out! But, it's far from worth the price. The mechanics and combat of the game are truly fun for an hour or two, but you can get bored really quickly. (In my opinion.)  The story mode is... Eh. That's honestly the best word I have for it. It tries to throw weird mythology about the bunny-people, dog-people and their Gods and whatnot, but all I could find myself thinking during the 'cutscenes' (which are pretty much almost just stills with a weird angle) was: "What the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ is this?" So, the first 10-20 minutes are pretty neat. Discovering the idea behind the game, and the mechanics of the combat system. This whole combat system immediately falls apart when you discover the bunny kick. You jump in the air, and launch both your bunny feet at the opponent. There's a chance this'll kill them in one go, and if it doesn't: Just do it again. No reason to use the other, now-clunky-looking combat options there are. I would not buy this game at the set price of 30 bucks, nor would I buy it at the promotion price of around 20 bucks. If you have some cash to spare, this might not be so bad- but after 9 years in development, this is what the team pushed out? This? No thank you.

I love the story and im glad it was made but the game should have been named pyrrhic victory. Total score 10/10, worst segments lower it down to like a 4/10 Cant recommend it for most honestly, i backburnered this game hard for a month or two from how much of a job it felt at times.

I saw this game getting a lot of attention and decided to try it out. I thought MAYBE it had some appeal that I couldn't see after watching some gameplay and reviews. I was wrong. It was exactly what I expected it to be. Technically the game worked. The graphics were decent (even though i went low for the competative edge), the mechanics worked. The problem isn't so much the game, as it's the concept. My first match went as expected, I made it to the mid 30s. 2nd Match 3rd place. 3rd nearly as well. Why did I do so well? Because I camped. I camped hard. I spent 95% of each match reading a book on my e-reader crouched in a windowless room in game. Fact is, I see it like this. I could either A) have fun and lose, or B) Camp till the last 5 and have a shot of winning. Neither option wholly appealed to me so I'm refunding.  I completely recommend this to any and all campers in any other FPS I play. This is your home. Go home.

Tout d'abord les efforts mis dans l'ecriture de ce review sont equivalentes aux efforts qu' Infinity Ward ont mis dans ce jeu. Graphiques nul a en perdre les yeux alors qu' Activision parlaient d'une amelioration c'est une une blague, c'est pire que MW3 . Multijoueurs plein de hackers qui disent que "l argent paye le Skill" (Ce qu'un enfant m'a dit). Impossible d'apparaitre sans mourir. Par contre les gens sont extremement nul quand ils ne hack pas c'est peut-etre pour cela que certains hack . Donc en gros ce jeux estde la merde, peut-etre si un jours Activision sort une patch qui pourrait retirer les hackers et ameliorer les graphiques le jeu pourrait etre moins pire. Le jeu est plein d'enfants qui chialent quand ils meurent et soufflent dans leurs micro comme d'habitude. Les cheats de COD Ghost sont trouvable partout . J'ai eu ce jeu gratuitement mais je demande un remboursement pour l'acheteur Activision ne merite pas cette argent. Je prefere le donner a un sans abris qu' a Activision . Le jeu est tout simplement decevant . N'achetez pas ce jeu limite achetez le si vous voulez voir a quel point c'est de la merde. Je ne payerais meme pas 5$ pour ce jeu, le jeu ne vaut pas 60$ .

Good Coregame Experience (Yep, there is potential)! I had fun playing through the storyline and the Combat System is satisfying (Played a Bowbuild, got to lvl66 and Champions to lvl 85 and still doing good). Encountered many bugs like Questenemies dropping of cliffs so they were unreachable and the mission could not be finished -> only hard exit with total loss of progression, enemies not spawning in with total loss of progression) ... and a lot more minor bugs that were not gamebreaking but annoying as f**k (like untargetable enemies). The endgame is EXTREMELY grindy ... a lot more (and slower) grind than PoE for example, with less progress and even less rewards and absolutely no goal. It really starts to get boring pretty quick since there is zero varity and only 5-6 maps. I can't image how to reach lvl 90 ... respect to those who made it, this is an insane grind with nearly zero reward doing so! In its current state i do not recommend this game by any means. If you can handle gamebreaking bugs during endgame progression and are a fan of insane repetitive grinds, you might give it a try since the price of the game is fair and there is potential but if you're looking for a long time game, i fear that in its actual state you won't get satisfied. I had fun for around 50hrs until now (but yet i'm frustrated :/ ) and that's a good amount compared for the price but i'm really looking forward for bugfixes and more endgame content since there is literally nothing to do in endgame :/ Edit: some typos fixed

Pros Good graphics a good recreation of the maplestory world into 3d player made items house building removal of fair fight Social systems and guilds the mounts are a little bit of fun CONS Unintresting and uninspiring quests, some might be but not alot are Destinyesuske Loot based system of unrewarding proportions Daily caps on almost everything not very good keyboard and mouse support skill varity is lacking comparitive to the last game no second or futher job advancements comparitive to last game level cap is far less than it was last time decreasing overall leveling frequencys Membership being less than worth it basic events guilds progression costing far too many mesos the grind for materials to upgrade weapons  the unrewarding randomisation of loot from high end dungions the dungeon "rewards" cap the devs the ever sinking player count Suggestions Remove all caps on everything make loot more rewarding for dungeons make the game less like destiny make better quests Final verdict while i will be occasionaly replaying and will rewrite the review as things change currently i can absoulutely not reccomend this game to anyone due to the massive changes from the last game and due to it not really having much stregnth to stand on its own even seen as a standalone mmorpg due to its various tendancys to try to follow the mmoprger market. Final score: 2.5/10, whenever its fun its a 5/10

Game will not start in fullscreen mode. Checked the discussion section and most people are having this exact issue.  Good thing is that there is a workaround that seems to work for some. You need to set the exe file of the game compatible with Windows XP via properties. Ok good, I got the game running but now I ran into issues with the game not recognizing gamepad input...per the discussion section there isn't a straightforward solution to this. Worst of all, the developer openly admits these issues but has stated that the game is no longer supported and no fixes will be provided because of the older game engine. At that point, why not remove this from the Steam store instead of trying to cash in on a completely broken game?

Logistics are a complete mess. Management games are supposed to be organized, clean and practical. In Good Company, you need to manually create lines between different stations with just dragging lines. Imagine running a +100 stations factory and lines everywhere, products, modules. No no no. That being said, game looks beautiful, friendly interface and easy to understand. Nothing too relevant though, just another management game with some tweaks. Looks like it could have a lot of success on smartphones and tablets since you could do everything with touchscreen.

As much as I wanted to recommend this game, sadly I couldn't. Here's why: - Controls are clunky as s*** and trying to steer is really annoying, reverse steering even more so. It's only when you get the Geotech wheels (the yellow blocks) that it becomes nicer to manage - Before you get nicer wheels, you have to go ALL the way round the trader with a stiff a** vehicle and right click on a tiny screen to open the shop up. Have fun with something that takes longer than the Lord of the Rings Trilogy to do! - Camera has the annoying spring regardless of the setting you put it on. So stiff and clunky to manoeuvre - You can get stuck REALLY easily and die some cheap deaths because they're so terrible to drive uphill - Speaking of death, enjoy the lousy presets you have once you die, salvaging your old self is costly and there's no option to save up and buy back, you have to choose on the spot if you can afford your custom made back or not. You CAN salvage your old self back but it's not always easy to do so - Sure when you get the yellow blocks you can start pubstomping those who get in your way but before that you gotta avoid hitting up on others unless you got a ton of guns/blocks. Or they're just blind. - The combat music plays even IF other players aren't firing at you.  - Oh and the icing on the cake?  . Have fun not being able to see a f****** thing at all! Seriously one of the most frustrating games I've EVER played. It *can* be fun when you beat that boss or get a mission done with a few seconds left on the clock, but that last bug on top of ALL the frustration I endured to get the yellow blocks: yeah no thanks. I don't feel like dealing with "get gud" fanboys so I'm denying you your voice, go cry on another negative comment. :P

Could have been something fun and entertaining but too many of the holes rely on some gimmick and a hefty does of luck to get through them. You'll start at so many holes with no idea what you're supposed to do or even where the flag is. There should be a fly-over that gives you a general idea of how to play the hole, but there isn't one. You can customize your ball, which is fun, but the customize screen just shows a bunch of locked options with no hint on how to open them, so that's pure luck too. The pirate and the haunted house course were the most fun, some of the others were just ok, and ones like the space station are just absolute garbage. Too many NOPE courses and holes for any sort of positive recommend.

Let's face it, no one likes losing. Even sat at traffic lights in your car, you never want the car who pulls up next to you to beat you off the line. Battlegrounds is a game that has found meteoric success over the last few months attracting millions of bloodthirsty players ready to fight to the death, but not all of them want to play by the rules. Depending on who you ask PUBG either has a serious hacking problem that affects every game or cheaters are barely noticeable, rare unicorns witnessed every one hundred games or so. Whichever side of the fence you sit on, PUBG has banned roughly tens of thousands of hackers in the last three months, so they're certainly out there. You may very well have played with a hacker, but the truth is you'd never know it, if the hacker slowly stalked you using ESP, an ability that grants the cheater extra sensory perception of your location at all times. You'd just think you were unlucky. You can't win every game after all. Hacking communities are notoriously secretive and for obvious reasons, but this often leaves their motives shrouded in stereotypes. Common opinion paints them as vindictive children with too much time on their hands and a penchant for mischief, but surely they can't all be like that? Some of these hacks aren't cheap.  So back to the game.... FPP or TPP? My opinion on FPP vs. TPP: First off I prefer FPP over TPP. When it comes to watching I prefer, to watch FPP. The reason being is gameplay is more exciting. You can play more aggressively, higher kill games are more common. Gun skill becomes more a factor. People have to take risk to gain information in FPP, you can't just sit behind your cover and see everything that is happening around you. You have to understand when to peek, what directions to be watching. You can snowball fights, If I engage someone in FPP and damage them heavily, they either have to turn to fight me, or retreat to cover. If they retreat to cover theyâ€™re now blind to my movements, I can flank them, reposition and attack them from another angle. The enemy player after being caught off guard, or losing the initial engagement has to understand where I can move on him. He either needs to predict my movements, or take a risk to gain information by peeking, and then responding accordingly. If that same scenario happens in TP, as soon as the guy gets to cover he is safe. He can med, he can see all my movements, I can't push him. It becomes a stalemate. Whoever moves first more often than not will die in this situation. Gameplay is slowed down, and aggression is halted. There's way more action in FPP that's why I prefer watching it. There's a ton of game sense that comes into play in first. Since you don't have some camera floating up behind your character, with a super wide FOV. When it comes to what one is more skilled, both require a large amount of skill to do really well in at the highest level. At the end of the day when it comes to the more skilled mode, I have to give it to FPP though.

This game may be a classic WW2 game which would technically belong to the category of similar games, such as Cod Waw etc. The graphics are decent and there is action in the Campaign. I simply didn't like this game because to me it didn't feel like some perspectives of the game. It didn't fulfill the expectations I usually have on any WW2 game. Then again, it has some good moments. I only recommend to consider the purchase of Hell's Highway.

Another one of those game that "automatically" gets a "NOT RECOMMENDED" mainly due to DLC/s tied to achievement/s. Been holding off my "not reco" review, but, as they say nothing is forever! Really this is an OK game and one that I regularly play and use for brain workout. PROS: Nice graphics, music, and ok sound effects. Puzzles difficulty from easy to sometime make you really think. Has daily challenge - good for daily brain exercise. Supports different control inputs. Has trading cards CONS: Has achievements. (required DLCs for achievements - a PRO turned to CON) Daily Death puzzles repeats. Annoying in-game ads.

Forsaken gave me hope that Destiny 2 would finally achieve the greatness that Destiny 1 was after it's last DLC. Even more so, when Bungie finally split with Activision which made me think at first that everything is going to be great from now on. I thought Shadowkeep was not just going to be a good DLC, but also a positive turning point for the series so I immediately bought the entire Season Pass bundle. But sadly Destiny has disappointed me much more than it has positively surprised me The new Seasons just suck. The new "content" isn't content, let alone new content. You basically are just playing old stuff to earn old stuff with a few new things mixed in. Season Passes should ATLEAST come with a Strike, Crucible Map and a Gambit Map. Even that is such a bare minimum but instead we get to grind Bounties which is definitely the type of grind I've been always looking for. The "new content" is either just a new horde mode or gear that they recycled from Destiny 1 and if they add actual new gear that also looks cool, it almost always is something from the Eververse. Taking for example with Shadowkeep's launch. We have the launch of a new raid: Garden of Salvation. A Garden Vex based raid that has us fighting our way through the mysterious black garden from D1. Within it we get a RESKINNED set of armour, a new exotic weapon quest, some kinetic and energy weapons and god â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ forbid why there is no heavy weapons is beyond me. A very below average loot pool I would say for a newly released expansion raid. However, there is no ship, no sparrow and no ghost within this raid. Except what should be considered the ship and sparrow for this raid is locked behind the premium tier of the season pass. And a Vex Harpy Ghost shell "Harper's Shell" can be purchased from EVERVERSE. Why wasn't any of this moved to help fill the absence of loot in a end game activity. Honestly there needs to be some kind of respect put towards these cosmetics Bungie. If you are designing something that is themed to a certain activity or season, don't hide it behind a Eververse paywall and actually put it down as a earnable reward in activites. It shows that we have gone and earned them through either a loot drop in a end game activity or like you've done before, certain high tier triumphs so as they are not as rng loot dependant. Why not have the Thorn ornament as a reward for solo flawless, creates a sense of..........pride and accomplishment for doing so, rather then just an emblem. Before finishing this review I quickly just want to point out a few other things -Surprisingly small Trials pool with the armor being yet another reskin. -No ritual weapons. -Quite a lot of hackers -More error codes than you could humanly count -Still no vendor refresh. -This season is a bounty simulator, again. -Strikes are STILL useless after YEARS of feedback. -Another season without a raid with no word of how often we can expect them or even when we can expect the next one. -Eververse seems to get the most attention. Looks like the only balance bungie really cares about is the one for my bank account. -Just the general amount and quality of content is lacking. It honestly feels like Destiny 2 has been in a slow decline since they parted ways with Activision, because at that time they got someone to put pressure on them to make actual content. Wether the content was good or not, it was still content and not hours of Bounty grinding, which doesn't mean that I want them back because the Eververse is already bad enough. Edit: The new event "Guardian Games" is about deciding which Class is the best one, not by doing challenges that take skill and would be fun, but by boring bounty grinding. Bungie is really putting a hell lot of effort into these huh ?

I got this on a bundle and gave it a try. It was worse than I was expecting. It's totally horible game, and not even worth of one dollar(if it will be on sale).

Just putting random references all over your game doesn't make it funny. There is some nice art here and there but not enough to stomach going through all the forced attempts at comedy. Devs come off as folk who fancy themselves a lot more clever than they actually are. They had a decent concept with the kid's imaginary world + noir film aesthetics but this kitchen sink approach of cramming the game with random lame attempts at humor and unrelated references galore just ruins the pace not to mention your character moves slower than molasses. A lot of P&C just let you 'teleport' to where you click. Making you wait for your character to baby step all over the place is just another reason to give this game a hard pass. I find it ironic how Fallout is a parody of Capitalism but then they indulge in â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ like creation club.# Lets get down to the game and not this silly update though. The game at heart is good; great gameplay, alright graphics (not great but ok), good crafting system. The only thing that let's this game down is writing if we don't take previous games into account. However, if we do look at previous games this game looks like the grey sheep (black sheep is Fallout 3), restricting character """"creation"""" (you play Nate or Nora just like how you can only play Shepard in Mass Effect) and the new leveling system is tolerable at best but compared to the originals or New Vegas it's bad.  That's not mentioning this new Creation Club which downloads all mods taking up space even when you haven't forked over your cash. The audacity of Bethesda adding Micro-Transactions to an RPG is insulting.~ I'd get the game if you are able to tolerate this new update but i'd wait until a sale.~ EDIT: It's actually on sale right now 50% off which is pretty good if you ask me

The idea for Cannibal Crossing is pretty forthcoming: another zombie apocalypse scavenge-and-base-building survival game. The reality of it, at present, is that its generally good "game feel" is buried underneath an unholy mire of bugginess. In the first hour of play I experienced the following: And presumably not a bug (although I honestly can't be sure!), but a point of criticism:   I don't care if it needs to be a skill, a pickup, filled out as you explore the map, whatever, but   is a repeating tileset of asphalt and dirt roads, trees, stumps, and the same handful of buildings repeated over and over which shuffles each time you die. It's impossible to keep your bearings for any real length of time. It's by the team who've made Death Road to Canada the rousing success that it is so I have reasonable faith in them, but for the time being I would not under any circumstances recommend this based on my experiences and say maybe go check out Cataclysm: DDA if you wouldn't mind a game like this in a more traditional turn-based roguelike wrapper.

This tower defence game is fun in parts but i cannot recommend it. More advanced towers should come to you as you naturally progress through the game and not by some random card drop.  If you don't have the right cards for the level it becomes increasingly difficult to proceed as the enemies level with you through out the game. You will then have to farm the right card drops for the job, its a mechanic of the game that adds unnecessary grinding, unless you are really lucky and get the right cards for each and every level first time.

To be honest its not a bad game... BUT, its not exactly a "fun" game either.  For the price they are charging for this... well, take a look... Its a now very dated 2008 game that has brought little more to the party except interesting physics.  At the time of me posting this the game is on sale for 20 bucks... for that price I could buy about 4 other games that are just as good, if not better.  Hell I have played better looking and more fun games on my phone... FOR FREE! If its on sale in future for 5, sure its worth a punt... but full price or even on sale for 20... no way!

Too many modders on GTA online and nothing has ever been done about it. P2P sessions instead of servers on a huge game like GTA..ridiculous. Constantly having to change session because modders either force kick you so you go back to GTA 5 which then  takes 10 minutes to get back online again or they remove you from your vehicle or put your character in a box, spaceship or other item (and the only way to remove it is to start the game again) or remove you as a CEO for 20 minutes or constantly explode stuff around you or kill everyone in the session using your name (so everyone thinks you are the cheater!) And the mod menus they use detect when you report them as a cheat and block it and force kick you from the game. And they wonder why the PC version isnt as popular anymore as the console versions.. except for the many modders who dont even have R* accounts

It was an alright heist overall but far too short for the 7 dollar price tag. If anything, just get the Weapon Color Pack 2 instead. Far cheaper, and is basically a collection of skins you can use on all of your weapons. I really want to support Overkill on this one, but when the DLC is the same price overall as the main game, it just isn't worth it.

I refunded. I won't play through the entire intro/tutorial again, super tedious (not bad, but just annoying and takes a while). You get bombed with informations, every single inventory page is explained, but what you forget to tell us, is that this game DOES NOT auto-save? Just fyi dear Devs, theres nothing more annoying in survival/crafting games, then losing your whole progress.

Only a couple hours in but it seems like either: 1) they didn't understand what made DOOM 2016 so great, or 2) they over simplified everything on purpose to appeal to a wider/younger audience. Either way it's a pretty bad follow up to 2016 masterpiece. The reasons are (already) countless: busy and messy controls, terrible UI, overdeveloped story lore, random narrative exposure, immersion breaking stuff everywhere (the worst being teleported to the virtual arena to test new weapons). It's basically an arcade version of 2016. I'll keep playing but it's hard to recover from a bad first impression.
Typical MatchMaking you can expect in Australia.
